お安いプランで朝食付きで取れたので行ってみました。出来たばかりなので綺麗です。まあ本当にホテルばかりが立ち並ぶエリアにあります。チェックインは自分でタッチパネルで入力し、キャッシュレスで精算します。タッチパネルが三台しかないので、繁盛期は並ぶかも。ロビーは広々、ソファもあり、色々な調度品もあります。奥に隠し扉があり、トイレや自販機があります。イリィのコーヒーマシンがありフリーです。ルームウェアや髭剃りはアメニティコーナーがあり自分で持っていきます。あまりチェックイン時に説明はありませんでしたが、最近このパターンが増えたので慣れました。お部屋は最上階でしたが、窓の向こうは隣のビル。。小さな窓が一つしかなく、閉塞感がありました。残念。入ってすぐにベッドがありびっくり。ただしトイレが別なのでよかったです。バスタブはありませんが、シャワーがバラエティに富んでいて面白い。ドライヤーも見たことがない海外製。テレビはSONY、YouTubeが見られて良かったです。ミラーリングもOK。ベッドは広々、寝心地も良かったです。空気清浄機があればベスト。エアコンは三菱、冷蔵庫も電気ポットもあります。ただ乾燥が激しく、静電気でパチパチ。入ってすぐベッドでしたが、狭くは感じませんでした。ただ、梁が大きい部屋で、梁の向こうに窓無しの小さなデスクが。閉塞感いっぱいで使えず、冷蔵庫の前に椅子を持ってきてそこで夕飯を食べました。YouTubeが見られなかったら、窓の外は隣のビル、しんどくて部屋にはいられなかったかもしれません。ビジネスで泊まる人には関係ないかもしれませんが。ホテルステイにはあの部屋は無理。ホームページを見るとシングルでも窓が二つある部屋もありました。私が泊まったのはダブル。クリスマスも予約を入れているので、メールでなるべくなら外が見える角部屋、とリクエストしておきました。朝食ですが、ボックスメニューでフロントで手渡し、部屋かロビーで食べます。朝食会場はないのです。サンドイッチでしたが、まあまあ美味しかったです。コーヒーも美味しいし、朝食としてはいいのかも。コーヒーは部屋に持ち込めます。美味しいのでたくさん飲んでしまいました。相対的に、ビジネスとしてはなかなか良いと思います。ただ、ゆっくり1人でホテルステイをしたい人には不向きかもしれません。
銀座で夜遅くまで食事をしてもすぐに泊まれる位置にホテルがあって大変便利であった。ホテルは新しく、スタイリッシュで、必要なアメニティーをロビーから各部屋へ持っていくという方法であった。ベッドも広く寝やすかった。カウンターでは仕事もでき便利であった。金曜日に宿泊したが料金が銀座にしては高くなく、コスパの良いホテルであった。銀座付近に宿泊するのであれば、次も使用したい。

立地は銀座からも新橋からもアクセスしやすい場所でありながらとても静かなところでした。 館内も清潔感に包まれており、消毒や密を避ける等の感染症対策もしっかりしておりました。 チェックインは自動チェックイン機を使ったセルフ対応で、初操作の不安がありましたが、フロントスタッフが丁寧にご案内下さりあっという間に終わらせられました。使って見て分かる楽さと快適さです。 ロビーには無料でいただけるコーヒーマシンも設置されており、あまりの美味しさに2杯3杯とリピートしてしまいました。 お部屋はベッドもテレビも大きく、特にテレビはミラーリングや動画サービスの利用が出来て、家とは違う優雅な時間を過ごせました。 多機能シャワーと呼ばれるシャワーは期待以上の多機能っぷりで夜も朝も利用しました。家では味わえない快感にこの為にもまた訪れたいくらいです。 部屋の遮光カーテンの遮光っぷりも素晴らしく、たっぷり寝ることができました。 お部屋に置かれたミネラルウォーターのサービスも嬉しく、ロビーのコーヒーサービスと合わせて飲み物で不便することはなかったです。 チェックアウト時もスタッフは笑顔とお辞儀でお見送り下さり、もう一泊。とあと引かれる思いでした。 全体を通して大満足の滞在でした。この場を借りてスタッフの皆様に感謝申し上げます。

ロビー、ラウンジ、部屋など、隅々に至るまでオシャレな内装になっており、まるで別世界に来たような錯覚を覚えます。シャワーもオーバーヘッドシャワーとハンドシャワー、さらにはボディシャワーまであり、海外のリゾートホテルに来たような気分が味わえました。スタッフの方の対応も丁寧かつ上品で、ホスピタリティの高さを感じました。このクオリティの高さなのに、コストがあまりにリーズナブルなので驚きました。またぜひ宿泊させて頂きたいと思います。

プレミアルームに宿泊しました。小上がりになっているベッドルームとカウンターが設置されており、ゆったりと過ごせる作りになっています。 個人的には、お部屋に設置されていたBluetoothスピーカーとノーズレスドライヤーがとても気に入りました。お部屋の中で快適に過ごせる環境が整えられているなと思いました。 ラウンジではコーヒーを飲んで自由に過ごすことが出来ます。全体的にお洒落で落ち着いた雰囲気の素敵なホテルでした。

Attended a conference at the hotel. I was impressed by the welcome reception. Fast check in process, helpful staff and always greet with smile. Impressive room with beautiful view towards the Manila Bay.Fantastic choices of food at the restaurant.  Outdoor swimming pool which is too shallow to swim.But great to soak at the luke warm water after full day schedule.

Very nice location, situated right in the heart of the city but peaceful neighborhood. It is near the hanzomon station. If you got luggages you can conveniently take the Exit 4 elevator, outside it turn right and you’ll just have to cross the street towards the hotel. It’s also only a few blocks away from the imperial palace and chidorigafuchi park. The room is very clean and well-maintained. Everything is functional. All staff are great and always ready to assist you. Didn’t get to try the food in their restaurant since there are quite a few good places to dine around the area. Definitely recommend this place though you might want to choose a bigger room if you need more space.

This hotel could be a reasonable alternative if budget is your concern.  Positive of this hotel: 1) Close to Hanzomon Station of Hanzomon metro line - the hotel doorstep is a mere 100m from Exit 4 and Exit 5. In addition it is only 15 min from Hanzomon station to the main Tokyo train station. 2) Proximity to attraction (Imperial Palace courtyard and 650m from Yasukuni shrine) 3) Staff quality - the staff is attentive and try their best to address your needs despite they speak relatively little English 4) Reasonably price room rates for the comfort of its room; good option for budget-sensitive travelers to Tokyo.   Downside of this property includes: 1) located in relatively quiet neighborhood; only 1 24-hours convenience store and a handful of eatery outlets around 2) the hotel
is a little dated in spite it is still very clean and all facilities functions well. The hotel appears old-fashioned.

Staffs were very cheerful and in good manner which made me happy.  The location is good in centre.  The atmosphere of he entrance and lobby were good atmosphere. Check in and check our procedure were quick !  Inside the room... very compact which had no problem. But on the table, bed head board and clock etc. were full of dust !  Bath tub was getting moldy. Under the toilet was full of dust with somebody’s hairs.... Bathroom sink, I had to wait 10 min. to get water, first water was running first.  Bathroom amenity was .... shampoo, conditioner, Body soap, toothbrush and razor only !  So, for ladies, you need to bring by yourself maybe ?  Bed was ok to sleep, no problem...  Breakfast  - - staff’s smile qnd cheerful greeting were very nice but not so much choice in dishes.  But it
was only 1 night, so it was ok to stay.

We selected Diamond Hotel because of the close proximity to matters we need to take care of in Tokyo. This is really an overnight stay hotel for business travelers. Rooms are very small and cramp, sufficient enough for a single person at best. Furnishings are a bit dated but everything is clean and functional. No place to store your luggage, 2 hangers on a wall hook, no dresser drawers, no closet. Essentially you live out of your luggage. One small in room TV with zero western stations. The hotel buffet in Plumeria Restaurant was reasonably price when added to the initial booking. The price was less than $10 USD per person. If you buy the breakfast buffet in person, you will pay 1400 yens. Plumeria Restaurant offers a mix of western and Japanese breakfast items. Dinner price at

Plumeria Restaurant is around 2200 yens for a thin steak, 1 floret of broccoli, 1 slice of carrot, 1 dollop of potatoe, 1 tea cup of soup, and 1 mini cup of coffee. The pork cutlet dinner there is around 1700 yens. For dinner, you can do much better at nearby walkable restaurants. Several mini markets and grocery stores are close by too. Hanzomon Metro Subway Station is less than 5 minutes walk from hotel. You can reach most areas of Tokyo via train transfers. A refreshing walk to the Imperial Palace grounds is quite doable from Diamond Hotel also. Diamond hotel and Plumeria restaurant staff were very polite and attentive to your needs when asked. The free WiFi internet connection in the room often drops off. WiFi connection in the lobby is better.

restaurants.name: Fukuoka Ryori to Shun No Aji Fukuoka

reviews: Modern hotel with nearby train station and loads of food joints & places to visit . Front desk has English speaking staff. Please check room size before booking though. Breakfast is name sake only in a box - neat and clean rooms - location is good - nice for a day or so -

Fantastic helpful staff. Reception lady insisted on helping my daughter and husband to a taxi in the rain and made sure the driver knew exactly where they wanted to go. Very friendly and helpful beyond the call of duty.  The rooftop garden was a primary attraction, but was cordoned off because of some wet weather. We had a sneak peek anyway, and it would have been perfect, as each of the several separate lounge areas are covered. Each lounge seat remained dry and would have been perfect for a relaxing drink. Next time?

Fabulously located hotel in the heart of Roppongi. Friendly staff and very clean, the hotel I believe is new opening in 2018. Now we all know that room size is not overly generous in Japan. However ACT rooms are listed as 'economic double' - they are not - they are singles, as confirmed to me by the manager when I needed to book an extra night over the phone. They may serve the purpose for a 1 night stay - bed-size is a 3/4, but for any longer you will have to work out a rota system with your partner ! Bottom line is if you want a double room, book the standard double - still relatively small but more manageable.

Modern , very clean , has washing facilities , very quiet as well. 3 minutes from Roppongi Station exit 2, so very convenient.  Room's are very small (well, quite normal for Tokyo) but it’s comfortable , modern , and everything works , there is a safe also. Comfortable bed and I slept well . Nice and friendly staff at front desk. No breakfast available.

Picking up my daughter in Tokyo i booked the Act hotel in Roppongi due to its good location between Roppongi Hills and Tokyo Midtown, which includes the Roppongi Metro Station - 2-3minutes walking distance.  The hotel is rather new, opened in late 2018. The hotel offers no breakfast, the rooms only.  We had a double bed room, which was on the tiny side but in very good and clean condition. Desk and minfridge - no content - and a very well working AC unit.  The bathroom was small too but again, very clean and with a good shower - rainshower included and all things needed in the bath such as shampoo, lotion, toothbrushes etc..  The toilet was one of the fancy electric ones which hose your bottom - if so desired.  The hotel also offers a nice roof terrace which unfortunatly is

underused and underservced and closes at 10pm already - a lost opportunity here for the hotel to serve some drinks and create a nice socializing space.  The staff was friendly, accommodating and spoke well English.  I can recommend the hotel to tourist travellers who merely need a comfy place to sleep for a reasonable price. I will return.  Nice food places, a british pub and convneience stores are within 2-3 minutes walking distance.

The hotel is within walking distance to both Tokyo and Nihombashi station, if you know the area. The location is fantastic, with endless dining/drinking options steps away. I found the staff incredibly attentive and helpful, especially as the rules from the growing pandemic were being enforced. My room was bigger than others I'd had in Tokyo, and was also super clean with a deep bathtub too. The breakfast was buffet style with many different choices, though I would recommend getting up early to avoid the mad rush. I hope to return here in the future.

I stay the surrounding area hotel, include Via INN and Saibo, they are the best.   Nice room, good services, provide free drink in lobby, breakfast is super. Overall experience, they are the best hotel in that area!

I chose this hotel because it had bigger rooms than the norm in Japan and I was not disappointed. The hotel is a 20min walk from Tokyo station and is in the business area. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. The breakfast was excellent with a good Japanese and European choice. There are some restaurants around the hotel but there are a lot more in the stores in the shopping street two main roads away. I would definitely stay at this hotel again

I stayed here for 2 nights in early April. The room/bathroom were typically small but also, typically, perfectly fine. An in-room fridge is provided but the microwave is shared between other rooms on the floor (perhaps other floors too). Something I had not seen before was a "Handy" smartphone provided in-room. I didn't use it but it seemed like it would be a great help while travelling locally if you had no phone of your own. The entrance and lobby is very welcoming and staff spoke good English. Location is good ... on the main street within 5 mins. walk of Ningyocho Metro Station which connects with Ueno Station (Hibaya Line). A 7-11 is on the adjacent block.

Because rooms are very small for two people, it was given to us semi double which looks like size single bed. I stayed in Kyoto, Osaka, Hiroshima, Takayama and also in Tokyo other hotel. But this one is incredibly small. Stay away from this hotel, do not bother booking.

restaurants.name: Sake to Koshitsu Izakaya Maguro Daihyo-dan ta Daihyo
Shabu Shabu Yakiniku Tabehoudai Merino Ginza

reviews: Booked this hotel as it was close to Tokyo Dome. It did not disappoint, it was just 2 mins walk away! The rooms were small and basic, but clean and tidy. Value for money!  The staff spoke very little English, but that was fine as we did not require much. However, they were very friendly and helpful. It is also close to train stations, so it was easy to get to other places. To get there from the airport, you can take the Limousine bus to Tokyo Dome Hotel and walk over.

Was in Tokyo for the Coldplay concert and pretty much every hotel was fully booked or they jacked up the room rates to ridiculous levels. Seeing that this hotel was near the Tokyo Dome and Suidobashi station, we gave this small hotel a try. In terms of accessibility, it is just across the road from LaQua shopping mall and exit A5 of Suidobashi subway station so no problems there.  Reception staff was friendly enough and spoke English reasonably well. The room itself was very basic and tiny. There was hardly space to place luggage and still walk. There was a musty carpet smell and the room was very stuffy and warm. There is air-conditioning but there is no way to adjust the temperature and the air that comes out from the vent is not very cool. We opened the window and it became

bearable after an hour. The window faces the side of a building. You can reach out and touch it! I heard noises from the street throughout the night and I had to close the window again, which made the room stuffy again.  The tiny bathroom had a strong damp smell from the shower curtain that made it very uncomfortable to use. There was hardly any space to towel yourself dry as the bathtub looked like it was made for a small child? And no hooks to hang any clothes. At least it was clean and the shower gel and shampoo smelled nice.  Wifi was serviceable but slow or nonexistent during evening peak hours. We did note that there was a small refrigerator but it was not cold at all?   Reception gave a voucher for free breakfast on one of the mornings. The buffet breakfast is pretty basic but it was good enough for me!  I would try for the Tokyo Dome Hotel if you need to stay in the Tokyo Dome area.

Tiny room, but probably pretty standard for Japan. No breakfast--need to add another 1,008 yen. That makes this place very expensive compared to others in the area. No English TV channels, no AC control, and everything is quite dated. And seems to forever have a faint smell of smoke in the air. However, it was pretty much as expected, so not really surprised or disappointed, but definitely not wowed either. Staff was great and the location can't be beat, but I just think there has to be a better choice in the neighborhood.

Data of stayed 03.07.16 to 04.07.16 Room no.534  Great to stayed a day, close to Tokyo Dome city with access to restaurant & Suidobashi Station, easy to find, room had get ready for guess provide penjamas,room very clean, the staffs was able to speak English very well. Just the tv broadcasting all in Japanese, I cannot understand the Japanese languages, hope I can stay again for next coming.

Small compact rooms but perfectly acceptable for this price. Staff very courteous and helpful and rooms very clean. Good location for Tokyo Dome and Chao University and five mins walk from two metro stations. Imperial palace is also only a short metro ride.

restaurants.name: Benitora Gyozabo Tokyo Dome City LaQua
Yokohama Iekei Ramen Bukotsuya, Dome Mae
Pizzeria Mar de Napoli, Tokyo Dome City Laqua
Moomin Bakery & Cafe Tokyo Dome City LaQua

reviews: Predominantly a so-called business hotel. Very close to Yoga station. Handy for travelling into centre of Tokyo via public transport. Convenience stores, super markets, restaurants, drug stores, etc. are all situated nearby. Not exactly a cosmopolitan district of Tokyo however the room has basic day to day facilities such as washing machine, clothes dryer, cooking heaters, etc. although they may only be available for their twin rooms and not for single stay. I would have given another star if they had parking facilities. Otherwise a very convenient base for those long stays in Tokyo. Could possibly lower their rates a little bit for more frequent usage.

Very pleasant hotel, staff speak decent English and everything is functional and comfortable. Decent price, is only a few metro stops from the centre of Tokyo and is very quiet and relaxing. Excellent wifi is included, shower is strong and efficient. Cable TV is free, on demand available as well as a vending machine and laundry facilities.

This hotel gives good value for money. It is conveniently placed at Yoga Station only a few stops on a local train Line from Shibuya. So If you are in Tokyo and want to Stay a little away from the centre, this is a perfect place.

I stayed at Tokyu Stay Yoga for 2 weeks in January 2016 in a double room. The rooms are a little on the small side for a couple, but that's pretty standard for Tokyo. Plus this really is a business hotel, so it's not really geared for couples or families.  The guys at reception were always polite and helpful, they also speak English if you're not a Japanese speaker.  The combined washing machine/dryer was fantastic and super quiet, you could sleep while it was running.  I didn't really use the kitchenette as it's a bit too small for comfortable cooking, plus there's a cheap Fuji Supermarket (and a Lawson's, 7-11 and FamilyMart) only 2 minutes walk from the hotel, so it was easier to just buy meals.  The location is fantastic - the hotel is only 1 minute's walk from Yoga train

station on the Den-En-Toshi Line, and you can take a local train or semi-express straight into Shibuya (express trains don't stop at Yoga).  Overall, the stay was comfortable and convenient, and I'd definitely stay again.

The room is small typical japanese style in Tokyo. However, for one person is plenty of space. Very functional and clean. Though the staff can speak less English but they tried to understand so not that bad. the best things are it's very close to train station, close to food and local groceries areas, food stalls, so nice area to buy and shop anything, supermarket and so on. I like it and it's not very expensive. I would consider again for sure.

restaurants.name: Doutor Coffee Shop Setagaya Business Square

reviews: We stayed at the Tokyu Stay Yotsuya during the Rugby World Cup in October 2019. While Tokyo was extremely busy, Yotsuya was relatively quiet. It’s rather central but not as crowded as the more popular tourist-oriented districts of Tokyo. The hotel is 5 minutes from the Yotsuya metro station, which proved to be very handy. All the staff at the Tokyu Stay Yotsuya were very polite and helpful. Miss Goda, who worked on the reception desk, was extremely helpful when we needed to extend our stay due to Typhoon Hagibis. Our room was a reasonable size with a large bed, small sofa, wardrobe, desk, etc. There was also a small kitchenette that was equipped with a fridge, microwave, saucepans, plates, utensils, etc. There was also a washer/dryer. Best of all there was a small balcony with a

wonderful view across Tokyo. On a couple of days we could see Mt Fuji from our room! Brilliant! Unfortunately, there are few restaurants in Yotsuya that have much for vegetarians on their dinner menus. There is a Family Mart right next to the hotel and you can find just about everything you need for snacks, a light meal plus beer and English language newspapers. We heartily recommend The Rising Sun pub nearby for an excellent pint, grilled cheese sandwiches and chips plus excellent rugby camaraderie!

Rooms are fairly sized and clean and boast a balcony. Every unit is a neat little efficiency with everything you need. A desk, a small sitting area, a bathroom, a cooking area and a washing machine. Yotsuya is well located on the west side of the city, 40 minutes by subway to Asakusa and 30 minutes to Shibuya. At about $90-100 a night for a single room it’s value for money, but I might stay somewhere else next time I’m in Tokyo to explore other parts of the city. Ps: if you stay less than a week, there’s no housekeeping but they will remove your trash and give you fresh towels

My wife and I picked this hotel based on reports from other reviewers and we were not disappointed. Tokyo is a sprawling city and this hotel is conveniently located just a few stops from most places along their very efficient subway/train lines. Rooms are small but well equipped and having a washer/dryer combo in your room is an added bonus. Small kitchenette and fridge but efficient enough if you want to heat up a snack after along day sight-seeing.  Aircon worked well as temperatures were well above 30c for the time we were there.  Breakfast is served in a cafe at street level next to the hotel, and although modest it sets you up for the day ahead.  Staff on the desk were very polite and accommodating.   If we were to return to Tokyo again one day we would definitely stay here

We booked a 3 person apartment with 3 single beds to stay for 3 nights. The room is reasonable for 3 adults though a little tight with all the luggage. It is clean and well located about 5-10 minutes walk from Yotsuya train station or the subway station which is just opposite of each other. Not too difficult for visitors with heavy luggage as the train station has escalator to the street and is only slightly incline uphill pushing from train station to the hotel apartment.   As you come out from the train station, go up the ramp and cross the traffic light to KFC and go straight up for about 200 meters and cross road opposite will be the hotel apartment. There are a lot of restaurants nearby when you come out and convenient stores. Reception staff is very helpful and courteous.

We arrived early and they helped to clean up faster for us to check in as we were tired arrive on a night flight.  Room has fridge, stove and microwave. can do minor cooking but we ate out everyday.  Check in and check out is fast. Is only about 10 minutes walk to Akasaka Palace. From Hotel turn left and go straight down to the traffic light junction, turn right and walk straight for about 5 minutes would reach the palace. Highly recommend this hotel and would stay again if in Tokyo.

First off, I want to point out that the staff at this hotel are incredible! My husband and I left ALL our electronics (Apple Watch, Kindle, Bose Headphones, etc) in a small drawer in the hotel. It was so embarrassing because we only noticed our stuff was missing after landing back in the US. We promptly emailed the staff and they kindly mailed everything back for us. Just know that you are in good hands if you are staying with them!  As for the hotel itself; we loved it! The surrounding area is quiet and only one stop away from Shinjuku. The room is very spacious (for Tokyo's standards), bright, modern and clean. The bathroom has a wonderful tub to soak in after a long day of exploring. The toilet seat is heated :) You have full control of the AC/Heater in the room. Our room had

a small balcony too which was fun. The staff speaks good English and they are very nice! The check in process was easy. They provide all kinds of items such as toothpaste/toothbrushes, hairbrushes, soap, bath sponges, etc.  They gave us a breakfast coupon to use at the diner next door called "Jonathan's" and it was a perfect way to start each morning before exploring.   Overall, I think this hotel is great if you are staying longer than 2 or 3 nights in Tokyo. If you are looking for a more spacious room that's clean and modern and you don't care to be in the center of all the craziness, I highly recommend this hotel.

restaurants.name: Shabu Shabu All-You-Can-Eat Yakiniku Merino Shinjuku

reviews: SO if your claustrophobic, don't stay here! The room was a double ( 2 beds) in a room that was barely the size for one bed! I too the mattress from Bed #2 and put it atop bed #1 and had a bit more space. Fortunately the frame folded up and I stored it against eh other side wall. The bathroom door is only about 18" wide and I had to turn sideways to get in there.  Think small cruise ship bathrooms and you will understand. AS a standard I asked if there was a larger bathroom available, and the whole thing was lost in translation... One good thing was the breakfast for $11.00. Nice selection. The locations is tops for going to the Sumo Bashos.  Great JR line access. Great restaurants in 3 block radius. I would return for the right price.

Checking-in was quick and the staff was extremely courteous  LOCATION: It's centrally located but not that central that you encounter hordes of people every day and at every hour. It's near Asakusa (temples), Akihabara (anime and games), and Skytree (Pokemon Center). It's in Ryogoku so it's close all things Sumo. There's plenty of food places (I recommend going to the nearby Hasegawa for a taste of Michelin star tonkatsu) and convenience stores nearby. It's walking distance to the train station so sometimes it becomes noisy.  SERVICES and AMENITIES: There's a laundry area on a different floor. There are several vending machines. The Internet is everywhere. There's a resto on the 1st floor (I recommend having breakfast elsewhere if you're on a budget). The room is Japan-size (aka
small). The twin room barely fits two people. If you're more than 6'3 tall, good luck to you. There's the usual stuff: kettle with tea, hairdryer, bathtub, etc.  Nothing fancy but sufficient.

Rooms are small. Service is good breakfast OK. Very near the station so easy to walk around. If you like McDonalds then this gets better as there is one just a few steps away. You can walk to the Skytree felon here. You can also take a boat and see Tokyo and get to a beach!

We stayed here for a last few nights before we came back home and we found it to be in a good location with small restaurants nearby and the train station is quite close.  The only downfall is that the train station is so close that it is quite noisy.

We had a great stay here. First the location is superb, place is quiet and very near the Ryogoku Sobu line station, just 1 minute walk! There are restaurants and convenience store nearby.  Room we had is small (economy studio room) and on the older wing of the hitel but all is okay. Room and toilet & bath is clean with free toiletries. Wifi connection is fast.  Staff are very helpful and can speak english well. Breakfast is also good.I just hope there's a complimentary bottled water in the room.  Check in and check out was smoothly fast.

restaurants.name: Tsukiji Kagura Sushi Ryogoku Edo Noren Standing

reviews: First of all, it is obvious that I am a foreigner with foreigner friend but somehow the foreigher<?> receptionist kept speaking and handed me form in Japanese. I don't mind since I can read and understand few, but I don't understand why.  Other than that, the hotel was beautiful! Very equipped and spacious. I appreciated the TV and cutlery. The layout was different with the photos they had in their website so be careful. Cute amenities and very delicious tea.  The corona prevention measurement also taken seriously. I am so happy to have hand sanitizing alcohol in every corner you could think of. Would be nice if we have it too in our room.   Also close to the station though I cannot find any convenient store nearby, maybe in the back alley?

The Ueno North Mimaru is conveniently located very close to the train station making it an ideal base for a Tokyo holiday. The family room we had was very spacious and comfortable for 4. Staff were very friendly and extremely helpful in assisting with sightseeing ideas. All staff we dealt with spoke fluent English making the experience so easy.

We stayed at their Japanese style room for 5 nights. It has 1 bunker and 4 single beds enough for 6 people. The room was very cozy and spacious enough with Japanese style living room. We had enjoyed our stay as it was near to Ueno train station, quite convenient to travel besides there are a lot of foods and shops in the neighbourhood. There was once the housekeeping forgot to change our towels on the third day although we have put the used towels in the bathup. Not sure whether they cleaned the room thoroughly or not but we did not mind as the room looks fine.

We stayed for 7 nights and were very confortable. It´s beautiful and roomy. It´s great to have a table and chairs to eat on and a fridge to stock food. It´s a shame that they don´t clean the room every day. And the walk from the train can be a little frightening in the dark since it´s out of the touristic area. If you ask, they´ll put 2 matressess in the bunk beds so they are more comfortable. They don´t offer breakfast or food service.

Room is big enough for six people family. Great services here! Looking foreword to come again! :-) Here can wash and dry clothes. I think is good for hosts that live here for more than two days. And clean!

restaurants.name: Humming Cafe by Plame Collome, Ecute Ueno

reviews: We stayed in 5 hotels during our stay in Japan.  This one was a disappointment.  We got attitude from the staff.  The rooms reeked of smoke.  When I went down to exchange my room I was told the place was sold out (didn't believe it).  Rooms were your typical tiny rooms and old-fashioned.  Yes, the rooms were cheap, but I would have to place this hotel way below a Motel 6.  Our visit was before the pandemic so masks and hand sanitizers were not required.

Very good hotel, great value for money. The location is alright, about 10 minute walk to a metro stop. The service was great, with room cleaning everyday. Would recommend this hotel if you just need a good and cheap place to sleep, whilst exploring Tokyo.

In 2001, my first trip to Japan, I stayed in this Asukusa hotel (different management—then called the “Seventh Sky”) and had a memorable (and romantic) two weeks because my “sweetie” was staying there with a group.  Since then I’ve come to Tokyo often and stayed in more expensive hotels, but this time for a four-night stay I decided to stay in its successor, the Smile Hotel, as a bit of nostalgia.  I don’t regret it.  Although it’s been spiffed up, it looks much the same inside and out and brought back many nostalgic memories.  It’s still a budget hotel with small plain rooms, but it is clean and quiet with a decent shower, bed, little fridge, and TV, and the A/C and wi-fi worked fine. It still only has one small elevator for 10 floors and and an opaque window, and you might

want to bring an extension cord and a few extra hangers, but the price was right.  It’s a short walk from the Ginza Line and the Asakusa Kannon Temple—and not far from the Tokyo Sky tower (tallest tower in the world).

This was our first hotel of many, as part of a trip taking in many cities of Japan. The room was quite small, very tight. Very little room between the beds and around the beds to walk around.  We expected rooms to be small in Tokyo, but this was even smaller than I had imagined, LOL. We managed.  The bathroom is quite small as well, and the whole room has plastic paneling so if your shower head sprays outside of the shower/tub area, it doesn't matter, LOL. You have to STEP UP to enter the bathroom, which I tripped on a million times because I'm not used to that.  Our room faced the main road that the hotel is on, and was sometimes kind of loud when trucks, motorbikes or ambulance/fire went by, but otherwise not too bad.  Small closet to hang up your clothes. Very little space to

spread out, especially for two ladies with clothes, makeup and toiletries.  I found my bed to be VERY firm. Too firm for my liking. It was like sleeping on a slab of concrete, LOL.  The hotel staff was pretty friendly and spoke some English.  Our room booking included buffet breakfast.  This was our first experience with Japanese breakfast so we weren't sure what to expect. Let's just say, over our 16-day trip, that we learned that what was offered at this hotel was typical.  Rice, fried chicken, tamagoyaki (egg omelette), salads.  We enjoyed the buffet!!    The location was a bit far from the subway station, a little further than I would have liked with luggage.  But overall not a bad location as it is pretty close to the Tokyo Sky Tree tower and Senso-ji temple and Hoppy Street.

Hotel near Metro station "Mitsukoshi-mae" and Shinnihombashi station and walk from station around 4-5 minute. Room is normal size for Japan hotel 12 sqm. All staff are very nice and services mind. Them have mini restaurant at front side for Breakfast. And have bike for rent in front of hotel. Nearby with Japan restaurant and cafe. Hotel will offer only 1 day for Room cleaning (i stay 4 days).

Be careful Train Line Views are ONLY for the single rooms. All the doubles face the other direction. I got caught out, disappointed but that’s life, everything else is very good with this hotel. Would stay again.

In the last 3 weeks we have checked in to this hotel thrice and have spent 14 days in all. This is a combined review for all the three stays. The reason we chose this unlikely hotel, located as it is towards North of Tokyo ,is that our son stays nearby. Rooms to the hotel were not available on the JR- East Mets website but we got bookings on Expedia( via TripAdvisor). The rates are slightly on the higher side.The hotel does not have an e-mail id , so in case if issues I did not know how to connect with them.Luckily we had no issues prior to check in. If you are reaching Tokyo at Narita airport ,the simplest way to reach the hotel is by Skyliner to Nippori. Change to JR line in Nippori and Tabata station is only 2 stops away in 4 minutes. Reverse the route for return journey to

Narita. The hotel is located at a minute’s walk from the station. It is a tallish structure but the lobby is small. As you enter the hotel you will encounter lovely citrus flavours and there are also lot of literature for tourists, but only one in English. Which brings me to the fact that the English abilities of the staff are below average although they are a very co- operative lot. They keep some candies on the counter to which you can help yourself. You can borrow umbrellas and also entrust your luggage to them for free if you are going out of Tokyo for short trips.During our first stay lasting 11 days we were given a spanking new room( Room no. 1001) on the tenth floor, however for our subsequent stay we were allotted slightly jaded room no. 401 on the fourth floor. The room is of average size by Japanese standard and the room has good view of the locality from windows. The room had all requisite amenities including a universal adaptor and two chairs. There is no English Channel on the TV. The free wifi did not work inspite of our complaints. The toilet is very clean and has all amenities ( however the shaving razors were of poor quality). You can help yourself to roasted green tea, green tea or coffee. The air conditioning is but of an issue as the room does not cool enough, even in highest fan speed.The free breakfast is served in the cafe called “ Pronto”( it is part of a chain). You have four breakfast sets which never change including one with toast, omelette, salad , yogurt and s single cup/ glass of hot or cold beverage. The juices are unlimited but we did not try them. The cafe is open to outsiders too and seem fairly busy and you can eat till late night.Overall we were quite happy with our stay. Tabata is around 20 minutes to Shinjuku and around 15 minutes ( one change) by train to Asakusa and the area is very quiet except for noises from train ( including Shinkansen).

It's only a few minutes walk from Yamanote and Keihin Tohoku line Tabata station and good accesses to Tokyo and Saitama areas. Room are good size and provide enough amenities and give good views of Tohoku, Joetsu and Nagano Shinkansen trains. Restaurant for breakfast is also acceptable.

restaurants.name: Honba Sanuki Udon Oyaji no Seimenjo Tabata

reviews: We ended up here due to a Challenging reservation process and it was 2 am and Watanabe the Front desk gentleman was extremely helpful - 10 out of 10  The room   Big for Japan and had a extremely comfortable king sized bed, and lots of space,   The Breakfast was free with room and was fine, good coffee fresh food and service.   I will Make this my hotel of choice in Tokyo from now on because of   Excellent Service  Good amenities- iron, hair needs, clean bright bathroom Comfortable bed and linens  Quiet area very central to Metro line, Shinkansen, and a tonne of Shopping and amenities  Enough room for large luggage on a longer term stay.

This hotel just one minute walk from Exit C6  (West exit) of Ikebukuro Station is conveniently located, and deserves a five star for its location. Not too bad a place to stay (and reasonably priced) if you don't mind the following.   It does not have wifi in room, you can get them at hotel lobby, but it is not stable, sometimes I can't even log in to the wifi. You can connect your lap top in room as there is cable provided, but the speed is really quite slow.   Room is reasonably clean but bed and chair seem old, the mattress and cushion are sinking.   Other than that, breakfast is decent with 4 choices available and free flow of drinks.   Bathroom is a bit bigger than the usual business hotel standard, with a bigger bathhub.

Cons It says that there's wifi, and there is, but only in the lobby.  The lobby is a hallway with a check-in desk and two chairs.  We were traveling internationally, so this was a major inconvenience.  There are four breakfast options. What is shown in their picture options is much more than what they actually served us.  For instance, one option shows half a fish with a few other things. When I chose this option, I received what amounted to about four bites of fish. The staff spoke very very limited English. To be fair, I don't speak Japanese.  Pros They are close to the subway and plenty of stores and places to eat. It was clean and fairly quiet.   If I went to Tokyo again, I would absolutely not stay here again.

From the get-go,  I've been so displeased about this hotel. From key-locked windows to burnt lampshades,to dusty room and a horrible bed and a broken shower head to a non usable aircon at night. It's plain horrible!

One of the young guy from the front desk was very helpful that it's closed to New Year Eve and my husband got serious tooth pain, that he tried to find the dental clinic that still open and closed to the hotel so that my husband could have emergency fix first.

restaurants.name: Pork Tamago Onigiri Cafe Ikebukuro West Entrance

reviews: I stayed at Comfort Shirakawa between 12-14th of April 2008 and paid their standard rate which is 8.200 Yen (80 USD) per night including taxes and breakfast which is great value for money.   The location is in a residential area just outside the very centre but you are no more than a few stops on the subway from the very heart of Ginza. And access to the subway (nearest station is Kiyosumi-Shirakawa) is very easy, the entrance is just 10 meters from the door of the hotel. The hotels sells discounted 1- and 2-day passes for the subway, just beware to get a pass that works on both subway companies (Toei and Tokyo Metro). Access from Tokyo Narita Airport was also very easy, take the Limousine bus to the T-CAT station (3000 Yen) and walk for 5-10 minutes and you are there.   The

staff if very friendly (like anyone else in Tokyo), their English is so-so but they are more than happy to fulfil any request. The room is quite small but that is common for most Tokyo hotels. The bed is rock-hard but that seems to be the case for most hotels as well. I must admit, it was rock hard but by no means uncomfortable. The bathroom is small with a small bathtub and a toilet equipped with a number of Japanese gadgets that you’ll just have to try out. There is free WiFi in the room and a fridge for putting beverages and other stuff in. The room was very quiet so I slept very well.   If you want some great take away food, exit the hotel and turn left. On the next corner across the intersection there is a small place that sells just great food for no money at all. Just around the corner of the hotel there is a supermarket (the one with two floors) that is just great, pick up all the stuff you need. Breakfast was nothing exciting but gives you a basic filling with coffee, bread, some cereals and not to forget the rice balls.   Conclusion: good hotel that gives you some great value and the location is perfect with the subway metres away. A very strong 4 is my overall verdict.

Economy hotel in Tokyo, about 15 minutes from Tokyo Station. Take two subway lines: the Marunouchi line one stop to Otemachi and switch to the Hanzomon line for three stops to Kiyosumi Shirakawa station...hotel is about 15 feet from subway exit B1...cost is 160 yen.  Not much in the immediate area of the hotel (go out to dinner elsewhere), but convenience to other areas of Tokyo and the proximity to the subway makes up for this.  Rooms are quite small with an even smaller bathroom, but rooms do inlcude a number of features including flat penel television, an air purifier, and a humidifier.  Hotel also has free wireless internet access and free continental breakast (modest with few choices). Hotel is clean and relatively new.  At 7,200 yen per night (less than $70) for a single,

a very good value if you are in Tokyo for something other than a hotel experience.  For those looking to pay more (but remain on budget) and stay in a more vibrant neighborhood, consider the Dai Ichi Hotel Annex near Shinbashi Station and walking distance to the Ginza.

We spent 5 nights here on our recent and first visit to Japan.   I made a mistake when I chose the double bed over 2 single beds. Turned out that the room was so small that two of us had to side-step each other and the stuff in the room all the time. While making the reservation I did see the message saying 'small room' but had no idea that it would be that small!! We asked to be shown a room with 2 single beds and it was almost twice as big. Unfortunately for us, all the bigger rooms were sold out during the 5 nights we were there.  My sincere advice to any couple booking this hotel would be to choose 2 single beds over the double bed. Interestingly, the double bed is the same size as the single bed. For us it would have been great since both rooms cost the same 8000 Choice

points for 1 night.  This hotel is primarily a place to sleep and eat breakfast as there is really nothing else that you can engage yourself in. Considering that we were first time tourists to Japan, we anyway did not spend any time in the room.   The hotel is neat, clean and efficient in whatever services we used it for. Being adjacent to the Kiyosumi Shirakawa metro station meant that getting to any corner of Tokyo was a breeze. We used the metro extensively during our 5 days there and at night, the metro exit being next door was a boon because we used to spend 10 - 12 hours on foot traipsing around Tokyo.  A 24-hour Family Mart next door and 2 large department stores round the corner (1 minute) mean that one could get something to eat or drink at any time.   Access to / from the airport - both Haneda and Narita - is easy though time consuming. We had reached Haneda at 10.30PM at night and had no problems in reaching the hotel by train/metro - all it needed was 600 yen per person and 1 change at Daimon station. Similarly, for getting to Narita when we were leaving, we had to change once at Oshiage and had paid 1290 yen.  All in all this is a good hotel to sleep, eat and hop onto the metro.

Great location. Very clean.  Very helpful staff with adequate English. Nice room. Good beds and bathroom. Lovely breakfast in a nice room (fruit,　yogurt,pastries, rice rolls, eggs...　Ｎext to Kiyosumi-Shrakawa subway station. Excellent reasonably priced restaurants just around the corner. Neighbourhood is interesting for a visitng North American. Fuyagawa museum, a block away, has a replica village from the Edo period. The Kyosumi Gardens, also a block away, are delightful (lake with carp and plenty of birds).

The hotel is located right above the kiyosumi shirakawa metro station. The service was good. Some receptionists couldn't speak english fluently but they did try their best to speak to us in english. The room itself is very comfortable. The bed was comfortable and the blanket was really soft and fluffy. The amenities given were also sufficient. It included toothbrush set, shaver, soap and shampoo. For its price, this hotel is an excellent choice. I would surely recommend it for a budget travelling in Tokyo.

All staff are an asset to the buisness, housekeeping never let us run out of supplies even when we had the do not disturb sign on the door they left us a bag full of toiletries and towels to make sure we was alright, the lads on the front desk are super!! They helped me out when  the airline cancelled my connection flight home by calling different numbers and waiting on hold for 40 odd minutes in the end they managed to secure me a direct flight home absolute heroes! The Japanese are so kind and thoughtful this is my second trip to the country. my favourite place in the world and I will definitely be back!

Very small room, and even smaller bathroom.  Spotlessly clean, and basic storage.  But well situated and with good metro coverage. The beds were comfortable.  We were in a group using 6 rooms, and they were all good.

Overall good experience.  ROOM: small but surely larger than other hotels and Apa's. Clean, with all amenities to sleep, wash, and relax. I liked it.  SERVICE: great! Staff was very nice, good English skills and maintained high standards of hygiene in common areas.   HALL and CHECKIN/OUT: very small hall with only two counters plus the express check-in/out. Easy to get everything sorted. Staff will also let you leave your luggage for a morning there before departure  BREAKFAST: included if wished, consists in a set menu with soup, eggs, veggies and unlimited drinks (coffee, juice, water) and bread. Quite nice but other APA offer a buffet breakfast. It is served in the adjacent cafe at the entrance (next to the lift). Open until 10.30am.   LOCATION: conveniently located 5mins

from Asakusabashi station, which is an easy and cheap trip to Narita and Haneda with the Asakusa Line, without having to get express trains which can be expensive, and close to Akihabara. Fantastic also to move around Tokyo with other lines and stops  An important miss is the laundry service. You are forced to go elsewhere to wash clothes. Have not tried other services.

So this is my first time visiting japan. I checked in at this hotel on February 18th - February 23rd 2019. The first time I entered I was warmly welcomed by the hotel staff, I like the interior of the lobby that looks cool and modern. the lobby is not too big but functional with all facilities such as toilets, vending machines, ice dispensers and microwaves. This hotel is quite strategic because it is located near the heart of Japan. The position of the hotel is close to the train station and also close to the mini market. the first impression that I got from this hotel room was the size of the room was not large but the facilities were quite complete. This room is suitable for travelers who only need a place to sleep. Overall, great!

My husband and I stayed at APA hotel as part of our Honeymoon. We knew it was a budget hotel and not always the most ideal for a honeymoon! However, the room was everything we needed in a base hotel. First of all the staff are friendly, and understanding. Our room was quite small which was to be expected in Tokyo but it had all the amenities that you could need and even had a little half tub bath! I would definitely ask for extra pillows as the one provided is like a gym mat. We had breakfast included which was a soup, egg & sausages and Rice or bread with refillable juices, this set us up for the day quite nicely. The reason I am giving this four stars is because  of the location, the hotel is a 3 min walk to Asakusa Line which was ideal. We liked our stay here and would

restaurants.name: Very Berry Soup Apa Hotel Asakusabashi

reviews: In big cities we prefer apartments and like to stay where the locals live; which gives us more freedom and the chance to get local cuisine and to avoid "tourist-traps.  Ikidane is such a place. We stayed for 3 nights in a two-bedroom apartment on the 6th floor; spacious, clean and with cooking facilities. The location is great, near to a subway station and plenty of local, inexpensive restaurants, shops and department stores in the neighborhood. And Kudos for the staff (Julia, hope I got it right) who was amazingly helpful.

Clean, well maintained, VERY comfortable beds. nice little cooking area with grocery stores very close. Train and subway short walk away. A little farther out from the center but an easy subway ride and just loved the local feel of the neighborhood. Not an overly touristy neighborhood which is exactly what we wanted... quiet, calm, local yet close enough with modest subway ride to whatever you want to do or see. Would highly recommend and will stay at this location again.

Perfect room in a perfect neighbourhood. The room had everything we wanted. Very comfortable beds. Super clean. Lots of restaurants and shops in the area but a quiet neighbourhood. The girls at the front desk were super nice, very helpful and had very good tips. Their English was very good.

This is an apartment-hotel located close to the Machiya Metro-station and a main street containing many convenience stores and restaurants. Our flat had a kitchenette, a washing machine, a refrigerator, two queen-sized beds, a sofa, a dining table, etc.  A thing to note is that this hotel is minimally-staffed - we only ever saw one person at the reception - if you're checking in after 10 PM, you need to inform them in advance. You don't get housekeeping services during your stay, so if you have collected garbage (for example), you need to put it out yourself.  Other than that, the rooms were fairly comfortable and clean. We especially loved the covers on the pillows on the sofa. The washing machine came in pretty handy in the hot and humid weather at the time. The kitchenette
came in handy to have home-cooked breakfast in the morning. The neighborhood was quite peaceful. The proximity to the Machiya Metro-station helped a lot every day.

Small apartment located about 5 min walk from Machiya station, so location very convenient. Many eateries around til after midnight, including 24 hrs bento shop (150m from the hotel) where you can choose among many type of take away food incl bento box, onigiri, katsu etc, with cheap price. 28km from Haneda, will cost around ¥11000 by taxi. 20 min by train to Asakusa. Useful info:  1. Reception closed at 10pm. You need to inform them in advance if you want late check in. After 10pm there will be no one in the reception so if you need anything, plan in adv.  2. Apartment very clean and new but no housekeeping during your stay. They provide powerful vacuum cleaner to use.  3. Im staying in Japanese type room, very spacious. Can fit 6 person. Do note that double bed in Japan is

140cm, so for 2 big guy, will be a bit cramped to share the bed.   4. Common space is where you sleep on futon, but curtain is paper thin so it will be bright in early morning. Those who like darkness better sleep in the bedroom.  5. They provide washing machine but no dryer. You can dry clothes on hanger in balcony.  6. If you need taxi esp big car, reserve the day before. In my case, i had to wait 30 min before being informed that they were fully reserved, and had to hail taxi under the rain, with smaller car, our luggage barely could fit. Not good if you need to rush to the airport.  Overall I had pleasant stay. Highly recommended.

restaurants.name: Souke Ichijoryu Ganko Ramen Hachidaime Chokkeichoya
Genki Shichirin Yakiniku Gyu Shige Machiya
Tokyo L O C A L Base

amenities: Fitness Centre with Gym / Workout Room
reviews: This hotel continues to be the  pinnacle of Tokyo business hotels.  The location is great and the access to trains and subways are perfect.  The views are typical Tokyo and can’t be beat.  If you hit it on the right morning you’ll be lucky enough to see Mt. Fuji.    I have stayed at about a half dozen Park Hyatt hotels around the world and all of them are memorable.  You really can’t go wrong.

The hotel itself is gorgeous, the jazz bar was a wonderful experience, the staff members were very courteous and helpful, and the views from the hotel room were incredible.  However, the hotel went from being fantastic to being awful all because of the bed. The bed was extremely uncomfortable and too firm. I mentioned this at checkout and was told that Park Hyatt offers mattress pads/cushions for guests that need softer beds. No one mentioned this when we checked in. I was very disappointed that we were only informed of the mattress pad at the end of our stay. If you can't sleep, no hotel is fun, no matter how beautiful.   When we came back to the room in the evening, the turndown service did not seem like anything special.  At other hotels, I have seen robes laid out,

mints/chocolates on the pillows, mood lighting, and music. The only difference I saw was that the lights were turned off and the music was off. I actually like mood lighting and the music playing in the room when we first arrived was one of the highlights of the room, so I would have preferred that it stay on.

If you're looking for a hotel to stay to celebrate a special occasion or just to spend a night, this is the place to go. My wife and I have stayed at  many excellent best hotels not only in Japan but around the world and Park Hyatt has got to be on the top of our list. We celebrated our wedding anniversary there and everything was absolutely perfect. Thank you Park Hyatt.

Everything was excellent during our stay. The staff helped me with every special request and went out of their way to make our time at Park Hyatt Tokyo unforgettable. Dinner at The New York Grill was amazing.

Over the years I have stayed at scores of hotels and Hyatts and I keep coming back to this hotel year after year.  During the COVID, they did not lower their standards despite having different protocol, they actually stepped up and perhaps had better service and amenities than they usually do!  Truly a great experience.

restaurants.name: Mangetsuro Shinjuku West Entrance Park Tower
Kitakata Ramen Bannai Shinjuku Park Tower
The Conran Shop, Shinjuku Main Store
Shabu Shabu All-You-Can-Eat Yakiniku Merino Shinjuku

reviews: Walking distance to several Metro stations. A fruit shop is just opposite to the hotel, good for Japan fruit lover. Staff are friendly. The kids love the room so much. Excellent for family. Strong recommend.

We had a great time at Mimaru Tokyo Ginza East. We are a couple and were assigned a room with 4 beds (I think that's the minimum for this facility), so plenty of space for us! The room has comfortable beds, a kitchen with all base facilities and the usual Japanese style bathroom with the (super automated) WC in a separate room. Great choice to substitute the TV with a projector that works as a multi function device where you can also stream from your Apple devices via AirPlay. Two separate apps on the projector work as a TV. The ABEMA TV bundle had some buffering problem in the evening times and was often interrupted, so maybe in these hours the Internet connection was a bit congested and slow. But still everything was great in the room and we enjoyed it a lot.  The hotel is in

a very quiet zone and still so near the the more buzzing center of Ginza. You can find a couple of 7-Eleven at a few minute walk and 2 or 3 minimarket at 10 minutes max. There are also three metro stops at max 10 minute walk distance of three different lines, so no problem connecting. If you want to walk here from the Tokyo station it just takes 20 minutes max. In the hotel you can also find an automated laundry service where you can both wash and dry your stuff and a machine selling soft drinks and water. Finding restaurants in Tokyo is absolutely no problem, because you can find something to eat at every single corner of this incredible town.  Staff is super kind, helpful, and international! Reception is open from the early morning till late evening. Outside of reception times you can use your card to enter the facility. Cleaning in the room is done at different levels every day based on a precise schedule given to you at check-in time.  This hotel will be on top of our list when we decide to come back to Tokyo, and we will!  Thanks again to all the staff at Mimaru Tokyo Ginza East

We stayed for 2 nights. A but pricey but I think that’s average for Tokyo. I did some research and for the amount I paid, this room was great for our family of 4. Spacious and felt like an apartment. Kids loved it. Kitchen was great which allowed us to cook or reheat food for the kids.   The hotel was 15 min from tsujiki outer market and 10 min from Tokyo station (walking time). We walked to the bus stuck in there and took an airport shuttle for 1000 yen each.

Spacious room. Kids love bunk bed. It’s great to have a kitchen so can cook Kobe beef in the room. Quiet area. Need to walk 15minutes to ginza or Tokyo station. Supermarkets nearby are all quite small. Wish there is a big supermarket to shop. 房間空間很夠，孩子愛上下舖，還可租借鍋具煮和牛享用。希望附近能有大型超市。走到鬧區都要一段路，帶著孩子有點累。

This location opened in November 2019 and the location can not be better. It’s 5 minutes walking to the nearest metro, 3 minutes from a large 7-11, there is a fruit grocer right across the street, and basically you are in the heart of Ginza, but still in the evenings and weekend mornings you will find it nice and quiet here. The rooms are spacious and well thought out, everything works well. The room has a natural light wood and white color scheme and there is plenty of lighting in the rooms. The staff speaks good English and is very friendly. You get a handy phone with free Internet that you can use outside the hotel. WI-FI signal is strong and you get good connection speed. Basically it checks all the boxes I have for both business and family travel. The apartment style with
the kitchenette and dining table is especially suitable for families. I would recommend this hotel for sure and will stay here again next time I’m in town with my family.

restaurants.name: Sake to Koshitsu Izakaya Maguro Daihyo-dan ta Daihyo
Shabu Shabu Yakiniku Tabehoudai Merino Ginza

reviews: My wife and I travelled to Tokyo in February 2016 on holidays. The three nights that we spent in Tokyo, we stayed at the Ryumeikan Tokyo Hotel and the experience from beginning to end has been very pleasant.   After making the booking online, we got in contact with the hotel via email and asked them to please ensure that our room was non-smoking and away from smoking floors. The hotel responded within 2 hours indicating that our request was going to be granted.   The first thing you notice when you reach the hotel is that the location is top. You are just a couple of minutes walking from Tokyo main train station (direct trains from Narita and Haneda Airports), Nihombashi subway, loads of restaurants to choose from and main attractions such as the Imperial Palace, Tsukiji fish

market or the neighbourhoods of Shibuya and Akihabara are “around the corner”. On the hotel’s door step there is a nice restaurant, a couple of coffee shops and a 24/7 convenient store where you can grab a sandwich in the night if you are too tired and don’t fancy to dine in a restaurant.   Reception is in the top (15th) floor. Upon arrival the staff is very pleasant, polite, and they speak English. The weather was cold, so receiving warm wet little towels to clean your hands and face was very welcoming and nice gesture from them.   We booked one of the smallest versions of the possible configurations offered by the hotel; our room was located on the 14th floor. The room do not have wardrobe, but there is space enough in front of the the bed or in the room’s corridor to store your baggage (note that we carried two massive cases and handluggage!), so for us this was not an issue. The bathroom is also small, but practical and absolutely spotless. There is a little basket with loads of complimentary stuff such as shaving foam, aftershave lotions, bath salts, comb, brushes, toothbrush, toothpaste, headbands, cotton buds…  and if you are missing something, the reception staff brings it to your room in no time. The bath is big enough and the flow of water in the shower is great, particularly after a long day walking around the city.  The bed was of a decent size keeping in consideration Japanese’s bed standards. I had read reviews of hotels where the beds were really tiny. This is not the case in this hotel, where the two of us slept comfortably without bothering each other. Something I really liked was that the hotel provides a typical Japanese kimono/pyjama for you to use. It’s a nice gesture and gets you into their culture a bit; we found it fun to get them on.   The room temperature can be regulated with a very easy to use thermostat located on the wall. I had read reviews of American tourists who found the air conditioned not good enough in Japanese hotels. We visited in winter, so I cannot comment on air conditioning as we made use of the heating; it worked fantastically leaving our room warm and lovely.   The TV choice is not great, but you can purchase a TV card for films and stuff on demand. In the floor’s corridor there was also a self-service drinks dispenser and ice. Here is where you can also buy the TV on demand cards. The prices of the drinks are the same as the convenient store or the vending machines on the street, so it is good to see that the hotel do not take advantage of the service increasing the prices of the drinks.   The room has safe to store your money, jewellery and documentation if needed. It also has a small fridge although I can’t remember if it had any drinks in it. There is also a kettle and a choice of complimentary teas and coffee. Every day they also put a couple of little bags of Japanese snacks that we found nice to eat during midday.   Although we stayed in the tallest of the possible floors, the view wasn’t anything special. Again, this did not bother us at all, as we used the hotel simply to sleep and rest, and we spent all the time in the city out and about.   WIFI is available and for free. Its speed and signal strength is well above standard. We did not stream music or films, but we were using chatting apps to catch up with friends and family and it worked absolutely fine. We also sent a few photos and checked email with no hassle at all.   We can’t comment on the breakfast as we didn’t combine our room reservation with it. Instead we had breakfast on a Starbucks located literally 200 meters far from the hotel’s door. However the breakfast area on the 15th floor (next to the reception) looks fine.   Check-out is at 11 am. The hotel asks you to return the card/keys of your room or you will be charged for them. Our flight out of Tokyo wasn’t until 23:00hrs so we asked the reception staff to look after our baggage, which they did for free and without any hassle, problem or hesitation (we did read some reviews of other hotels being funny about this, or even charging for leaving the baggage in reception, hence why we think is worth mentioning).  Overall, a very pleasant and relaxing stay in a top hotel with a very reasonable rate per night.

This was a great hotel.  I highly recommend this hotel if it is your first trip to Japan.  It is very attentive to foreign travelers.  For example, there is a pamphlet that explains how to wear the Yukata and slippers and all kinds of other helpful advice I wish I had known earlier in our trip.  The check in is on the 15th floor.  The staff was super attentive and all we dealt with could speak English.  They had excellent maps of the city and were helpful to tell us how to get to the subway station and other parts of Tokyo.  Grab the foldout map of Tokyo they provide, there are good and easy Japanese words to help you on your trip.  The room we had was very spacious even with three people.  We had several hours of relaxing in the hotel before our flight and it was very

comfortable.  There was a nespresso maker with many choices of coffee pods.  The amenities were nice products.  This was my favorite hotel to stay in out of the 4 hotels we stayed while in Japan.  I will definitely stay there again.

Great location across the road from Tokyo Station (Yaesu North Exit), where the shinkansen (bullet trains) arrive, and many metro lines run through, including the Keiyo line to Disneyland.   The hotel restaurant offers Japanese food only, but there are many other fantastic restaurants and coffee shops nearby.  The Daimaru department store is located across the road at the Yaesu North exit of Tokyo Station, and has the amazing food hall in the basement as well as excellent cafes on almost every floor, and the 12th and 13th floors have numerous very good restaurants that are open until late at night.  We got interconnecting rooms, which were perfect for our family of 4.  The rooms were very clean with lovely amenities, including a Nesspresso machine. The beds were very
comfortable, with a choice of pillows.  An express bus for Narita (900 yen per person one-way) leaves hourly from a stop about 50 meters from the hotel door.

This hotel was highly recommended by a good friend. After reading so many excellent reviews on this forum, I decided to try it and the excellent reviews here are true; I don't think I need to add more. Clearly this is the best hotel in its class and I've stayed in Tokyo several times. The hotel is super clean, complete ameneties (including a flat iron- must call the front desk though), room is big for a 3 starred hotel, and staff is efficient and helpful. The front  desk helped me sending my luggage to Narita airport (to be picked up at the day of my departure), so that I didn't have to carry those to the bus stop. Location is convinient for Limousine bus and Keisei bus stops- all go to Narita airport. This is going to be my go to hotel from now on in Tokyo.

We stayed here four nights, in a "Forus B" room.  The location, room, amenities, sound-proofness of the room, they were everything we'd hoped for and more. There's only one element we'd have loved to see a little bit better.  Location:  2 minute walk to Tokyo Central Station Yaesu entrances. Also only a 5 minute walk to get into the middle of Ginza, where you can do nice sightseeing stuff and go shopping.  Room: Some may find hotel rooms in Tokyo small, but not the Forus B room, in our opinion. They're not particularly big, but very nicely and practically arranged and furnished. The bed "experience" is fun and relaxing, having a wake up system with light, music and vibrations. The shower area is very nice, spacious, luxurious (waterfall shower), and pretty much sound proof.

There's no bath, but we prefer showers in hotel rooms anyway, so it was perfect for us. The photos on the hotel website give a good impression of the Forus rooms.  Amenities: The Nespresso coffee maker is such a nice extra, as is the melodious water cooker ;) There's also a small refrigerator. Every day four 500ml water bottles were made available, and tea bags and coffee cups were restocked. While we were there, every day a postcard from an art collection was made available which the hotel staff posted for us at no cost for postage. The only thing we would have liked in the room would be a safe to store stuff while we went out. We loved the Japanese pyjamas and kimono, which we  wore every day when we got "home" and were replaced every morning when the room was done. We would have been just as happy to have used the same set all days of our stay, but it did indeed feel very luxurious to have clean ones every day. The free wifi was fast.  Soundproof: As the hotel website states, the Forus B rooms are sound proof. Ours was indeed, we were very pleasantly surprised by it. To be in the middle of such a hectic city with the traffic and all, it was very quiet. We also did not hear anything from other hotel guests at any point. Perfection.  OK, so one little point of improvement we think would have made our stay more perfect than perfect: if all of the staff at the reception desk would speak a decent amount of English. Some did, but some could hardly put a sentence in English together and that is something we would have expected at a hotel we think receives many international guests.  Other wise, if you wish to be near the train station and also near shops and touristy things and you like the feeling of being pampered: this really is the place to go!

restaurants.name: Sake to Koshitsu Izakaya Maguro Daihyo-dan ta Daihyo
Shabu Shabu Yakiniku Tabehoudai Merino Ginza
Sukhumvit Soi Thong Lo Tokyo Yaesu
Din Tai Fung Tokyo Station Yaesu Entrance
Bar of Tokyo Manouchi Trust Tower
cusines: Brew Pub, Pub, Dining bars, Beer restaurants

reviews: 設備が整っていて、ゆっくりできた。 家にいるような空間と時間をもらいました。 友達とかときてもいいと思いました。
今回、プレオープンで宿泊させてもらいました！旦那の誕生日が翌日ということもあり、子ども達はクッキーやケーキ、私は時計のプレゼントを準備してのサプライズパーティーをすることができました！バミューダオーブンやキッチンがついてるので、料理もできますし、Switchなども借りることができました！楽しい夜になり、またイベントのときには活用したいとおもいました！
部屋が広くとても綺麗でした！ キッチンもついていてみんなで料理ができるのでパーティーにもオススメです！
とても綺麗で清掃が行き届いていて、とても快適に過ごせました。 スタッフの方も、親切でした。 コンビニやスーパーも近くて買い物がとても便利でした。
友達とパーティーする為にデイユースで借りました。ホテルの外装からとても綺麗で内装も清潔感がありました！キッチン家電やお皿なども充実していて快適でした。また利用したいと思います！！

This capsule hotel cranks up the heat to 80F or 27C. Little air conditioning units in capsule are as useless. Tiny changing rooms, lockers and front lobby. Anshin Oyado in Shimbashi is much better. Very inconvenient to get anywhere.   Pros: Menthol shampoos and various amenities. Drink bar and free massage chairs are a plus.  Cons: Heat. Heat. Heat. You can experience summer in Japan while traveling during winter! Maybe Japanese people have thyroid issues

Capsules are very comfortable, but public space very small, lockers are tiny, amenities are very good.  Lockers are way too small, but they will provide a clock-room, to stare your belongings.  Shower-rooms are quite small and crowded as well, but very clean, organized and full of amenities.   A bit in a dirty part of town, but nothing is too dirty in Tokyo anyway.  Over-all, would have given 5 out of 5, if not for the small public spaces and small lockers...

This was my first stay in a Tokyo capsule hotel--I have stayed at one in Taipei before, but that one had quite a few issues that weren't present in Tokyo. The Japanese invented the capsule hotel, of course, and they have ironed out quite a few of the issues.  This capsule hotel is tattoo-friendly and many of the staff speak decent English. There were a few foreign guests, but the overwhelming majority of guests at the hotel are Japanese. The hotel was kept clean, even at the busiest of times, and I really enjoyed my stay. The in-capsule tablets allowed me to access Netflix on the 40" TV in the theater capsules, which was great!   The amount of toiletries you have access to is incredible. Coming back to the sento bath and steam room every night was a real pleasure and really

helped me sleep. A few of the guests can be noisy and inconsiderate, so the earplugs in the capsules are a real plus. Despite the noise, I slept very well indeed.   There are lots of places to eat around the hotel and the staff can give you recommendations too. There's a supermarket one street over if you want to buy food and snacks to take home. I took home several bottles of sake since they can be imported into Hong Kong tax-free.   All in all, an excellent stay and I'd gladly stay there again. I enjoyed my stay at the hotel and enjoyed the sake and shochu available at the bar. On my first night, I asked for a few of the accompanying dishes with my sake and since it was already late, I got them gratis and was told to enjoy my stay! The little dishes were lovely.  Note that the hotel does get busy and if you want one of the fancy special pillows, get one early. The same goes for breakfast; one morning I got up there half an hour before breakfast was over and literally had to scrape the pot for leftover curry. All of the hardboiled eggs were gone too. I wake up with low blood sugar, so I need to eat before I get moving or I'm uncomfortable until I get food in my belly. I had to make do with a few teaspoons of curry, white rice, miso and some Calpis before I set off for a real meal.

restaurants.name: Grilled Chicken Sapporo Kushidori Ogikubo Eki West Entrance
Hakata Motsu nabe Satsumadori Fukumon Ogikubo
Gyoza no Osho Ogikubo Station West Entrance

reviews: We stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of our 4 week stay in Japan and we are looking forward to returning here for another few nights before we leave. The location is excellent - a very short walk to a well connected station, beautiful little streets all around and lots of good food options. The ryokan combines the traditional (tatami mats, futons, robes) with modern amenities (super clean shared showers and bathroom) and the hosts are extremely friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed the tasty and beautifully presented breakfasts! We will definitely recommend this place to family and friends as a must stay in Tokyo. Thank you for a great stay!

I could not fault the Ito. Great location near subway and so many great eating options, cloud like doonas, delicious breakfast for only 550 yen and the most amazing helpful kind staff. A wonderful neighborhood and experience.

Il ryokan non è distante da una fermata della metro grigia, ningyocho. Lo gestisce la fantastica Chicako e avrete l'occasione di provare un ritorno al passato. Dormire sul tatami non è poi così male, consigliata la colazione tradizionale. Ci è piaciuto.

If you are looking for a nice, quiet spot in Tokyo, try Ito Ryokan! It s close to transportation, has good dining options close by, and has a very welcoming staff. The rooms are comfortable with futons on tatami. There is abreast shower on the ground floor (never had to wait) and a luxuriously deep bathtub of the second floor. Breakfast is great...and you can’t beat the ¥500 price!

Il Ryokan è assolutamente perfetto, molto caratteristico, pulito e lo staff è davvero gentilissimo. All'arrivo siccome ero un pò in difficoltà, chiesi aiuto ad un ragazzo per strada che chiamò la struttura...la manager venne a prendermi lei con un ombrello visto che pioveva... una gentilezza unica. Mi fece anche provare 1 kimono meraviglioso. La zona è perfetta e vicina a diverse stazioni metro dov'è possibile recarsi ovunque!!

Guest House En is located not far from asakusa station exit/entrance gate no.5. You only need to walk less than a minute then you can find it easily. The prayer room was very clean and tidy. It's very recommended for moslem because it has its own prayer room.

Guest house en have comfortable pray room... the location is only 300 m from sta. Akasuka. I recomended this guest house for stay if you want to visit akasuka. In this place also available money changer. Nice place!!!

We stayed in the Guesthouse En for two nights. The Guesthouse is just 2 Min from Asakusa Station and has a great view to Tokyo Skytree and Asahi Building. The Room for 8 Person has enough space and has 1xshower and 2xtoillets, clean and nice. Pocket WiFi available. We recommend the Guesthouse for groups.

We booked it last minute, and honestly one of the best hostel we’ve ever stayed in! So clean, so convinient, located directly in front of the famous sumida river, in which you can have the nice view of the tokyo sky tower. The reception was super kind and really helpful. On top of that, there is a cafe directly in front of our room... meaning.... unlimited supply of beers! Nice vibes too. Love it

A comfortable guest house which a muslim friendly and close to the tourismn spot and very near to the asakusa station! Staff is so friendly, i can do a pray at the 2nd floor, sometimes you can experience the japanese culture with the local such as write kanji caligraphy. Some available there :  ●Currency exchange ●wifi rental ●translator rental ●baggage room also you can use even you didn't stay there. The cafe also so comfortable!

Zacznę od ogólnego wrażenia kiedy wszedłem po raz pierwszy do pokoju. BARDZO dużo miejsca, kiedy szukałem hotelu w Tokio byłem załamany wielkością pokoi, i wtedy pojawiło się M-1 które miażdży konkurencję ogromem pokoi. Co do czystości nie mam żadnych zastrzeżeń, dywany podkurzane, podłogi pomyte, kuchnia jak i łazienka wręcz lśnią. Wspomnę jeszcze o wyposażeniu, w kuchni znajdziemy wszystkie podstawowe rzeczy takie jak szklanki, talerze oraz sztućce które aż lśnią od czystości.  Ostatnią rzeczą o której chcę wspomnieć jest łazienka. Jak na Japońskie standardy jest ona ogromna! Całość jest podzielona na dwie częsci-  1. W której mamy ubikacje umywalkę oraz pralkę(przy pralce czeka na nas płyn do prania jak i wszystkie mydełka do rąk.  2.Tutaj znajduję się wanna z prysznicem oraz
wszystkie kosmetyki do kąpieli(szampon i odżywka)  To wszystko co mogę powiedzieć o tym mieszkaniu, był to mój pierwszy raz w m-1 ale na pewno nie ostatni.

De todo lo que se puede demandar: Camas amplias y cómodas, calefaccion, baño separado, wc separado, cocina con nevera y microondas, agua de cortesia, instrucciones perfectas, puedes hacer el ckecin tu solo, te vienen luego a informarte, todo muy sencillo, limpio y para ser tokyo se ajusta bastante a los requerimientos de los europeos. Aunque un poco apartado, está cerca del metro y en ubicacion tranquila. Ideal para descansar y desplazarse por Tokyo. Excepcional.

This place is an outstanding value for money option for people visiting Tokyo. M1 Kamata is situated about 15 mins by train from Haneda Airport in one direction and Shinagawa, a major rail gateway to the rest of Tokyo and Japan, in the other. It’s an easy 10 mins stroll to Keikyu Kamata Station or the JR rail line. The premises itself is clean and modern. The room was slightly larger than I usually see in Tokyo with a seperate toilet, bathroom, and kitchen area. Access codes to the main entrance and room doors were provided in advance and they have a really cool   Keyless lock system. 5g wifi was super fast, the TV had a built in Netflix option, there is a washing machine and drying facility, aircon / heating,  and a 7/11 virtually opposite to pick up brekky and other

necessities. My travel party are a hard to please bunch and they were also delighted with their stay. I can highly recommend this place for the savvy, cost conscious traveler who doesn’t mind a walk and wants a great place to stay without all the 5 star frills and cost.

Para ser tokyo gran espacio, tiene refri, camas dobles, microondas, calentador agua, lavadora.  En comparación otros hoteles un gran espacio, un poco desorden en la entrada por la zapatos de los otros huéspedes (muchos zapatos no hay espacio para pasar)

El lugar es ideal, una habitación con todas las prestaciones. La puerta blindada, cocina equipada, cama muy cómoda, el baño perfecto. Nos recibieron en un perfecto inglés y nos informaron de las normas.  Existe cerca a unos 200 mts estación de tren y muy cerca supermercado.  El lugar es ideal aunque esté a las afueras del centro, tranquilidad y comodidad.

The room is tiny just slightly wider than the mattress on tatami. It also has a small television showing only Japanese channels, WiFi is available. The rooms are spotless with snowy towels and kimono. The shared showers and lavatories are also fantastically clean, but there are only two showers for two floors. There is a washing machine and microwave. The owner speaks a little English.
