The only downside of this place is it has a strict curfew, I arrived from the UK at 10.30 and could not get there for 11.30 (the cut off time) so had to pay but spend the night at the airport

I really loved Fukusen and my small and clean room with futon bed and rice pillow. You get free tea and hot water, the showers are good and there is a microwave in the lobby. But best of all was the staff – all of them. They were so warm and smiley all the time. They learned some words in Swedish which was really cute, and they always welcomed me with big smiles. When I left after six days, the two receptionists and the cleaning lady followed me to outside, waving goodbye until I couldn't see them anymore. They definitely have a piece of my Tokyo heart. The area is ok. There are a bunch of restaurants, convenient stores etc. All the people I met in the area was super friendly and much more social and curious than they are in the city centre. If you are like me and like walking,
it is possible to go to Ueno, Asakusa and even Ahkihabara by feet. For the price, the location is great, according to me.

The hotel is not the best i've been in my entire life (looks talking) but to be in Tokyo was very very cheap (6000 yen for 2 nights). 4 minutes walk from the metro station. Clean hotel, maybe too close to the rails so maybe ask for a quite room. I had one. The owners, a couple i believe, are super super nice. Just choose Fukusen!

Environment: Minami senju is a small residential area but it is quite perfect if you want to have a good nights rest. The Hibiya line where Minami senju is located, is really convenient because it's just one ride to great stops like Ueno, Akihabara, Roponggi, Ginza & Tsukiji & Naka-Meguro (for Yokohama). Outside the station, it's quiet and low key. Santouka supermarket is right at the train entrance along with Lawson and McDonalds. Burger King and Dennys several meteres further from the station. There's a cheap ramen place opposite the road. So if you're hungry and want a cheap fast meal, you have options. We had out takeout dinners from Santouka for 200-400¥ which is very cheap. And beside, Fukusen is just a mere 3 mins by foot. Also, if you want a more elevated dining

experience, you can try Obana for their eel (kabayaki) (best in Tokyo) less than 100m further down from the hotel.  Hotel: its a small family-managed hotel, so please don't compare this to a backpackers' inn. The kind of atmosphere here isone of mutual respect, noise reduction and privacy. Most tenants Ive encountered were out of town businessmen, quiet Asian tourists. No loud brash tourists who loiter in the common room. So expect things to be more like a hotel than a hostel.   Facilities/Rules: The curfew 1130 is manageable, so it's not a deal breaker. We arrive usually 8-10 after a looong day, so it was not an issue. The sento bath was rarely utilized by the tenants so if might have the chance to have it for yourself.  There is no common area to lounge around but they have a computer cubcle if you need to surf. Besides if you have a tab + fast hotel wifi, you can surf in your room. The two showers have great pressure, easy & fast temp control and the place is clean.  No experience of lining for the shower so far.  Each floor has a ref and a microwave for your food needs. You eat inside your room.  The rooms are SPOTLESS! No graffiti or dustbunnies. It was not claustrophobic to say the least. The A/c was cold. Caveat tho: no elevator. So if you have heavy luggage, I suggest you transfer your cargo piecemeal to the groundfloor and pack it there in the lobby. That is if you don't want to experience the joys of an herniated disc. Also, the traintracks are near the hotel so you might be disturbed by the sounds. Trains stop 12am. Lastly, doors open 5am but i think reception opens at 8am tho.  Staff/service: the staff were courteous and hospitable. They gave us directions to Obana, had small conversations on Tagalog equivalents of daily expressions, lent us an umbrella when we arrived early for check in, brought our luggages to our rooms while we were away, cleaned our rooms daily, provided us w/ towels and yukata. Overall, just like any other hotel but on a smaller but more intimate scale.  Pricepoint: Cheap! Consider the location, service and amenities... This is one of your best options for Tokyo.

restaurants.name: Indian Restaurant Phulbari Minami-Senju Eki Mae

reviews: We thought this place was just great value paying £84 per night for our initial stay and £67 on our last night before returning to the UK. It really has everything you need including washer dryer, powder, iron, fridge freezer etc etc. Rooms were spotless and very comfortable. Location is calm which we liked given how busy the rest of Tokyo is. 10 mins to the subway and about 25 mins to the nearest JR station. Convenient for Narita airport with direct access on the Keisei line but note this line is not covered by the Japan Rail Pass.

Stayed two nights here with my wife and kids. Very friendly receptionnat the front desk. Our room on the sixth floor had plenty of space and was well equipped with everything we needed. Good wifi and free coffee. Very clean. Short walk to the Skytree area with breakfest and lunch options.

Small apartment rather than just a hotel room, super friendly and helpful staff and a good location near Skytree. Price very reasonable and would definite stay again. They also provide a mobile phone to take out with you

Ultra modern apartment.  Everything you need. View overlooking Skytree. Staff helpful and friendly. Good location for skytree and underground.  On a quiet road. Comfy bed. What more could you want! Provide complimentary mobile phone. All facilities in apartment e.g. hob fridge freezer washer drying room. Shower bath loo tv balcony. Would stay again.

If you can get a deal, look into booking this place. We spent 4 days here and were happy. The regular price is a little too much though.  It's an "apart-hotel" meaning you get your own tiny apartment. There's ample storage space for luggage (2 closets + space under the bed), TV, full kitchen (cooker, microwave, fridge, freezer, kettle), work table, free and fast wifi, standard japanese bathroom (shower + soak tub), standard japanese toilet/washlet, washer/dryer combo (ideal for longer stay), AC, a little balcony, a comfortable bed and an extendable sofa bed. Towels are provided. Free coffee in the morning at the reception.  The property is in a residential area and is about 10 minutes walk from Tokyo Skytree / Oshiage station. Direct access to Narita airport via the Narita Sky
Access trains. Walking distance to Asakusa district for Senso-ji and other attractions.

restaurants.name: Ginghis Khan Sapporo Daiichi Tokyo Sky Tree Ekimae
Yakitori Dagojiru Satsumaya Tokyo Sky Tree Station
Nanas Green Tea Tokyo Skytree Town Solamachi

reviews: For me, this place suited our travel to explore the city of Tokyo (6 nights stay). Hamamatsucho and daimon station are near that you can access to go in different parts of Tokyo. The place have enough space and very clean. Also, looking from different hotel reviews and compared prices this hotel met my criteria so far.  Will definitely go back next time since we were not able to visit some museum and other tourist attractions as they were closed due to corona virus outbreak.

This hotel is a little gem in a fantastic area of Tokyo. Staff and facilities are great. All the rooms are large (by Japan standards), the bed was firm but very comfortable and the room facilities were great (although not much storage). We will definitely be using This hotel again when we’re in Tokyo.

I have stayed in 3 different Tokyo hotels on this trip alone.  This was by far the best one as well as the least expensive.  Had a large room with a king bed and a twin + breakfast for $145.  The other 2 hotels I stayed in were much more expensive and the rooms were much smaller.  Highly recommend.

The place is considered near to the subway and railway. The rooms were large enough for the 4 of us and they have really hard pillows that can support my side sleep position. It would be better if they could have a different variety of food for breakfast in the morning. The staff at the restaurants were very helpful to us too. We bought a cake for my kid's birthday and they allowed us to be seated in the restaurant for cake cutting and provided us with the plates and fork to eat the cakes back in our rooms.

Stayed at this hotel for four nights, unfortunately one if the nights was during he tornado and earthquake but that wasn’t the hotels fault. A nice central location although don’t expect ad nice view the rooms look out upon a car park. Bk us having breakfast included with a choice of traditional Japan breakfast, continental of nearly a fried breakfast. Nice room with a futon type bed, enjoyed the stay.

restaurants.name: Shabu Shabu Yakiniku Tabehoudai Merino Ginza
Sake to Koshitsu Izakaya Maguro Daihyo-dan ta Daihyo

amenities: Fitness Centre with Gym / Workout Room
reviews: We chose to stay in Odaiba simply because hotels are a bit cheaper here. Hotel has a brilliant entrance and lobby. Rooms were very practical and clean. Not as luxurious rooms as other places in Asia but Japan is more minimalistic which is also great. They really took care of our child. They mistakenly took his towel we brought with us with the rest of the hotel towels and struggled to find it as it was also white. However housekeeping asked us to buy a new one and deduct it from the bill. A very nice lady in the main lobby cafeteria also arranged milk for our child which she didn't charge. Overall very good hotel close to a mall and to a train station.

It is vrry good located, connected to aqua city shopping mall as well as a train station. The breakfast was great, room was comfortable, bath is good. Room views is also top overlooking the bay, the rainbow bridge and statue of liberty. Staff are very polite and helpful

I stayed here for 50 days on a business trip.  Throughout  the entire time the service of the staff was top notch.  Check in was very smooth with managers always on hand during busy periods to help.   The pool area and hot tubs are very nice.  The gym leaves something to be desired.    The breakfast was excellent, a very good mix of East and West in terms of the food offered.    I didn't eat at the hotel ever as there were not any casual dining options.    The location on Odaiba was perfect.  The metro station was right outside the hotel.  There are four malls with lots of stores, restaurants, and entertainment within a 20 minute walk from the hotel.

We booked this hotel based upon location and to use the pool for our son. No notice was given regarding the pool being closed until after we arrived for check-in. The check-in clerk handed us a sheet of paper which stated it was closed for “Big Sporting Event” which we presumed was the Olympics. Rather disappointing

Great hotel, great environment, excellent service. One of the best i’ve ever stayed. Maybe the breakfast foods needs more menu but overall taste also great. And the room is spacey which is great in japan.

restaurants.name: Sushi Tamakagari Tempura Tamagoromo Grand Nikko Tokyo Odaiba
Tsukiji Dining Genchan Aqua City Odaiba

reviews: Rooms are small (maybe 90 sq ft) but that's expected in greater Tokyo.  Good value for what you get.  Well managed hotel and I was actually surprised how well run hotel is.  Only minor negatives are rooms lack safety box and hard to figure out how to call front desk from phone in the room.  Didn't notice any english instructions on how to use phone.  Hotel can even be more efficient if they allow guests in some way to indicate whether new towels, supplies are needed.  Didn't need my room cleaned or made up but housekeeper still left a bag of towels, supplies outside the door every day.  Room provided a lot of stuff (like pyjamas) you don't normally see at hotels, esp budget hotels.  Great location as mita line station is like 100 m from the hotel and the JR line station is only

like 200 m from the hotel.  Very impressed with this APA hotel, which is first one I stayed at.    I assume it's standard policy to charge extra for early check in, like 1,000 Y for checking in 1.5 hrs before normal 3 pm check in time even though I would be check out at 6:45 am rather than the usual ~11 am check out time.  Well organized area in front of reception area to store your luggage.  Clean room.  Bathroom is small.  Maybe 25% larger than bathroom on cruise ship.    I visited onsen on 14 th floor but never tried out.  Stayed here 4 nights in Dec.

Location is good since the subway is just a few steps from the hotel entrance. Like all Tokyo hotels, price is pretty steep but what you are paying for is the convenience.   This was literally one of the smallest hotels I have stayed in (comparable to room size and price of Singapore hotels). Once you open the door to your room, there is a bathroom to your right and the bed which pretty much occupies the entire room. The walking space inside the room is negligible so avoid bringing large luggage as this will be difficult to open and will just eat up room space.   The room has a large flat screen TV (this is Japan so I would expect nothing less than modern conveniences :) which is probably the best part, but I dont think I noticed any English channels.   The worst part about the

room was the smell of the bathroom. It smelled like urine even if we had just arrived and havent even used it. Even after the help cleaned the room, the smell of urine stayed. I am not sure if it has something to do with the material of the toilet. They have a deodorizing spray but it does nothing to help.   There are toiletries available in the bathroom (shampoo, conditioner, liquid body soap) and they also have other items like shavers, hair ties, hair caps, toothbrushes.   Another good thing was the hot tub at the top of the hotel. I used the women's hot tub and (of course) you have to cleanse yourself prior and need to be completely naked. It wasnt awkward for me even if it was my first time. The water was very relaxing.

Basically it is a decent location, next to the subway station, very near Sugamo Jizodori Shopping Street.  The main reason and what I do like about the hotel is the onsen.  It is not very easy to get an onsen hotel in Tokyo.  Unfortunately, the room given to me, when I turned on the aircon had the smell of cigarettes.  Though it was a non-smoking room and floor.  Fortunately, the staff arranged for me to change rooms within the same floor.  But because of the "unfortunate event" the staff asked me to check the aircon vent.  That is when I saw how filthy it was.  Granted that I do not normally check the aircon vents in the hotels, I stay in.  This was was really bad, I asked the hotel to clean it the next day when I was out; I am sure they did.  But hope they will not wait till
we complain to clean the aircon filters and vents.  I tried to take a photo, but it was too dark; so even after they did clean it, it obviously needs much more cleaning.

I have stayed in APA every time when I visit Japan. This APA hotel is just 2 minutes away from JR Sugamo Station and just a few stations from the Skyliner Nippori station to Narita station and a few stops from Ikebukuro station, where basically you can get everything there. There is a seven eleven, Matsuya beef bowl shop and Family Marts and lots of restaurants in the area.  The room is a typical Japanese standard of cleanliness and tidiness. The onsen on 14th floor is a bonus to relax at night. Staff are nice. You get everything needed like bathrobe, sleepers, toothbrush, shaver, etc. Toilet seat is high tech. The only downside is the insufficient amount of laundry machine.

I have stayed at other APA hotels in Tokyo, but this  one is the BEST!  I will probably stay here again on my next trip.  Sugamo is a quiet neighborhood, with plenty of restaurants.  The hotel is a 2-minute walk from JR station on the Yamanote line, which can get you anywhere you need to be. The hotel is beautiful, and the elevators are fast.  The rooms are typically small, but the two of us had plenty of room in a twin room.  The best thing about this hotel is the onsen on the 14th floor.  Don't be shy, give it a try!   There is only one English-speaking TV station, but that's ok because I use the local shows to improve my Japanese skills!  We did not get to try the restaurant on this trip, but I'm sure the food is great!

5mins walk from Daimon Subway and 8mins walk from JR Hamamatsucho. Located in office district with minimum night life but that means maximum quality rest. Lawson is the nearest convenience store and some eateries (Mac, Mos) nearby.

Close to hamamatsucho and daikon stations, easy to find with a map on your phone.   Checkin staff were friendly and efficient. Room is small but that’s normal for the price range in Tokyo and all I needed was a bed and a shower for a couple of nights so that worked for me.   There was a fridge and a kettle in the room which is all you really need. Everything worked well.   My only moan would be about the pillows which were like rocks. They could do with slightly softer pillows to avoid giving a stiff neck - but maybe that’s due to my age haha

Due to typhoon and flight cancellation, I booked this hotel within 15 mins. Picked this cos it s close to monorail to haneda airport. In fact it takes 15 mins walk from the station. Plenty of restaurants n some convenience stores nearby. But the day i checked in was a public holiday. Most restaurants closed. Most basic amenities r available at lobby. Serve yourself. Room clean-up cost applies but you can reject such svs. They will still provide clean towel every morning. Staff s nice n friendly. Quick checkin and out.

The room offered on the 14th floor, accessible by elevator, turned out to be very small, complete and clearly intended for a short stay.  Breakfast was not included. The hotel is less than 1 km from the ferries to Izu Oshima.

Clean rooms, few minutes walk from public transport, nice staff, felt like a newer hotel, and had tons of single-use amenities like hairbands, face masks, toner, etc... also had a pretty view out the window too.

restaurants.name: Shabu Shabu Yakiniku Tabehoudai Merino Ginza
Sake to Koshitsu Izakaya Maguro Daihyo-dan ta Daihyo

reviews: Never stayed in a hotel this cool and chic before. Did not regret a single day of it.   Although location is a bit far from the train station but the hotel was worth it.  Service was excellent and the people there are really nice.   Would love to go back for sure.

My 10 y/o child and I stayed here while on a trip to Tokyo. She picked a ryokan for the unique experience. We had a great stay - comfortable room with everything you need including Wi-fi, TV, hair dryer, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, facial products, coffee/tea, microwave and fridge in the room. The bottled water and juice in the room was complimentary. The bathroom/shower/bath was incredible - the bath and shower were made from cedar. It smelled amazing. And of course - an amazing toilet.  The lobby offers free beverages and the staff was wonderful. While not many of the staff spoke English, they seemed accustomed to hosting non-Japanese speakers and were very helpful.  The hotel is located about a 15 minute walk from the train station. We felt very safe walking at all times
of the day and night. Plenty of restaurants and convenience stores nearby.

I really enjoyed my stay here. The lobby and the room and everything were downright immaculate. Japan tends to be clean in general, but this was above that bar. My room was comfortable and there were all the amenities I needed, including a refrigerator and microwave, discreetly tucked away in a cabinet. There was a large 50" TV and high-speed internet.  Despite its name, this is not really a ryokan aside from the fairly traditional Japanese theme to the rooms. The beds are contemporary mattresses (just on the floor). This is OK as I wasn't looking for a traditional ryokan. But just be advised if you're looking for the traditional ryokan experience, you should stay elsewhere. This is much more like a hotel with a traditional Japanese twist to it. It's really one part spa-hotel,

one part ryokan, and one part modern hotel.  Pros: All the above. Very good value for the price. The bathtub was in traditional Japanese style. They provide free water and plenty of different toiletries.   Cons: Inconvenient location (this was the major downside) -- it is about a 15 minute walk to the nearest station, which isn't covered by your Tokyo Metro or Toei passes, so expect to pay a bit more for transportation into the city. It is also a bit of a walk to the nearest convenient store. My room had shutters on the window, which may be nice for people who want to sleep late, but they completely shut out the light altogether (it was pitch black in my room at 8am). The maid service comes by pretty early in the morning. There's no "Do Not Disturb" or "Clean Now" signs to put on your door handle, so you either need to be out at 9am or your room won't be cleaned. The TV is really nice, but the channels and movies on demand are only in Japanese, so I didn't really get to enjoy it. They should offer some English options, in my opinion. They do have a BluRay player attached to the TV, so if they had a library of English-language BluRay disks downstairs, that would solve the problem.  Overall, I'm glad I stayed here. It was very comfortable. I'd rate it 4.5 stars out of 5 if I could.

Very positively surprised.Room size,spacy bathroom,hightech toilet.Nice blend of tradition and modern design.2 huge tv.Free drink in lobby plus free drink in fridge in room.Family of 5 can stay comfortably.Quiet.Not far from city if you have car.Sure will be back again.

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and we were really sad to leave! The best part of this hotel is the Japanese bath tub. We literally used it 3 times a day and it was soothing after a long day of walking. The room is quite small but it was good for two people. Bed is super comfortable. The staff here speak very minimal English but they were patient and really nice. We had to leave the room key with the receptionist every time we left the hotel. The walk to the station is about 10 minutes but we didn't mind it at all once we found our way around.

Azabu Ten has really superseded my expectations in terms of customer service. From the outset of my booking, we were greeted warmly and our requests were accommodated without any hassle for our wedding anniversary. Including some fantastic suggestions about how I could even make it more special for my wife!  Special call out to Haruna who was amazing with looking after us.  Would recommend staying here to any traveller.

We had the pleasure of spending 5 nights at this amazing boutique hotel in Tokyo in October. Only one night was prebooked but due to the Typhoon we had to extend our stay. The staff were amazing - so caring and accommodating. Room size was quite decent for Tokyo with a large bathroom, seperate shower and bath and toilet.Quality furnishing - very modern but luxurious.The breakfast was amazing - 4 courses - each course prepared for you by chef and the dinner was awesome. Would highly recommend - 5 min walk to train and very close to Tokyo Tower and all the restaurants and nightlife in Roppongi  but far enough away to be quite noise wise.

Stayed at this hostel during a Typhoon (Hagibis), booking was easy and swift. Staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are tidy with personal lockers. Toilets and showers are clean (on every floor), and there's a shared kitchen and fridge to cook and store your food. There's also a DIY coin-operated laundy service (washer & dryer). Location is good with JR and metro options to get around - though a bit far from the busy parts of Tokyo like Shibuya & Shinjuku. This is a quiet and family-friendly hostel where many travellers come and go so don't expect a party atmosphere. Great for those using it as a respite from their busy schedule to relax and continue your travel plans.

Lovely and clean place. The showers were lovely with shampoo and conditioner provided! Lounge space was nice downstairs and the beds were comfy and had a curtain for privacy. Train station is close to get into the main parts of town.

5 star stay. Don't think twiceabout booking here. The rooms and showers and washrooms are very clean, the staff is super friendly and went above and beyond to help us, and the location is very accessible

If I visit Tokyo, I always use here! It’s cheap and clean place!! And nice location for enjoying around Tokyo! It’s close to Ikebukuro, Shinjuku... it takes 30 minutes from here to Tokyo! The staff is friendly and kind. Also the place is cute!

My friend and I chose the Hop Step Inn as we really wanted a private room and for as much as we'd pay to share a dorm we were able to get a room here. We reasoned that the price was because it was a bit out of town, however in Tokyo that's not an issue as you're likely to use public transport a lot anyway.  We arrived and they were friendly and hospitable (my friend speaks great Japanese but they spoke great English) and when we asked to change rooms (we were given a double but wanted a twin) they were happy to just give us another room key.  It was clean, quiet and unlike many other hostels came with all the extras you'd more often associate with a hotel (free toiletries, regularly cleaned bedsheets and replaced towels etc).   It's so easy to find, right next to Oji station (5

minute walk) and with a 7/11, bars, cafes, restaurants etc all within as treet or two, you can't complain about the location.  Checking out was also the easiest it could be. I handed in the key card and got my deposit back.  Honest, well run, good value hostel. Can't recommend it highly enough

都内の小旅行で利用しました。 スーパーホテルさんは何店か利用していたので、「プレミア」に期待して訪問。 やっぱり1番のプレミア感は部屋の最新設備ですね。大画面テレビはテレビ用途以外にも、スマホのミラーリング、YouTube、AbemaTVなど利用できBSも見られました。 驚いたのは照明で、明るさや色合いをタブレットで調節できました。このタブレットは照明、エアコン、テレビを操作可能で、最近のホテルはすごいなと感嘆しきりでした。 朝食は少数精鋭でしょうか。クロワッサンタマゴサンドが良かったです。でもお値段的にはもう少し目玉品が欲しかったかな。 皆さん触れている「エレベーター1台」問題はやはり混む時間は大変。外階段が使えますが、さすがに12階からの往復は厳しいですね。 でも従業員さんも感じがいいし、総じてお値段以上ではないでしょうか。
ビジネスホテルなので広くはありませんが、充分です。 プチソファーもテーブルもありました。 窓からは、スカイツリー 川沿いのテラスからは神田川。 女性には洗顔など5点選べるプレゼント。 動画配信で韓国ドラマ見たり、ミラーリングで映画観賞して過ごしました。 お風呂の混み具合は、部屋のタブレットで調べることができるので空いているときに行きました。 キーが暗証番号なので、無くす心配もありません。

都心にいながら天然温泉STAYができました。秋葉原の駅からも近く、ホテルの裏が川なので比較的静かな環境でした。エレベーターが1台しかないので多少の不便さは感じましたが、許容範囲内です。フロント横のラウンジにはテラス席もあり、湯上りにのんびり過ごさせていただきました。コロナ禍でお酒のサービスは停止中でしたが、その分、お得に泊まれましたで良しとします。部屋はコンパクトながら、使いやすくまとめられていて良かったです。掃除も行き届いていて清潔でした。室内の設備は備品のタブレットで全て操作できるので、ベッドに寝転がったまま、週末のダメ人間生活でリラックスさせていただきました。

フランス在住の者です。娘が一人で利用。途中、数日大阪にも移動しなければならず、でもその間に荷物を預かっておいてくださったり、また郵送物を受け取り保管。渡してくださったり、それらの問い合わせにもメールですぐに支配人自ら対応。レセプションの方達も本当に親切で、仕事に必要な情報（接待場所など）も提供してくださったそう。最後にはレセプションの女性が手書きのお手紙を部屋においてくださったりもして、娘も驚いていました。本当にありがとうございました。
這酒店屬SUPER HOTEL 集團中較高等級的PREMIER 系列，2/F 設有天然溫泉，東京都內算比較少有。在2019年才剛落成，裝設十分新淨，房內提供一部平板電腦，可以控制房內的不同氣氛的燈光、電視開關，更可以看到溫泉是否濟湧。但，整座酒店只有一部電梯，繁忙時間或會有點不便。

I have stayed for three months here. Staff were pleasant and will assist you in a heartbeat. There is a small resto at the lobby which serves only breakfast and closes around 10AM. For lunch and dinner, you will have to go out and walk along the main road which is about 10 away. Nakameguro station is approx 15-20mins walk.

restaurants.name: Osaka Yakiniku Horumon Futago Naka-Meguro Annex

reviews: 池尻大橋からすぐのホテルです。渋谷からのタクシー代をキャッシュバックしてくれるプランがありそれを利用しました。  スタッフの方はキビキビとした感じでチェックインもかなりスムーズで待たされなかった。  客室はコンパクトながらスタイリッシュな感じでした。ベッドがシモンズで寝心地が良かったです。  最大の特徴はラウンジで、無料のドリンクバーとソフトクリームがついています。クラフトビールの販売もしており、簡単なおつまみの販売も。  隣はコンビニですし、テイクアウトやデリバリーでご飯を買って飲むのも良い。テレワークやおこもりにもよいと思います  他にもアメニティバーがあったり、コインランドリーの使用状況が部屋のテレビで確認できたり、随所にこだわりを感じました

池尻大橋駅徒歩5分 2019年6月27日開業 【ACT HOTEL(アクトホテル）】  仕事帰りに「渋谷駅からタクシーでGO！プラン」を使って 友人と宿泊してきました。 いまだけ！渋谷駅周辺からホテルまでの 片道タクシー代（上限1,000円）をキャッシュバックいただけます～  この日は終日、歩き回った日だったので 渋谷からはたった1駅だけれどとっても楽ちん  大通りに面していて、成城石井、マクドナルド、、、 周りにはたくさんのお店もあり駅チカでとっても便利  電動レンタサイクルも無料で貸し出してくれるので 三軒茶屋、中目黒、代官山、 下北沢あたりだって自転車なら10分♪ 六本木までは30分弱でいけちゃいます♪  エントランスエリアはバー・ラウンジと 一体型のデザイン性重視空間で とってもおしゃれ  雑誌や各言語のガイドブック、漫画（英語表記）が読み放題  ソフトクリーム、コーヒー、ソフトドリンク系は なんと無料サービス！！！ ＊クラフトビールやおつまみ系は有料  部屋に持ち帰ることももちろんOK！ ドリンクにソフトクリームを浮かべれば、 コーヒーフロートの完成！！！  バルミューダの電子レンジやトースターもあるので 近くの美味しいパン屋さんのパンを温め直すこともできます♪  部屋には40インチ以上の大型テレビ・最先端のVODシステム ・高速FREE Wi-Fiを標準装備  すべての寝具が世界で愛され続けているシモンズ製  ＤＨＣのスキンケア（クレンジング、洗顔料、ローション、乳液） ボディスポンジ、入浴剤、ティーパック、 コンタクト洗浄（有料100円）、汗ふきシート（有料200円）など アメニティも充実しているので、手ぶらでも不便ありません  長期滞在の方用にコインランドリーなど、 必要なものすべてが揃っています。  近所にはナノバブルの体験できる
近代的銭湯もあります！  宿泊だけでなく、30分500円、 最大12時間　4000円という破格値プランもあるので テレワークなどにも使えます！  ビジネスや、女子会、カップル、お一人様でも♪ ペット同伴できる部屋も1部屋あり！  暮らすように連泊されている 常連さんの姿もありました。  翌朝も早起きしてフルで一日使えて 大充実の1日に、、、  また利用したい！！！
とても綺麗な新しいホテル。 ドリンクバー無料。ソフトクリーム食べ放題も嬉しい。池尻大橋駅から3分くらいですが、渋谷からタクシーでワンメーター。 タクシーの領収書を出すと、¥1000までキャッシュバックあり。嬉しい！ 1階にはオシャレなワークスペースもあり、 テレワークで使うのも良いかも。 お部屋はシンプルな感じも好きです！ ベッドがシモンズで感激でした。

池尻大橋から徒歩3分 渋谷駅からは離れていますが なんと渋谷駅からのタクシーの領収書をフロントで提示すれば キャッシュバックされるというキャンペーン中でした！ 荷物多い時とかすごいありがたいサービス…  フリースペースは ドリンク飲み放題！アイスクリーム食べ放題！ 電源使い放題！Wi-Fiも通ってる！ という ノマドワーカーには天国のような環境 客室もベッドとテレビが大きく 清潔感がありました！ 客室には仕事机がないから フリースペースで仕事した方がいいかもですね！  近くにはマクドナルドやコンビニ、スーパーもあるので 食事も困りませんでした  一般的なビジネスホテルより ベッドが大きいように思いました！ のびのび過ごせました〜！
まだ新しくオープンした頃でオープン記念価格？で利用しました。 とても綺麗で、必要な分は十分でした。 カウンターも半自動なのはフルサービス受けて人と会うより気楽に利用できたと思います。 入るのもカードキーが必要です。 良いホテルだと思います。
すごい盛況ぶりですね。 ヘビーサウナーなら 毎日ここに来こなきゃ真のサウナーじゃないね！ 私みたいなただのサウナ風呂好きは、 露店なのに冷たいジャグジーとか 開店前のパチ屋の、 並んで整理券を貰って抽選するサウナとか それが過ぎると閉まるサウナとか、 風呂好きにはついていけません。 たぶん海外のお風呂はこうなんでしょう。  日本人のダメなサウナ風呂好きじゃなく サウナーの方々の聖地でした
旧オアシスを最新式にリニューアルしたサウナ施設。サウナ浴室等とにかく狭い。待ち行列が出来るほど混雑している。料金体系も説明も無く帰るとき機械での清算。2時間くらいで3980円。しかもサウナのみで。休憩室も混んでて待ち行列。これでは癒やしにもならない。
とても過ごしやすい施設です。何度か行ってますが、やはり平日の夕方までの間が一番空いてておすすめです。土日は15時くらいを過ぎるとソファが全く空いていないのでツライ。薪サウナがなかなか完成しないようで、それだけが待ち遠しいです。

池袋に2019年年末に出来た注目の男性限定のサウナ施設に、2020年1月早速行ってきました。  池袋は普段使用しない駅とあり巨大な地下通路が分かりにくいですが、出るべき出口から出れば徒歩30秒ととても分かりやすい立地です。ちなみにJRの改札からは5~7分くらい歩くと思います。  もちろん施設は新しいのでとても綺麗で、サウナや水風呂の温度も最高でした。休憩室はリクライニングチェアや寝っ転がれる半個室のスペースもあり◎至る所にフルーツの入った冷水が置いてあるのも助かります。またワーキングスペースなどもあり、パソコンを持っていけば軽い仕事くらいは出来ます。  強いてデメリットを上げるならば、基本エレベーター移動なので2基しかないのは若干のストレス。そして混んでいるということもありますが、中でもグループ連れが多いのでサウナや休憩室がうるさいです。「喋ってもいい雰囲気」が出来上がってしまっています。サウナの入り口に「お静かに！」という旨の張り紙はあったものの効果を発揮はしていませんでした。  値段に関しては色々なところで「高い」と言われていますが、個人的には少し高くても静かにゆっくりできる清潔な空間にこれからなって行ってくれるといいなと思います。
充実のサウナ、充実の水風呂、そして充実の休憩スペースとサウナーのツボをわかった設計。アクセスもいいが、それゆえにめちゃくちゃ混んでる。客数を絞るには値上げとなるかもしれないが、経済的に頻繁には使いにくくなるし難しいところ

I stayed at Nippori Livemaxx while my stay at Tokyo.  Location wise, it is 5 minutes’ walk from Sendagi tube station, 15 minutes’ walk from Nippori (JR station) and 30minutes from the Ueno park so quite convenient. There are a few restaurants and small supermarkets close by. The zoo is 30 minutes walk. The rooms, in spite of being really small, have a window and they are well equipped with kettles, microwave, hair dryers and all the toiletries you can think of.  Customer service was efficient and quick.  There’s a lift but a little steep 5 steps at the entrance that could be a challenge for someone disabled or elderly. Overall, I certainly recommend this hotel if you are looking for some budget place well connected.

It locates in residential area result in having a very peace night. There are supermarket and convenient store next door. Consequently, auto-vendor machines are standing in front of the door. It's very easy to get any food or drink anytime, even in the midnight. However, it's a little bit far away from JR instead of metro. Suggest that arranging traffic plan by metro will be easier.

I love this hotel. Even though the room size was small, everything was nice. The staffs are so friendly and room condition was clean . Hot water and wifi was so good. The location is good to go near subway station.

The best point of the hotel is its location: it's near Nippori station and the neighborhood is really cute, with many little shops and delicious food stalls! We would have never discovered this neighborhood otherwise so for this point we were happy.  The hotel itself, however, is kind of depressing. It's true that it's very cheap, especially for Tokyo, but we could find other hotels with the same price and that were a lot better. This hotel and the room were old and not "fresh". Old stains were on the walls, the hallway was always pretty dark, and most of the amenities were old-fashioned. The reception is very tiny and the front desk staff is hidden behind a tinned glass, so it's really not handy and welcoming to talk with them and ask them for information.  Finally, although we

specified on our online booking that we wanted a non-smoking room, we got a smoking one and we couldn't get rid of the disgusting smell. We think they don't speak English (we only spoke with them in Japanese) so that's why they didn't get our request on our booking (entirely written in English). We were happy it was just two nights and we won't go back there.

The best thing about this hotel is that it is cheap for Tokyo and easy to get to and from. My husband and I stayed here for three nights in January 2015. I don't think that we would stay here again.  The bed was comfortable, but a small double, which is a squeeze for two people. The room smelled very smoky, and as far as we could tell, I think that there are only smoking rooms, no non-smoking rooms. To add insult to injury, we only got the window open once. After that, it jammed. We were stuck using the air conditioning all the time to get fresh air into the room, which left me quite cold.  The room said that it had a kitchenette, so we imagined that there would be some way to cook. This actually meant that it had a small fridge and a microwave. There are no cooking tools or any
kind of cooker.  The receptionist didn't really speak any English at all, but that was ok as we figured out how everything worked anyway.  Access to Narita airport from this hotel is really good.

This place is truly exceptional - I felt at home and know that I now have a family in Tokyo: Uncle Jij. He was so nice and so interesting and cool to talk to (he travelled a lot when he was young!) and at the same he was never “too much”. He really touched me. In fact a couple of other guests in the hostel were people who had already stayed here before. Once you discover this place, I don’t think it’s possible to go elsewhere. Location is also perfect, close to so many stations (including Kanda at 6 min walk and Tokyo at 15 min walk) and in a quiet street. Dorm is good too with comfy bed and duvet, and very clean. Wifi works great. And last but not least the price is unbeatable for Tokyo... To sum up: the best hostel I’ve ever stayed in!!

I loved the location of Backpacker`s Mini house - it`s a 15min walk from Tokyo Station, but I recommend Otemachi Station (Exit 2b or 2c), from there it`s a 2min walk. Otemachi is perfectly connected with five subway lines. The accommodation itself is small but sufficient. As everyone who enters will cross the small common room you will meet a lot of the other guests, mostly you will meet Jiji. Jiji is a talkative and super nice host, who travelled as a backpacker in his younger age. He wants to give each visitor a good memory for their stay in Tokyo. I loved talking to him! The beds were the most comfortable I`ve ever had in a Hostel! Each bed has a curtain and plugs. In the shower you can use free shampoo/conditioner and body soap. Jiji was too nice and let me have a free
breakfast even though I was way too late for it!! He even kept my luggage for free after my check-out.  The only thing I didn`t like was the missing cleanliness of the sink.

Destiny brought us together in a cold winter night in Tokyo. The landlord is a 73-year-old man with friendly and warm heart who welcomed my sister and I when we arrived. He was so worried that we might be loss or anything. But the distance between this hostel and Kanda JR station(1 stop away from Tokyo station) is actually a 6-8 minutes walk. It is hard to believe there is still a little cozy place waiting for us in such a big city in Japan. It was the last night of my 6-day journey, and I didnt ask more but a place to stay overnight for my flight next morning. But this hostel and grandpa "Jij" was just beyond my expectation. He kindly shared everything we wanted to know and even took us to dinner. He patiently introduced all the raw fish we were eating and about the Japanese

food. He was also a backpacker like us when he was young. And after he retired 2 years ago, he decided to make this hostel a "home away from home" to those who was travel alone like him. He woke up at 5 to prepare a really great breakfast box for us to eat on the way to the airport. To be frank, I almost burst into tears when we left Jij. There is no such place that I would like to come back again so much. The heart-melting smile has already built a really tight bonding between us and trust me you will feel the same. 從來沒有一間民宿會讓我有強烈的慾望想再度回來. 爺爺非常溫暖及熱情. 他年輕時也是背包客, 兩年前退休蓋了一棟自己的民宿提供給像我們一樣的旅人. 他喜歡聊天, 喜歡分享關於他的關於東京的關於人生的任何事情. 爺爺幫我們舖好溫暖的床舖. 特地早起準備隔天的早餐讓我們帶上火車吃. 他讓我想到自己的爺爺. 希望你們也能親自去感受看看, 一起認識這個可愛又很棒的爺爺.

This hostel is a little bit difficult to find as it's small and hasn't got a big sign to indicate it's presence. It is a 3 storey building in a small street in Chiyoda and is about 15-20 min walk from Tokyo Station. This hostel is near numerous restaurants and bars/clubs (2 min walk).    We got greeted by a lovely gentleman who was very welcoming and accommodating. He showed us our room and the facilities available. As we were only staying for one night, he asked what time we would leave the following day so he could arrange our breakfast prior to our departure ( breakfast is free). This was such a nice gesture which we couldn't say no to no matter how rushed we are for our next trip. We got the room of 4-bunk beds to ourselves so it felt like a our own private en suite room.

I couldn't false the hospitality this gentleman has given us. Truly one of a kind. We were looked after very well and I would highly recommend this place for backpackers like us, couples, friends and families. Very cheap and very accessible!   Arigatou guzaimasu!!

amenities: Fitness Centre with Gym / Workout Room
reviews: Great location of this property, fantastic atmosphere, Clean rooms as its a one of the New Hotel Build in the Center of Roppongi,Convenient to Roppongi hills, Tokyo Tower,Tokyo Midtown, Clubs and Restaurant and Night life in Roppongi,  The Only Issue I had was lack of English communication from the Front Desk , that didn't understand a demn about what I need her to change my Room to a twin room, and only Got same room I booked for, Surely recommended for anyone needed to explore around roppongi

Matsui Garden Roppongi ticks many boxes for a nice and comfortable stay in Tokyo. The hotel is relatively new (January 2020). The design of the public areas is spacious, tasteful and with eye for quality and detail. The rooms are very comfortable. Not too big - 26 sqm - but very practically arranged. Comfortable bed, great shower!, amenities, etc.  Breakfast is a pleasure - a choice from a good menu.  The service is impeccable. Quite a lot of staff - but all very well trained and always willing to help.  And the price we paid was very reasonable.  Last but not least, the location is perfect. In the middle of trendy Roppongi.  All in all - a safe bet when staying in Tokyo.

Nestled in a quieter part of Kita-Senju, which by all means is a reflection of a slower, more natural reflection of Tokyo life, the hostel is about a ten minutes on food from the train station and worth the pleasant walk. In true DIY hosteling style, this feels like an Auberge of old, a stop along the way if you will, authored and run by it's manager, Daisuke. Whether it's finding a place to eat, which "Sento" to go to, or figuring out what to do, Daisuke was a wealth of knowledge, going out of his way to answer any question to the best of his ability. On top of that he also provided wonderful conversation, making us feel even more at home. Our six person dorm room was exceptionally comfortable and the common room invites conversation with other guests. While the homespun feel
of the place and location may not be for all, the personality of the space and Daisuke himself make this place worth it alone.

The Kagaribi guesthouse is ideally located close to the Kita-Senju station, within walking distance. The neighborhood is peaceful and within reach of all Tokyo sights. Very friendly staff, extremely helpful. We rented the 4-people room, which is really tiny. You technically have enough space to fit four sleeping people and nothing else. Not an issue as the beds are actually futons you unfold for the night and fold back during the day. We loved staying there and do not hesitate to recommend it to other travellers.

2度利用させていただきました。スタッフさんはとてもフレンドリーで親切です。北千住駅から少し遠いものの、離れているからこそ味わえる貴重な体験ができました。宿周辺には銭湯が数カ所ありました。ゲストハウスは和風で海外からの方にとてもおすすめです。 One of my favourite hostel. Staff was very kind to me. It is Japanese style hostel.

I really liked this place, close to the Kitasenju station and a small supermarket, so calm and soooooo clean ! The guy that has this place is so kind, always in good mood and always ready to help :)  *to get there: Kitasenju station, straight on the main street, turn right at the light where you see a pink hairdresser shop, then left on the first light (last light before the big blue building on the right) and then always go straight and it will be on the left side of the street :)

This guesthouse was just was we needed. Prime location, close to the local shopping area, and about a 10min walk from the train station. The guesthouse it's self was very clean and calming, the other guests were not loud and it was a lovely place to come and relax. The host was even better, such a lovely guy and would go out of his way to help you. Will be back!

amenities: Fitness Centre with Gym / Workout Room
reviews: Excellent staycation at the Tokyo Edition. Beautiful, clean aesthetic, excellent service. We were upgraded to a premier king with a great view of the skyline and imperial garden and received personal service from the management team. We were celebrating my partner’s birthday and the local team went above and beyond in decorating our room for the occasion and providing a thoughtful birthday amenity.   Great pool, bar / lounge and set Western breakfast that was amazing. Highly recommend.

We had a wonderful family staycation at the edition this past weekend. Anshul and his team took care of everything we needed to celebrate my husbands 40th birthday. He made sure we had the perfect room to have our room service dinner celebration and also the private dining room for lunch the next day.  We had a couple friends join us for lunch and they made sure that all seats were 6 feet apart, socially distanced and everyone felt safe. On top of it all, the food was fabulous and service was excellent.   Thank you again to the edition for helping us plan a perfect covid safe birthday!

Had a great stay at the Edition. From the warm welcome by Sayaka san and Ikuko san when we arrived at the hotel to the superb room. I arrived too late to try their restaurant for dinner but i had very delicious desserts with Room Service. Breakfast and lunch at the bar were also very pleasant despite the hotel being very busy. Thank you to Akon san, Yoshiki san, Saito san, Wakana san and Hoshi san for their care.   We will definitely be back!

Had Brunch on a Sunday there - was a fantastic experience. Relaxing atmosphere, contemporary yet slightly extravagant interiors, extra attentive staff, and the food was plenty and soooo yummy. Will definitely go there again.

Unique and luxurious boutique hotel, with a buzzy vibe and eye-catching ambiance. The views of the Tokyo Tower will stun locals and visitors alike, and the modern amenities and room appointments will suit even the most fastidious of travelers. Opened in October 2020, the spaces still feel especially fresh and new - and the mix of customers ranges from hip scene-hunting locals and influencers, to families looking for a high-end experience all around. If you read no further, know this is a must-stay hotel in Tokyo. It was a cheekier version of The RC - approachable but luxe. My family and I stayed just two nights, over the New Years holiday week - looking for a special “staycation” experience in our hometown. Wow. The Edition’s beautiful lobby embodies the exact words of it’s

architect: a frame of nature. I’ve never seen such a space! The bountiful foliage is expertly maintained, and each unique seating area is exquisitely designed (from furs/pillows/blankets on couches, to rich wood tables with intricate tealights and flowers - like you’ve just walked into a wealthy friend’s insanely decorated home.) The maintenance alone of this space is proof that the operations team is on their game. Walk closer to the window and you’ll recognize why everyone has their camera out - the Tokyo Bay and Tower just a few blocks away are mesmerizing. While check-in was slower than expected, the team working the front desk and lobby were beyond polite and helpful. The rooms are modern, spacious - and white. All elevating the experience to feel fresh, new, and like you’re the first person to use the space. The elegant wood paneling evokes Japanese design mixed with some sexy function, allowing you to peek between the bathroom and sleeping areas. Le Labo NYC products are generous (and fragrant), and together weave the scent story of the entire hotel. We ordered room service (wine and dessert) and it was prompt, delicious, and it’s tough to deliver ice cream without it melting! Our dinner the first night was set-up by the concierge at our request: yakiniku. Not only did this wonderful woman make calls on our behalf to obtain a reservation last minute, but she walked with us all the way to the street level from the hotel. I say this because this included at least 5 minutes outside, and in nearly 0 degree temperatures. Completely unnecessary, but so thoughtful to ensure we wouldn’t get lost on our way. Breakfast service in the Blue Room was a delight. The service was attentive (our server had fresh coffees at the ready before we even asked), and thoughtful in presentation. A limited menu was executed perfectly, well-timed coursing and more than ample portions. In particular, the kids raved about their waffles and pancakes for days after (I feel like the fresh whipped cream may have been a positive factor). Glassware was intentionally selected, and my mimosa was served icy cold. The pool is small, but beautifully maintained. It requires advance reservations (covid-related restriction), and it’s a popular amenity so do your best to book early! We were a little disappointed to learn of this fact after we were suited up and ready to swim, but when we brought this to the hotel’s attention directly - they were extremely apologetic and we had no further issues. Given the reservation system, you get the pool all to yourself once you arrive which turned out to be a lovely treat afterall. The spa is exquisite. My husband and I booked shared services, and had a large room for his massage and my facial. A customary foot wash was performed prior to each service. Days later my skin still feels like perfection, and my husband couldn’t stop talking about his massage. We felt like the only guests in the spa at the time, even though I’m sure this wasn’t the case. We never once felt rushed or like we needed to do anything but fully relax and soak it all in. I’ve spent years of my life in hotels, and can tell you that this one makes the top 10.

restaurants.name: Schmatz Beer Stand Tokyo World Gate
Sake to Koshitsu Izakaya Maguro Daihyo-dan ta Daihyo
Le Bar a Vin 52 Azabu Toko Kamiyacho
Shabu Shabu Yakiniku Tabehoudai Merino Ginza

hotel_name: Jr East hotel Mets Tokyo Bay Shinkiba
reviews: 新木場駅目の前。 ダブル、ツイン以上しかない。位置的にディズニー客がターゲットかも。休前日は値段が跳ね上がる。  ツインとしては狭めかな。洗面台、トイレ、ユニットバスがすべて独立している。洗面台とベッドの仕切りがカーテンなのはチープ感がある。ただ、ここが引き戸だと狭さが目立って痛しかゆしか。まあ一人泊なら十分な広さだ。  チェックイン・チェックアウトとも自動機で対応できるのはいいですね。無駄な会話がいらないので。

前から窓が印象的だな、とすごく気になっていたホテルです。 舞浜に行く機会があり、 泊まる事にしました。  金額も立地も お部屋のキレイさも満点だったのですが 脱衣所にあたるスペースに ドアがなく、 丸見えというのが すごく気になりました。 （プレミアムツインベンチです） 私は１人で泊まったので問題はありませんでしたが 一緒に泊まる人は選ばないと・・・な感じでした。  そこだけが気になったので －★で。  駅前にコンビニもあるし ホテル下にもコンビニがあるし 便利でした。

11/20からお世話になりました。当初は、ツインのユニットバスを予約していましたが、子連れを考慮して下さったのか、無料グレードアップでバストイレセパレートのお部屋をご用意頂きました。ありがとう！ 舞浜から快速なら一駅。駅前はコンビニや居酒屋くらいなので、イクスピアリやディズニーで済ませて来る方なら気にならないと思います。一階のデイリーヤマザキの方、ホテルの朝食会場のカフェの方もとても親切で気持ちよく滞在できました。また、ディズニーに行く時にはお世話になります。
京葉線沿線のホテルはリゾート向けで高いか、必要以上に質素で安いか、ラブホ。 になりがちな中で貴重な存在かなと思います。 その貴重な存在の中で最寄り駅へのアクセスという面では最高ランクでしょう。 ただ新木場という駅があまりに何もなさ過ぎてなかなか泊まる気になれないところが残念なポイントかな・・・

京葉線、りんかい線、東京メトロ有楽町線の3路線からアクセス可能な新木場。その駅前にあります。 1階にはカフェと24時間営業のコンビニエンスストア、2階にフロントがあります。チェックインやチェックアウトの手続きは原則機械を使って行います。また、各種アメニティやコーヒーのサービスもあります。 客室は当初プランよりアップグレードされ、エキストラベッドを入れて3人部屋にもできる部屋でした。また、バス・トイレがセパレートタイプでした。窓際は、荷物置きに使ったりベンチに使ったりできる仕様でした。

I've stayed here only for one night but it was very relaxing and I could have a nice sleep as the website claims. I had a double room and was only carrying a small suitcase so it was spacious enough. If you are with a huge luggage, you might have trouble opening it. There was a small couch and a massage chair. There was no bathtub, but the shower was special and I enjoyed massasing my shoulders by the shower.   You can choose tea bags and amenities of your choice upon check-in.   It is only 8 min walk from Shinbashi station. There are many eateries around. Don qui jote and a convenience store are nearby so you will have no issues even if you need sth in the middle of the night.   You can also watch Netflix, Hulu etc with your account on the TV in the room.

Good location but had to change hotels after a couple nights, room was just too small. The price point makes it somewhat of a good value but for $20USD more a night found a much better hotel about 10 minutes away. Breakfast Isn’t very good at all - they give you a voucher for a fixed-menu “cafeteria” style breakfast tray that wasn’t appealing at all to eye and taste. Skip breakfast if you do decide to stay.

This new hotel just located behind the hisahashi ginza -asakusa line; just only around 200 m towards the subway exit.  Hotel is super new, all the facility still in superb conditions.  Lawson is just right around the corner, only less than 50 meters.   Receptionist did a good job, handling all the customer in an orderly manner.  There's an ice machine, vending machine, and laundry, at the lobby level, which is on the 2nd floor. 1st floor was a cafe, and lift towards lobby hotel.   Room size for hollywood twin room, so called bigger room according to receptionist, was only 15sqm, which i found quite crampped, for two adults and one minor. But either way, thats all Japan standard size, so please keep in mind, if you carry your big suitcase, might not have lots of space for you to

open up the luggage.   Windows inside the room, was no view to the street, so pick your room better, if you would like to have better view, although the windows was a blurry tinted window. ( privacy issued )

Clean & tidy hotel. Hospitable and courteous staff. With adjacent or in the same building coffee shop. Near a train station. Front desk located on the first floor, not on the ground floor. Wide reception area.

New-ish (last few years? Rooms and lobby all quite new and modern) in Ginza near Higashi-Ginza subway station end. Rooms are standard Japan business hotel size. Quick walk to Tsukiji Outer Market (less than 10 minutes) and walkable to Tokyo Station (about 20 minutes). Shops and restaurants right nearby. Would stay again as good location and relatively new. No much view as buildings close by.

Landabout's hotel & cafe would easily fit in Harajuku or any modern parts of the city. Instead, it is an unusual and appreciated dot in Shitamachi's Negishi area, all pastel colors, deep carpet and woody counter.   Though hardly crowded, the cafe had run out of the only cake they had on the menu. I had the soba ice cream, which was an incredibly tasty surprise. My wife' s drink was barely there: remove the ice and you're left with a straw and a gulp of liquid....At Harajuku prices, that annoys even more...  Nice alternative to Ueno or Asakusa.
日暮里に所要あり宿泊。鶯谷駅から徒歩５分位です。(艶っぽいのは駅前だけ。後は普通の街です)お部屋は和モダンな感じで、狭いながらも備品は全て揃っていて居心地良いしつらえです。フロントの方も近くの美味しいお店やお薦め教えて下さり、ホスピタリティが感じられました。
おしゃれで、スタッフの方々は皆爽やかで、気持ちよく過ごせるホテルでした。 朝食も美味しかったのですが、説明を先に読まなかった私が悪いのですが、おかわり出来ない事に気がつかず、少ししか取らなかったのが残念でした！美味しかっただけに残念。  あとは、お掃除をもう少し隅々までやって頂けると、もっと良かったです。  部屋着はズボンのないタイプでした。

Great location which enabled easy travel across Tokyo to see all major sights. Staff very friendly - spoke English as well as Japanese. We were able to leave bags in secure storage on day we checked out allowing us to see more of the city. Rooms were clean and comfortable, albeit a little small but the roof terrace on the 15th floor made up for this. WIFI was quick and easy to access and breakfast was ‘build your own’ with a base of either toast or rice.   Lovely stay at Landabout, would definitely recommend.

We stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel is a walking distance from the Uguisudani Station. The staffs are friendly and very helpful. They have a viewing deck at the 15th floor. They also have a laundry area. Our rooms are connected separated by a middle door that can be locked on either side. Although the rooms have no cabinets, they have enough space near the door for your luggages. Foods are available at 1st floor or the nearby restaurants.

Before I say anything, I have to add the caveat that my visit was for the Olympic Games and therefore during a Covid-19 State of Emergency so some elements of the stay will be different when travelling in "normal" times.  The hotel is large and modern with a fresh reception area and clean large rooms. I travelled with a lot of camera equipment and never felt the need to secure or hide the items when left in my room which is a good sign of trust in the staff. The breakfast food provided wasn't good and I only visited the breakfast bar two or three times in my 22 day stay due to the quality. As satted above, this may have been down to covid restrictions but I can't vouch for any of the food beyond the poor breakfasts as the restaurants were closed.  A tip for other guests staying,

Uber eats operates in the area but you have to be very clear that it's the Annex tower and not the north or main tower reception that they have to deliver to. I had a meal go missing within the complex so wrote a note in Japanese in the instructions that cleared that issue up from then on.  The staff are helpful and friendly, with English not being an issue for most.  I've had to mark down the sleeping conditions a little due to the issue I find at a lot of places of too-hard mattresses. I got used to it a bit by the end of my stay but for the first week or so, I was waking with numb arms etc where they'd gone to sleep due to no give in the mattress as I slept on my side.  The hotel is directly opposite the busy rail and subway hub of Shinagawa station which can get you anywhere, including onto the bullet train to further off locations.
とてもホテルは綺麗です。ただ一番気に入っているのは朝ごはんです。朝ごはんビュッフェは本当にオススメです。
新しく改装したお部屋に泊まりました。 アネックスタワーは何度か泊まっているのですが、前のお部屋の方が広く感じるような気がしました。 清潔感はあるけどクローゼットは欲しかったです 大きいホテルとはいえ荷物をフロントで預かってもらえないのは残念です
品川駅からすぐなので、プリンスを利用することが多いです。 今回はアネックスタワーに宿泊しました。 ダブルベットも、クイーンサイズでしたし、お風呂とトイレは改装済みでしたので、快適に泊まれました。
品川駅からすぐ。 部屋は清潔ですし、バスルームも綺麗でした。 接客も心地良くて、全国のプリンスホテルを行くたびに、ハイレベルで、なおかつ安定感があります。 フロントは7階なのでご注意ください。

Its hard to gauge and rate a hotel during the pandemic as there are inevitable issues related to staff shortage. All in all its a pretty good hotel in a prime location with great view but conceptually from lobby to the rooms you get a sense of a hotel identity trying to be hip with out actually nailing the vibe.

hotel_name: Keikyu Ex Inn Hamamatsucho Daimon Ekimae
reviews: 東京に出張した際に利用しました。地下鉄から近くJR浜松町からも徒歩で行けます。 部屋も綺麗で静かです。朝食はコロナ禍でなのか、3種類から選ぶ形でした。牛筋カレーを選びました。美味しかったです。チェックアウトは一階のボックスに入れるだけで便利でした。
大門駅から徒歩すぐで抜群の立地。出来て間もないホテルなのでめちゃくちゃ綺麗です。 最近は他のホテルでも増えてきたがチェックアウトはカードキーを指定の場所に返却するだけ。 いちいちフロントに寄らなくていいので手間が省けていい。

大門駅目の前、浜松町駅も徒歩6分ほどで羽田空港利用民にはとても便利のいいホテルです。 バス・トイレセパレートで洗い場のあるホテルに拘りがありいつもホテル探しの際はまずそこを調べますがここのホテルはEXダブルとEXツインがセパレートになっています。EXダブルは都内の他のビジネスホテルよりも広々としており、トイレ洗面部分もゆったりで快適でした。そしてパジャマが上下セパレートタイプなのもポイント高いです。今回東京タワーが見える部屋を用意して頂き、部屋は文句なしの最高でした。(タワー見えなかったとしても最高です) しかし、午前に荷物を預けに行った際の男性フロントスタッフの対応がイマイチでした。奥から出てきたと思ったら挨拶もなく「何か？」という感じで気分があまり良くなかったです。チェックイン時の女性スタッフも淡々として笑顔がないし、全体的に暗い。チェックアウトの際のスタッフは明るく好印象でした！ 部屋が良いのでまた泊まりたいホテルです。
都営浅草線　大門駅A5出口からすぐで1分かからずに到着できます。2階フロントでチェックインし、チェックアウトはフロントによらず、1階にカードキーをポストに入れるだけで便利です。セブンイレブンが近くにあります。部屋は新しいのでかなり綺麗で、アメニティも充実しています。羽田空港への移動も便利なのでまた利用します。

We stayed at this hotel two weeks after it opened. Extremely clean and right outside a subway station. There are restaurants nearby which you can have ramen or drink very late at night. We took monorail from Haneda airport to Hamamatsucho and walked about 10 minutes to the hotel with luggage. Great location as a base to explore Tokyo. We booked on Keikyuu Ex Inn Japanese website. You can't book on their English website.

hotel_name: Toyoko Inn Tokyo Keihin Tohoku-sen Oji-eki Kita-guchi
reviews: まだ新しいので、他の東横インの部屋に比べ、部屋は綺麗だしバスはやや広め。 立地も悪くありませんし、宿泊料がおさえられており、ビジネス使用でしたので満足です。 ただ、低階層の2階に宿泊したところ、上階から降りてくる客で朝のエレベーターは大変混雑しており、何回も見送りました。 階段は外階段のみ？ 朝は余裕を持って部屋を出たほうが良さそうです。
王子駅から高架下を真っ直ぐに進むと 着きます。 周辺は住宅街で静かです。 大きな通りにでるとコンビニや居酒屋など たくさんあります。 客室は東横インらしくシンプルです。 パジャマは1階から持ってくるシステムです。 ユニットバスですが、少し広めです。 アメニティはシャンプー、リンス、 ボディソープしかないので 女性の方は必需品は持参した方が良いと思います。

王子駅から徒歩5分位、大きな道路から入ったところの線路そばに有りました。  駅前の通り沿いでは無いので、車ならナビ、徒歩ならiPhoneなどでマップを見たほうがわかりやすいかも。  設備は新し目で（でも柏のようにバスルームがバリアフリーっぽい感じでは有りません）、ベッド横にUSBやコンセントがあるのは従来の東横インよりかなり便利。  京浜東北線の他に南北線、都電荒川線も近いので時間があれば、都電荒川線で行ったことがないところ（東京染め物博物館など）に行ってみるのも面白そう。  近くには飛鳥山公園という大きな公園があるので、朝のウォーキングやジョギングするのにも最適。  駐車場も裏手にあり、先着順で停められました。

I was pleasantly surprised by this chain business hotel. I think the price was very good for a double room. Clean and good facilities, and I got some free skincare products on checkin. There is a simple breakfast included.

日本各地で東横インを利用している者からのレビュー。 好評価したい点 ・部屋がキレイ。さすが新築。 ・内装も今までの東横インとほぼ同じですが、色々バージョンアップしています。 ・高層階で場所によっては電車が行き交う姿もよく見えます。 ・都内の東横インの中でも朝食会場が適切な広さを確保しています。朝食のレベルも合格点。 ・あいさつがしっかりできています。  低評価したい点 ・やや遠い。公式HPだと地下鉄の場合、最寄の出口から徒歩3分だと書いてあったが、もう少しかかるかと。

新しくきれいで快適。 ドーミーイン名物夜鳴きそば。共立の温泉旅館と同じ様にアイスと乳酸菌サービスあり。池袋限定サービスのハッピーアワーと浴室内のポカリスエット。その浴室は黒湯の天然温泉（運び湯）サウナあり。冷たい水風呂と露天風呂つき（白湯）。オーガニックシャンプーバー。シャワーがリファのファインバブル。基礎化粧品、コットン、綿棒、ドライヤーはパナのナノケアとダイソンと至れり尽くせり。だからなのか女湯は特にいつ行っても混んではいました。部屋のテレビで混雑状況見られます。コインランドリーも無料（乾燥は有料） 朝食バイキングもビジネスホテルの朝食バイキングではない内容かと。 お部屋や館内は普通のビジホなんですがドーミーは寝室に一枚引き戸があるので落ち着きます。みなさん、そうなんだと思いますが近場の温泉宿として寛げます。

池袋駅から徒歩で10分位のサンシャイン通り近くにあります。東口の繁華街の側ですから食事場所やカフェには不自由しません。他のドーミーイン同様、ホテル内のサービスは完璧です。天然温泉も最高です。風鈴の音を聞きながらの露天風呂は至福の時でした。若い従業員さんばかりなので、はつらつとして、気持ちの良いサービスです。みなさん挨拶が清々しく、笑顔が素晴らしかったです。朝食では中華を中心に（池袋は中華が有名らしいです)朝から鰹のタタキ、鯵のタタキ、イクラなど豪勢でした。フルーツのメロンも大盤振る舞いで凄いの一言。近々また泊まり。人参のスムージーもご馳走様でした。

2021年3月、都内に新しいドーミーインが池袋に開業しました。 お得なOPEN記念プランがあったので、どこにも行けないこの時期に、都内で旅行気分を味わおうと思い1泊しました。 1泊朝食付きツインルーム2名で11,900円、通常料金よりはお安めでした。 残念ながらGOTOトラベルのような補助金やクーポンはどこからも出ていません。 部屋は標準的なドーミーインスタイルでした。 バスタブなしのシャワーブースのみですが、大浴場に通ったので使用しませんでした。 大浴場は最上階の15階で、内湯側は珍しい黒湯でした。露天の方は透明です。 内湯と露天の間にポカリのタンクが置いてあって飲み放題でした。 湯上りの夜のアイスサービスと朝のヤクルトサービスもやってます。 金麦とハイボールのドリンクサービスと夜鳴きそばは2階のHATAGOでやっていました。 朝食のバイキングは蓋つき小鉢を手袋をして取る形です。 いくらや刺身の小鉢で海鮮丼を作ることもできました。 ここのご当地メニューは中華で、チャーハン、焼き餃子、焼売でした。 コスパは非常によろしいので、また近場のドーミーイン巡りを続けようと思います。

We had a pleasant stay for 3 nights. It's located a bit of a walk from the train stations, in a residential place and you get to feel the atmosphere of a Tokyo suburb. The place was comfortable but we were disappointed because the room we got wasn't what was shown in the photos.

The place is nice and cute but it was a bit sensitive with sound. The cleanliness was okay.  However, the check in process wasn't prompt enough. We had to wait for a bit until someone came and hosted us inside.   Most of all, we met the owner who was really really nice and friendly.   Our stay was good apart from hearing the snore from the next door.

We stayed here for a couple of days, and had a pleasant stay. Its not expensive and the hostel can be found in an quiet area around Tokyo, wich is nice if you want to escape the citycenter. Also, the neighborhood to walk around, and had everything you needed in the area. A small walk to the station.   The lady of the house was very kind and helpful, and spoke a bit of english. She wasnt always around, but we could always email here for questions.  We had a shared bedroom, wich was nice. Altough the room couldnt be locked, we felt safe enough to let our belongings rest in the room. The foto's of the hostel are a bit outdated. The only thing we mist in this hostel, was a comfortable livingroom area where you could sit after a long day of sightseeing. A kitchen, with refrigarator,
was avaible for everyone to use.  We would like to thank the hostel again for a pleasant stay!

This is the place for those on a budget or for those who don't mind roughing it a little. Tokyo is very expensive and for our final three days in Japan, we reserved a large room here at the Hana An Guesthouse. We were pleasantly surprised. This is an old house recently turned into a guest house. Each room has either traditional Japanese futons placed onto tatami mat floors or custom-built bunkbeds. There are a total of 5 rooms for rent here. There is a common kitchen on the first floor that is immaculately clean. There are two shared toilet rooms and a shared shower room. Each of these locks from the inside when one person is inside. Though my wife and I traveled with two teenage daughters, neither we nor our daughters had any concerns about the place. It was for sleeping, and

we were fine with the clean, no-frills approach. We met the other guests. They were from Korea, China, or the United States. The owner, Kaoru, speaks no English, so her daughter handles the reservations and communication. Both were responsive to our questions, though one should bear in mind that this is not a hotel and that there is no front desk. Much of it runs on a trust system. There is an old-school public sento (bathhouse only a block away), there is a laundromat a block away, and the Kanamachi train station is no more than a 10-minute walk. There are tons of restaurants, stores, and convenient stores in the area, plus the ubiquitous vending machines on every street corner selling soda, water, and beer.

Hana an is 6 minutes by foot from the nearest Keisei Kanamachi station, in a north east part of Tokyo.  keisei Kanamachi is easy access from Keisei Takasago station where both Keisei Line limited express and Sky Access Line from Narita Airport stop.  (I was lucky not to need going to central area with my heavy baggage.)   Tokyo Sky Tree is just 15 minutes, Just 10 minutes to Yotsugi where is home town of football animation ”Captain Tsubasa”, each by train.  If you'd like to go to the central area (for example Tokyo Station), JR Kanamachi station is also convenient.   This guest house was reformed and opened in 2015 keeping atmosphere of typical early Showa era style wooden house.  It's calm day and night around the house cause of in a residential area.  Guest rooms are small

though, clean and comfortable, as well as beds.  Shared toilets and shower rooms are separated as Japanese style.   Don't worry about foods. You can find local restaurants, fast foods, Izakaya, convenience stores, supermarkets or Starbacks Cafe around Kanamachi Station. (金町製麺 Kanamachi Seimen is recommended!)   The affordable cafe is next door of the house, and you can buy some delicatessen in a meat shop in front of the flower shop.   The owner is very friendly and helpful. I'd join cooking experience of Japanese food in the guest house, when staying next time.

Traditional style ryokan, family owned accommodation on the old tokaido road, cheap for the location nearby yamanote line and clean rooms.  Ask for rooms with toilets when you reserve, it's the same price than without. shampoo, towels, yukata, teethbrush all available. also tea & kettle.

I'd heard of staying at a traditional guesthouse, but never really sought one out. Stumbled across this one by a recommendation from a local hostel.  Very nice owners, interesting (and beautiful) guests (many locals) and great charming neighborhood with easy metro/rail connections. The Shinkansen is a 12 min walk or metro is 2 min. walk (1 station to Shinagawa/Shinkansen).  Don't forget to get a Japan Rail Pass before you leave your home country!!! WELL worth it!!!

My husband and I ended up staying here for a few nights because a hostel nearby didn't have space and referred us here. We were so happy with the large room, friendly owner and location that we stayed here for an additional night at the end of our trip. Note that the low price means no meals or amenities beyond yukatas, towels, and some bathing supplies, but there are lots of inexpensive restaurants and convenience stores nearby. Also, the walls and sliding doors are thin, so it's easy for people in neighboring rooms to hear if you speak in a normal tone of voice or have the TV on.  The owners don't speak much English, but even non-Japanese speakers (I speak just a little) should be able to get by with the help of some signage and knowledge of local customs (blue slippers are
for the toilet area only, etc.).

i have been two times in shizumasa, is a perfect place, good value for the price, near to the train station and markets, the owiner is very lovely! when i will come back to tokey i will stay en this ryokan

Had a lovely stay at shizumasa, located close to station, nearby sento is a must, friendly owner, helpful, polite, room was great AC if needed, wifi worked well, clean towel daily, washing machine for 200¥.  Can wear yukata also, local shops and izakaya really good,  A good place to base yourself and explore tokyo and do day trips out of tokyo, very close to haneda airport,  Quiet area, no complaints, would definitely go back to stay again :0)

amenities: Photo copier / fax In business centre
reviews: 静岡のホテルとのことで、申し訳ないことに今まで知らなかったのですが、大変快適でした。 新しい施設なので、もちろんピカピカ。洗い場付き浴室、リラックス感のあるインテリア、ベッド、アメニティ……どこをとっても大満足。 用意されているコーヒーやお茶が美味しいのも◯。  そして、朝食が素晴らしい。 本来ビュッフェを予定なさっていたようですが、コロナ対策でプレートメニュー。 とはいえ、和食が食べたいがフレンチトーストを諦められない私にもフレキシブルに対応くださり、朝から幸せな気持ちになれました。焼きたてのオムレツ、バジルマヨネーズで食べるのも美味しかった。 なくなりそうな頃に、おかわりもすすめてくれます。  ホテルでリラックスするのが好きで、色々と泊まりますが、コスパ込みでの満足度は5つ星にもひけをとりません。 オンにもオフにも、幅広くおすすめできるホテルです。 私も、またリフレッシュしたいときに伺います。応援しています。

20/7/3にオープンしたばかりの名前の通り静岡鉄道のグループホテルです。当然建物も客室もとてもキレイ(^^)d外国人旅行客の利用も少ないからかキャリーケースが当たってクロスが汚れたりもしていない。客室内はウッド調で統一されており落ち着いて滞在出来る。17.3㎡とこのクラスのホテルでは広め。 TVはTOSHIBA製43インチ！LEDデスクライトはUSBポートが1つと何とワイヤレス充電機能まで付いている。ベッドボードにはコンセントとUSBポートが１つずつ、各照明スイッチがある。SHARP製加湿空気清浄器あり。湯沸しポットはTIGER製。有線LAN 、WiFiは無料で利用可！冷蔵庫はTOSHIBA製。デスクと一体化するようにうまく収納されている。冷蔵庫の中には｢一富士｣という富士山の天然水のペットボトルが1本サービスで冷やされていた。折り畳み式の荷物置きあり。このホテルの一番のオススメは洗い場付きのバスルーム、トイレ、洗面所に分かれているところです。3Fフロントロビーのアメニティコーナーで入浴剤を貰って、湯船にゆっくり浸かれば疲れも一気に吹き飛びます。5Fと7Fには製氷機、自販機、電子レンジがあり、6Fにはコインランドリーがあります。3Fのアメニティコーナーでは各種スキンケアアイテム、入浴剤、シェーバー、ボディータオル等を必要な分だけ取って行きます。客室内のドリンクアメニティに掛川茶のティーバックが置いてあるのはさすが静岡の会社ですね！朝に飲んで行きました(^^)dただ客室のスリッパがウォッシャブルタイプのもので使い捨てのものが無かったことが少し残念。コロナじゃなきゃ気にはならないんですけどね。窓は大きめで開閉可能。客室からは芝浦アイランドのタワマン群が見えた。エレベーターはカードキーを翳さないと動かないセキュリティエレベーターです。
チェックイン前に荷物を預けたら予め客室まで運んで頂けました。首都圏の電鉄系(相鉄フレッサ、京王プレッソ、東急REI、京急ex)ホテルは如何にも出張ビジネスマン向けという感じですが、こちらは設備、サービス共にシティホテルのようなプレミアムビジネスホテルです。大満足の宿泊でした。また宿泊したいです。
都内で仕事があり利用しました。田町駅から徒歩５分くらい。新しいホテルなので当然ながら綺麗です。お風呂はユニットバスでなく、浴槽と洗い場があります。ベットもセミダブルサイズ。朝食は1500円。コロナ禍でビュッフェではありませんが、おかずも食べ放題とのこと。これで6000円程度なので非常にお得です。

amenities: Fitness Centre with Gym / Workout Room
reviews: インスタでも話題のおしゃれなホテル、主人と1歳半の娘と宿泊しました。車で行きましたが事前に確認したところ、フロントの方が駐車場について丁寧に教えてくれたのでスムーズに利用出来ました！ 客室内のインテリアやアートがとにかく素敵で、これどこのだろうと思う物ばかりでした。おしゃれだけど奇抜でなくて、洗練された落ち着ける空間なのでゆっくり過ごせました。 おまけにミニバーやスナックがオールフリーでホテルステイには抜群のものばかりでした。 私たちもお部屋でフレシネ乾杯してから夕食に向かいました。 夕食は4階のベルコモにていただきました。緊急事態宣言はあけましたがきちんとコロナ対策されていてお客様同士の席は離れていたしテラス席でより安心でした。 スタッフの方がみなさん親切で、キッズプレートを娘にも食べやすく少しアレンジしてくれたのでたくさん食べることが出来ました。 小さな子供がいると外食が制限されるのでとても嬉しい対応でした。 お料理内容も美味しく、わざわざ2つに分けて提供してくれたのもとても食べやすかったです。 お酒も進み2時間も外食出来たのは久しぶりで至福の時間でした！ ミニバーが充実しているおかげでその後もお部屋で楽しめました。素敵なレストランの後お部屋で飲み直したくてコンビニに行くなんて現実感を味わうことなく！笑 お風呂も広々、リネンが気持ちよくゆっくり寝れました。 朝食も夜とはまた違った明るく開放的なベルコモでいただきました。和朝食が美味しくてびっくり！ また絶対訪れたいホテルです。
車で出かけて飲んで泊まって朝からステーキ 食べられる素晴らしい場所です。スウィートでパーティーも良し、バーも良し、暖かくなったら是非ルーフトップバーも行ってみたいです。朝のベルコモの雰囲気も夜とは違って青山っぽい光でなんだか懐かしい感じで素敵です。 ミニバーがフリーフローなのは嬉しいです。
一階、キラー通りに面する紅茶専門店　TEAPONDさんの営業時間は、午前11時から午後8時迄です。テイクアウト、ドリンクのラストオーダーは午後7時30分迄です。

i booked dorm style. the dorm is big. very clean. near Ueno station, about 400metre only. great location. Family Mart and 7 Eleven just few minutes walking distance. Walking distance to Ameyoko Street, Don Quijote.
新しいのできれい！ シャワーも脱衣場ごと個室。が、一番のマイナスポイントは 水量。チョロチョロしか出ないシャワーにイライラしました。

Este es mi cuarto viaje a Japón y ha sido la mejor estadía,cuando vuelva me hospedare nuevamente Camas muy grandes limpias de primera calidad,los baños y duchas siempre muy limpios y lo mejor esta separada de las habitaciones no se siente cuando personas se duchan muy tarde. El personal muy atentos ,preocupados de que tu estadía sea lo mejor,hablan Inglés fluido y otros idiomas tambien

Programamos la estadía en el hotel Tomariya con anticipación, Es un lugar muy cómodo con cápsulas amplias, los trabajadores del resintió son muy amigables y atentos, todo limpio.   Lo recomiendo 100%!!!

Barato, al lado de la estación de Ueno, limpio y moderno. La atención del personal exquisita. Ha sido un placer. Nos hospedamos de emergencia y no pudimos elegir mejor, a 5 min de la estación. Abierto desde el mes de mayo, las instalaciones son nuevas, todo está muy limpio.
日本で泊まったホステルの中で 一番海外っぽいホステルでした 英語が通じるので外国人の方が沢山使っているし、キッチンも調味料揃ってます。 外国人の友達作りたい方にもおすすめです  タオルはレンタル制です ベッドはとても柔らかいですが、少し匂いが残っていました。(ミックス部屋だからってのもあるかもしれないです)  駅から少し歩きますが 夜はシーンと静かでした！
新宿駅から頑張れば歩ける距離。住宅街にあるので静かで、朝食もおにぎりやシリアルなど無料でいただけるのがありがたかった。

This hostel is well connected and a walk away from Shinjuku, which is a super packed nightlife area. There is also Shinjuku park nearby and it is definitely worth a visit on a nice day! The rooms are pretty small with basically no room to move but most people spend their time in the kitchen which is way better anyway! Whilst we were there everyone hung out together even though we had all just met so it is definitely fun in that way! Basically, I'm super glad we stayed there and would recommend it for young English speaking people who are up for a drink and making a group of travel buddies!

Good wifi and decent shower but not much else. Stayed there for 4 nights but one would have been enough. The room was constantly stuffy even though the poor air con system was always on. Hard, squeaky bed & wouldn’t stay again.

I checked into Pumpkey for 2 nights and being the only guest on the first night, the family went above and beyond what a hostel would normally provide and took me out to a bar Mash room to celebrate their son, Yoshi's birthday. It was loads of fun :)  You can try on a yukata for free and they will take a polaroid photo for you to keep. There were at least 6 styles to choose from. I didn't know they had this service, so it was a real surprise to me and Kaoru helped me with putting the yukata on properly.  They gave me a map to explore Tokyo, which was very helpful.  This hostel has 3/4 bed dorms, unlike other hostels in Tokyo that has 30 beds in 1 room.   The hostel is about 20mins walk from Shinjuku station and about 5mins from Yotsuya Sanchome. It is very close to Shinjuku

National Garden and Jinju Icho Namiki Avenue, where the gingko trees are now at its peak. There are many convenient stores and a supermarket nearly where you can buy food and use their kitchen to cook.  Despite its central location, I was able to get decent sleep and I didn't even use my ear plugs. This is a brand new hostel, so everything was clean and tidy. They also have dedicated female toilet and shower room, which is a bonus.  Highly recommended if you are staying in Tokyo :)

When i called the place a girl answered. She was the manager or something. Super unprofessional. But i didn't mind. When i arrived a guy from Pakistan or something received me. Very kind.  But when I walked into the room everything changed.  The place is old and filled with rubbish everywhere outside. The room I was in had a cockroach invasion. Found a couple and had to sleep with the light on all night.  There are broken fridges outside. And the toilet is outside too. Super dirty. Broken door and so on.  I stayed there 2 nights. I was shocked when i left. Speechless. I didn't have the gits to have a shower. Just couldn't.  To reach the guesthouse it takes about 20 minutes walk from the station. Maybe more.

Together with a good friend of mine we booked a twin-room for a month. The room is a good size for two people, we had enough space for four suitcases and al the stuff we bought over the month we stayed there. The utilities are also good, the room has a air-conditioner that can make the room nice and cold fast, good for the hot summers. (Also has a heater for the winter months). There is also WiFi that reaches the rooms which was really great to have.  In Yoshida house there are also a few long-time stayers which was very nice because they know the area and are fun people to talk with.  The shower, washing machine, kitchen and refrigerator are things you share with the other residents. I myself had no problems with it. You can lock the laundry room which is connected to the

shower so you have enough space and privacy to change clothing.  The washing machine cost 200yen to use and the washing powder is free.  The refrigerator is big but you share it with a lot of people so groceries have to be done on a daily basis, which is not that bad because I went out everyday and on the way to the station are two convenient stores and a super market. There is also a convenient store less than a minute walk from Yoshida house, very handy for a late night snack.  The location is also good in my opinion. 15 minutes walk to the station and it is Tokyo so there is a train every 10 minutes or so. With the express train you are within 10 minutes in Ikebukuro and from there you can go everywhere with the JR lines.  I'm very happy about my month stay at Yoshida House, had a lot of fun there and met great people.  A quick summarization of all the utilities you get: -airco -new toothbrushes -WiFi (that reaches the rooms) -soap -Cotton swabs -Slippers (more like crocs) -Towels -Kitchen with refrigerator (Shared) -Shared shower (Big shower) -Washing machine (shared)  Thanks for everything Hiki (Owner) :)

If you're looking for a peaceful, cosy, old-Japan type of communal living experience with friendly, eclectic people, look no further! I recently spent three months at Yoshida, and would highly recommend the spot. I loved the sacred garden outside my room and ease of living in a quiet suburb not far from Central Tokyo. The housemates are respectful and always changing...artists, travelers, families, students and more! I especially loved the warmth and kindness of Yoshida Manager Hikki. No complaints here.

I've stayed at Yoshida House every year for a month at a time for the past 4 years and I absolutely adore it. It really has become a home away from home for me. The manager of the house, Hikari-san is such an incredibly nice person and will go out of her way to make sure you have a good experience. There are always many other very friendly guests, most of who are long-term residents who are also very friendly and helpful. They are always willing to share tips and stories and during the summer months they sometimes have potluck style gatherings and everyone is invited! The rooms are good sized, double rooms are large enough for multiple people, and single rooms are the perfect size for the solo traveler. There is a fully functional kitchen available to use in the common room, as

well as a communal computer and cable tv, but the best part is the free wifi! Outside is a nice little garden area, perfect for sitting outside for a chat and a beer with friends. The location might seem a little out of the way, but an express train takes less than 15 minutes to get to the bustling Ikebukuro station, and from there it's easy to get to literally any point in Tokyo via the Yamanote line. Oizumigakuen is a nice location on it's own, with plenty to do around Yoshida House. There's a very nice temple, as well as a river that runs through town. There are many nice opportunities for good walks or bike rides around town. There's also quite a bit of shopping and restaurants, especially around the station. A couple tips I'd have for travelers staying here would be to bring your own towel, book double rooms early (especially in summer time) and most of all DON'T BE SHY!! Talk to the other guests and to Hikari-san, they often know about interesting activities taking place around town and sights to see, things that your travel books don't tell you about (like local festivals!) The price of the rooms are what keep me coming back to Yoshida House, but the atmosphere and the people are what make me homesick for this place for the other 11 months of the year while I'm back home.

I would like to start off by saying that the strange guests mentioned in previous reviews have all gone now. It's just quiet polite young Japanese people staying here now... and me. (^-^)  I have been coming to Yoshida House on and off for 2 years now and I have to say it's an absolutely fantastic place to stay. It is located in a quiet part of Tokyo in a really cute little town called Oizumi Gakuen and it's only a 20 minute train ride to Ikebukuro (one of the major cities) with trains coming every few minutes. There is also a lot to see and do in Oizumi and a beautiful little temple right next to Yoshida House that I like to visit sometimes.   Yoshida House is now under new management and the new owner Hikari-san is really lovely and friendly and has done a fantastic job of

renewing this place. She is here almost everday now working hard to make Yoshida House a comfortable and pleasant environment for it's guests. There is also a beautiful garden outside that has just had lots of new plants planted in it, it's such a nice place to sit outside and relax in the summer (when it's not the rainy season (^^) ).  The kitchen is good to with everything you could possibly need and the best bit...free tea! (*^^)v  Another thing about Yoshida House which is definitely worth mentioning is that apart from being very affordable, unlike most guest houses there are no deposits to pay, no contracts to sign, and no strict rules to follow (apart from the obvious 'be respectful to other guests and clean up after yourself!).  I've gotta say that it was a bit strange before when all those weird people were here but now they're gone for good (most of them were quite elderly and have moved on with their lives to other places now), all in all I don't have a bad word to say about this place and always recommend it to anyone who asks me about places to stay in Tokyo! ★★★★★

Location: in quiet Sumida area, 5 min walk to either metro Asakusa or Honjo-azumabashi. Best to come in via Honjo-azumabashi exit A3 (stairs only) , as there is much less crowd. 7-11 around the corner, and small Aeon supermarket at exit of Honjo-azumabashi.  Reception is only from 10 am to 10 pm, and check-out is before 10 am (can keep luggage until 9 pm, or can ship luggage for a fee) .
