There was proper air con system and not a fan as so many hostel advertise air con and it isn't I found.   There was a little seating area where you could eat, but not an entire kitchen set up but who cares! The sleeping area was lovely, you get like a little private unit which was great to have some privacy again. The hostel

also had security it had a proper locking system on the door. The only down side for this place was trying to find it once getting to tabata station as I can't speak Japanese, but other then that I can not fault this place, the staff I meet were lovely also.    All hostels should be like this place, so glad it was my final stop before coming home, the perfect experience

We have a very nice stay. The house is spacious, well equipped and comfortable. The area is very quiet and the host very helpful every time we have a question. The 7/11 and subway are close and a bigger supermarket is at 10 min walk distance. There is also a big park close to the house.
清掃も行き届いており、アメニティも常備して、設備も届いていたので、とても良かった。オーナーも親切だった。

Stayed there for 6 nights..the room was clean, the bathroom was small size but it was clean also..no breakfast provided though..it was walking distance from nearest mrt stations, 7/11 and Lawson but the mrt station didnt have elevator so it was quite an effort for us to take our luggages from mrt to hotel, using manual stairs :(..the hospitality of Ficus was great also. Since we came 3 persons, we were provided with mattress for 1 person, however on 3rd night, the mattress was damp and when we asked for an exchange, the other mattress was damp also thus we didnt use it for the rest of our stay.

It is merely 6 minutes walk to JR Line Akihabara station. The place is also near to some restaurants and convenient stores. The place is very secured and serene. I love that the beds are very comfortable that we had a good rest after our tiring day. We almost don't want to get up in bed and just stay,lie and have a good sleep all day! The staff are very approachable and easy to communicate with. Early Check in is allowed depends on the availability. They have complete bathroom amenities such as towels,body wash, toothpaste, shampoo and conditioner. The room is good enough for the 3 of us. Linens are immaculately clean. I love how hi-tech the toilet is :) We'd like to recommend this place for every travellers. You will not regret staying here. They exceed our expectation. Thank
you very much for the warm accommodation.

The room is awesome. With individual bathroom and shower, although they are a bit small, they are very convenient if you don't like the typical shared shower and bathroom from most hostels. Good price and excellent quality on Tokyo downtown. You can get your laundry done and dried for around 300 Yens, also very convenient. Hosts are very friendly, definitely recommend!

amenities: Fitness Centre with Gym / Workout Room
reviews: JR秋葉原駅電気街口から近く利用しやすい立地です。泊まるだけの感覚で行きましたが、随所にオブジェなどが飾られていて休憩スペースなどを利用し、少しゆっくり現代アートを楽しみながら滞在すれば良かったと思いました。 　客屋はソファーの位置など使いやすい動線で、スリッパの履き具合がフワッと心地良かったです。2名です(ツイン)と濡れたタオルを置くところが少なかったですが、洗面台の高さがちょうど良く跳ねない造りのよう。シャワーブースでは、ホテルの厚手タオルにボディソープを付けても泡立ちが良かったです。 レストランはイタリア製の本格薪窯で焼いたピザが、一押しです。香ばしいかおりで、フレンドリーな外国人スタッフが運んできてくれました。 朝食はオムレツをはじめとして5種の卵料理からセレクト。サラダやハム、野菜などは薪窯で焼いたフォカッチャで挟んでも食べてもと言われました。そして、このご時世、毎回マスク入れを用意してくれるのは嬉しかったです。

𝐍𝐎𝐇𝐆𝐀 𝐇𝐎𝐓𝐄𝐋 𝐀𝐊𝐈𝐇𝐀𝐁𝐀𝐑𝐀 * コンセプトにアート・音楽・食が融合し、旅する人に一生忘れられない瞬間を届けるというのがあります。 * ホテルの扉を開けたら… その感動を味わう事が出来ます。 * またこの時期に重要なコロナ対策もバッチリです！ * レセプションはもちろんスタッフ全員マスクで皆さまをお出迎え。 Barカウンターにもアクリル版もあります。 * レセプションで体温計測、用紙に健康状態を記載します。 疑いのある方は宿泊出来ないのでレストランで隣り合わせになっても不安がありません。 * 都内でも珍しい薪釜で焼きたてのフォカッチャやピザを頂けます。 種類豊富な朝食が美味しい！ * バスにはレインシャワーが付いていたり、洗面台は女性には嬉しい女優ライト付きでメイクもしやすいです。 * ルームアメニティは周辺地域と連携したオリジナルプロダクト。 どれも美しく素晴らしい物ばかり。 * アートをテーマにしたホテルなだけあり、手に取る事が出来るアートであり美術品です。 こちらはフロントで販売しています！  * * 🏨: 𝐍𝐎𝐇𝐆𝐀 𝐇𝐎𝐓𝐄𝐋 𝐀𝐊𝐈𝐇𝐀𝐁𝐀𝐑𝐀 * 📍: 東京都千代田区外神田3-10-11 * 📞: 03-6206-0569 * 🚶‍♂️: 東京メトロ銀座線末広町駅 徒歩4分 東京メトロ日比谷線秋葉原駅 徒歩10分
直前割でお得に宿泊しました。 駅からは近いですが駐車場がないです。 近くの駐車場も18時以降しか打切り価格ないため確約できないので、車じゃない時がいいですね。 ほぼ非接触でチェックイン。 部屋も風呂も綺麗で満足いく部屋でした。 近くには食事するとこもあり、コンビニもあり不便なしでした。
新富町の駅から近いですが、面している道路が細いのと周りが住宅地なので初めて行く際には迷うかもしれません。 事前に荷物を預けていたら部屋まで運んでくれており、疲れた身体には大変助かりました。 テーブルに面した壁に鏡がないので、座ってお化粧したい女性にはちょっと物足りないかも。(出入口に姿見があるので鏡が無いわけではないです) 最近オープンしたようですがバスルームはひと昔前の規格で狭いです。
２０時チェックイン、１階福祉対応の客室に泊まりました。客室は広くバスタブもゆったりとしていて、とても快適でした。日曜宿泊ということで料金もリーズナブル。 ただ、若干消毒臭があります。客室横がコインランドリーなのですが、幸い利用者もなくゆっくりと寝れました。また機会があれば利用したいです。

八重洲への出張でこちらに２泊しました。朝のラッシュ時に満員電車に乗らなくてすむので助かります。 ホテル自体は新しくてきれいです。部屋はやや狭く感じましたが、濡れた傘を干せるくらいのスペースはありました。空気清浄機もあります。 デスクに電子レンジが置いてあり、台の上に荷物を置くスペースが足りなくて困りました。無料のドリップコーヒーが置いてあるのは嬉しかったです。 ホテルの公式ホームページに記述がないため着替えを多めに持っていきましたが、1階にコインランドリーがありました。出発前に知っていたら荷物を減らせたでしょう。 ユニットバスは標準的な広さで清潔です。給排水とも問題ありません。 シングルルームには枕が2個とクッションが1個置いてありましたが、枕の高さや固さが私の好みではありませんでした。どうせなら違うタイプの枕を2個置いてくれればいいのに。また、布団が薄くて朝方寒くて目が覚めるのは困りました。 このホテルに朝食つきのプランはないので、100mくらい離れたコンビニ（ローソン）で買って食べました。近隣に飲食店は多くありません。 私は使いませんでしたが、最近よくシティホテルに置いてあるhandyという無料スマホがここにもありました。
民宿的價格，大飯店的品質。無論是商務出差，或是全家出遊都可以享受高品質的住宿體驗。有個人（非公用）廚房與洗衣設備，不用與人共用。地點位於車水馬龍的新宿區。附近也有超市與藥妝店生活機能便利，舒適！推薦給來東京的朋友。
實在太棒了.乾淨舒適.地點便利.交通發達.價格實惠.......................... 加上中英文流利.服務超好的.床比較小.沒辦法.因為我太胖了.不怪他.該減肥了

DoMo S 百人町位於JR新大久站出站約3分鐘路程，從熱鬧的商店街轉個彎就走進這條安靜的小巷中，經過幾間高級住宅後，就會發現這棟新穎的電梯公寓。從入口開始，就能感受住宿環境是嶄新、乾淨、整齊，寬敞、光線充足...幾乎無可挑惕。房間內有擺放4人餐桌的小living room、廚房、大冰箱、洗衣機...生活設備齊全。房間很大，家人住4人房，我一人獨佔S402房，有一張King size 的雙人床，還有沙發休憩區與梳妝台，在東京可以說是一個小家庭的房子了～地點就在新大久保站走路3分鐘左右，附近有密密麻麻的各式餐廳、超市、藥妝店、便利商店、百元店，尤其是LAWSON的100元店超好買(下一篇介紹)。最厲害的是地下一樓的DoMo Café , 手沖咖啡是來自京都的Verdi 和 台灣的Fika fika, 來自小倉的紅豆熱壓三明治好好吃啊～只能說完全無可挑惕！

All staff are courteous and helpful. This accommodation has a real nice set-up, very accessible, and close to what a traveler would need. Reasonably priced and will certainly be my place of choice, when I come back:-)

This hotel is pretty secluded in a quiet neighbourhood.   Family mart and 7-11 nearby with several other department stores. Convenient as it is situated near Nakai stn. Which is on a toei line.    This hostel provides tatami/ traditional rooms however they were unavailable when I was there and my friends and I had to opt for a bunk bed.   Service is not that good, check in was at 3pm but it was delayed till 3.40pm+ due to the cleaning, and the cleaning wasn’t very good as it was rushed. Dust and debris all over the floor and inside the toilet. Cleanliness would be about 2/5.   Our stay cost about 70++ SGD a night, which is pretty value considering I’m sharing it with friends.   There is a laundry area with 400¥ for washing 100¥ for drying which is a little overpriced. There are
laundry services around the area though but I am unsure of the prices.
西武新宿線と大江戸線の中井駅からすぐのカプセルホテルです。 西武線の中井駅の脇に建っている感じです。 ちょっと知らないと、分かりづらいです。 マンションの入り口のところにホテルの入り口もあります。 スタッフは外国人で、日本語はかなり厳しいようです。

I have a huge amount of gratitude and respect for JP from the front desk at the Skycapsule Hotel. He helped me greatly in a time of need, and I will be able to make it come safely because of his good will. Thank you so much, and happy new year!
芦ノ湖温泉から毎日お湯を運んでくるそうです。配達するトラックを道で見かけます。 日帰り温泉は現在はcovid-19感染予防の為完全予約制です。 甘味とアルコールのセットがあります。 何も持たずに存分に温泉を楽しめる場所です。
温泉の泉質がとても良いです。日帰りで利用しました。 １０時から１１時にかけて、たくさん人が来るので、 その間は湯船に入らず、洗面所でいます。

Hotel staff are super helpful and speak good English. They call taxis when needed and offer good tours. The breakfast is delicious and traditional and overlooks a charming little garden. I would recommend this a lot as it is close to restaurants, cafes and super markets while still being peaceful.

For Westerners the rooms are small and so are the towels and the ironing board etc but the room has everything. Breakfast in very Japanese as you would expect. Best thing is the service which was so efficient

Excellent, quiet location half mile from Okura Hotel. Room prices extremely reasonable in comparison to the top hotels and guests receive lunch and dinner discounts at the two restaurants. Lunch at the lower level Sakura restaurant overlooking the delightful gardens is a real pleasure. Breakfast (included in the room rate) is served in a second, less formal room on the main level.  As stated by the prior reviewer, the rooms are small and basic but well-equipped with comfortable bed and TV. Most have garden views. However, the sound insulation between rooms is poor.  Staff are courteous and helpful but beware the 11am checkout requirement, non-compliance could cost you extra.

International House (or "I-House" to its fans) is a wonderful escape in the middle of Tokyo.  A short walk between either the Roppongi or Azabu-Juban metro stations (both vibrant neighborhoods) I-House has devoted following among academics, diplomats, and others who know of this unique location. The hotel rooms are discounted for members, but a reasonable price even for non-members.  The rooms are Japan sized: not large, but well appointed.  Most even have a balcony overlooking the garden. The garden is lovely any time of year, but particularly so when the sakura are in bloom.   Food is available in two restaurants.  Meeting rooms are available for conferences.  The "gym" is only a room with a few pieces of equipment, but take an early morning run in the neighborhood if you'd

like, including a jog over to Shiba-Koen and Tokyo Tower.   The setting inside and out of International House is serene. It's a great escape at the end of the day for those who like solitude, just blocks away from the enthusiastic nightlife of Roppongi.
女性フロアに四日ほど1人で泊まりました。化粧水やクレンジングなど肌に合いとてもよかったです。コインランドリーもあるので 少し長い期間泊まりたい人にオススメです！ドミトリーでしたが、他の方が宿泊しているのがわからないくらい静かで快適でした。内装もオシャレまた利用したいと思えるホテルでした。

女性専用フロアに一人で泊まりました。 フロアに入るのにカードキーが必要であり、廊下に監視カメラもあるので女性一人でも安心して泊まれる思います。 部屋は2段ベッドに専用ロッカーとシンプルなつくりです。 お風呂は30分単位の予約制なので、いちいち空いているか確認しにいかなくても 自分の予約の入れた時間にいけば入れたのが良かったです。 シャワーだけでなく、浴槽があるのはうれしかったですし、 メイク落とし・洗顔料・化粧水・乳液が用意されていたのは助かりました。 朝食も美味しくボリュームがあり、何よりラウンジがカフェの様なスタイリッシュな空間だったことで朝から気分よく食事ができました。 全体的にお値段以上の満足度でした。
ほぼ東京の中心なのにドミトリーがあるのに驚き。宿泊費を抑えたかったので非常に助かりました。しかも清潔感がある宿でした。今度は連泊で利用します。

海外から帰国した際の15泊16日滞在しました。アパアプリで予約して一泊3,900円で、直接予約してアパポイント10%還元がついてきました。  このホテルの長所は、設備の新しさ、立地と値段です。水回りが新しいことの快適さは言わずもがな、ベッドのマットレスも新しいせいかまだちょうどいい硬さでした。また、コンセントとUSBの接続口が多く配置されているので便利でした。フロントも感じはよかったです。立地もJR大森駅までは3分、京急大森海岸までも10分くらい。空港にも京急の路面バスで行けるようです。ホテルの前に松屋、徒歩3分圏内に西友とマイバスケットがあるので、買い出しをするにも便利でした。駅前の反対側に行くとそれ以外にも持ち帰り可能な飲食店が多かったです。あと1階にセブンイレブンがあります。  短所は、ホテル内の他の部屋でタバコを吸っている人がいるのか、時々その臭いがすることがありました。それ以外は特にないです。  なお、予約に当たり、インターネットでは15泊まとめて予約できないので、複数に分けて予約し滞在期間中は同じ部屋にしてほしいということを事前に連絡する必要がありました。また、帰国日から15日間は共用設備が使用できず、洗濯物は徒歩10分弱のコインランドリーに行く必要がありました。（小銭と洗剤が必要）羽田空港からは検疫所バスで行ける範囲内です。  これらを踏まえ、3,900円（＆ポイント）かつ読売新聞も毎日無料で読めることを考えると、本当にお得だなと思いました。
年越しを過ごさせていただきました。しかも初のアパホテル。このご時世、都民なので都内で温泉付きのホテルをと、利用させていただきました。まだオープンしたばっかりだから、とても清潔感があり、この値段で温泉もあってすごくのんびり過ごさせてもらいました。大浴場の混み具合が部屋にいてもわかるのもとても便利。また、行きたいです。
オープンから間もないからか、設備は新しくてキレイでした。 温泉も気持ちよくて、とてもゆっくりすごせました。 フロントは自動チェックができるのですが、慣れていないとスタッフに聞きながらやることになり、対面式よりも時間がかかりました。
アパ直でお得に泊まれました。泉岳寺駅前よりも、新しく、jrからのアクセスという面ではこちらに軍配があがります。 確かにエレベーターが2基しかないこと、空気清浄機や枕の数など見劣りするところはあるもののの、この値段なら満足です。ポストコロナに来る繁忙期値段では泊まらないとは思います。

既存のホテルより設備が劣るという残念さ(>_<)既存のホテルにはある空気清浄器も折畳みの荷物置きも無し！チェックイン時は自動チェックイン機ではなくクレカ専用の卓上型自動チェックイン機で！(そもそも自動チェックイン機がフロントカウンター3箇所のうち1箇所しかない！自分がチェックイン時は使用されず。)何故コロナ禍の最中に自動チェックイン機を使用しないのか！アクリル板無しであれこれ喋り、現金を手渡し。これコロナ感染対策に完全に逆行！自動チェックイン機ならセルフチェックインが出来るのに。ただアルコール除菌スプレー置いとけばいい訳じゃないと思うが(-_-;)部屋は912号室。エレベーター近くの部屋。部屋の中はホコリが凄い(-_-;)滞在中デスクの上やベッドボードの上、スマホ、パソコンのディスプレイを何回拭いても細かいホコリが溜まる！なのに窓は開閉出来ない！ずっとこのホコリを自分が吸っていると思うとゲンナリ(>_<)眺望は隣のビルの屋上など大森の絶景が広がります(>_<)アパホテルなので当然部屋は極狭！(>_<)高床式ベッドとぺちゃんこの枕に柔らかすぎるマットレス！本当腰が痛くなります！腰痛持ちの人は要注意です！東芝製50インチテレビが壁掛け。ベッドボードの立付けが悪くもたれかかると壁に当たりガタゴトと音がする！天井にはシーリングライトがあり明るい。何故か客室のミラーにはフックが付いているのだが何に使うのか使途不明！開業したばかりだから当然部屋は綺麗です。壁が薄いので隣の部屋のオヤジのイビキを一晩中聞かされるという罰ゲーム状態に！他のアパホテルと同様業務用エレベーターは無いので、チェックイン時間を過ぎていても清掃スタッフは我が物顔でエレベーターを使用。当然各階通路はリネンの台車やらゴミなどがあちこちに散乱したまま！2Fに製氷機がコインランドリーと同じスペースにある。空調はないので暑い(>_<)なお氷を入れる容器は部屋の小さい紙コップを使わないといけない。コロナ対策らしい。電子レンジは1Fのエレベーターの反対側に。ちなみに隣が多目的トイレ。何故こんな配置にした？センス無いのは設計士？アパ？読売新聞の無料配布あり。エレベーターはカードキーを翳さないと動かないセキュリティエレベーター。1Fにあるセブンイレブンにはホテルから直接行ける。ホテル向かいにはローソンがあり、まいばすけっとや西友も直ぐ近くにあるのでちょっとした買い出しには便利。アクセスはJR大森駅北口から右側(京急大森海岸駅側)のエスカレーターを下ったら直ぐ。ただフロントはセブンイレブンと反対側！  6/29～再訪。部屋は807号室。やはり窓は開閉出来ず(>_<)空気清浄器も無い極狭な部屋の中はやっぱりホコリが凄い(>_<)通路も開口部は無くアパホテルお馴染みの吹き抜けが大森駅前には無い！ので換気出来ていない！そして清掃スタッフも宿泊客もノーマスク(-_-;)東京は陽性者が50人超からついには100人を超えてきてるのに...ホテルクラスター起こす気ですか？部屋のクロスにはもう大きなシミが付いている！何故清掃する際に気付かないものなのか不思議？？オープンしてまだ1週間も経ってないのに...この部屋のベッドボードはもたれかかってもガタゴトと音がしない。まぁこれが当たり前なんだけど。アパホテルは引渡し時に各所のチェックしないんですね。ホテル社長はあちこちのメディアで自画自賛されてるようだが実際は...？？まだ板橋、大島、西麻布くらいしかホテルがない時には社長自身で各ホテルのチェックをされていたようだが、現在は各ホテルのチェックすることはもう無いのでしょうね！現場の実情を把握されなくなってしまったことは本当に残念です。  7/6～再訪。部屋は1017号室。やはり窓は開閉出来ない！眺望は隣のビル、階段、通路(>_<)ビルの階段にある照明が眩しい！ホコリも相変わらず(-_-;)  7/13～再訪。部屋は1014号室。やはり窓は開閉出来ない！同じく眺望は隣のビル(>_<)チェックインして部屋に入ったらデスクの上はホコリだらけ...窓が開閉出来ない、空気清浄器も無い部屋で清掃スタッフが、シーツ類を交換し、掃除機をかけたらホコリだらけになるよね。何故想像出来ないのだろう？チェックイン早々気分が悪い！ダストアレルギーの方は注意が必要です。  個人的なアパホテル大森駅前の  :良い点  ･駅から近い。 ･オープンしたばかりで綺麗。 ･客室の天井にシーリングライトが付いていて明るい。 ･大浴場が付いている。 ･コンビニに外に出ずに直接行ける。 ･アパアプリでクイックチェックイン。 ･ベッドボードにコンセント、USB、エアコン、照明スイッチがひと纏め。  :悪い点  ･客室が狭い。 ･客室からの眺望が悪い。 ･窓が開閉出来ない。 ･空気清浄器が無い。 ･客室内のホコリが凄い。 ･壁、床が薄いのか上からも横からもドンドン音が響く。 ･エレベーターの動きが鈍いので待たされる。 ･業務用エレベーターが無いので清掃スタッフと相乗りになる。 ･清掃が雑！ ･ベッドのマットレスが柔らか過ぎて腰が痛くなる。 ･枕がぺちゃんこ。 ･洗面のコップ、コーヒー、お茶のコップが紙コップ！ ･荷物を置くテーブル等が無い為、床に直置き。 ･アパエコ清掃の為シーツ類、枕カバーの交換は4日ごと！  個人的に再訪は無いと思う。

amenities: Fitness Centre with Gym / Workout Room
reviews: Even though there are few reviews, they were good so we went out on a limb booking our stay through a Russian site. Which was the only site we found that had available rooms.  But we didn't regret our choice! We found the place after having walked around in the rain for approximately 45 minutes.  It is hard to find at first, but it does exist, it's known by the name of "Leaf Court" not elite apartments. And it's a great little place!  It's about a 10min walk from Hatagaya station, down a cozy little street filled with local shops and wares.   The apartment itself is simple, but you don't really need anything larger. We were three adults in one apartment. And it worked alright for us. The staff is very helpful and polite, breakfast is great.   I would definitely recommend this

The apartment is quiet and good to stay with family. However, it is a bit hard to find. The breakfast is very nice. The laundry is provided with easy to use. No plates, folks and spoons are provided in the room.

"Don't hesitate & book now"  The room is really clean, spacious and the futon is very comfortable. We had a week stay with this apartment and we're very satisfied with the amenities provided and services. Friendly neighborhood and a peace area to stay. Mustn't miss the breakfast, as they served awesome breakfast. Staffs are very friendly and helpful. We will be back with you!  Love the whole package of it!

Hard to find and this place is better known by leaf garden instead of the elite apartments, very convenient located only 2 station away from Shinjuku station, heaps of restaurants and I would suggest the nobu bistro only 5 min walking from the leaf garden apartments.

The rooms are nice and clean, the breakfast is very good, and the staff is friendly. Definitely worth a visit. However, it's a little hard to find, since it's located on a small side-street and has no visible sign up front.

Booked this since it had a 10/10 review almost everywhere. No question about it. Very clean, near train stations, near convenience stores, quiet area, very good wifi, with bathtub and heater and complete utensils, even trash bag were provided. Buttt.. Since it was winter (more luggage for thick coats), and i went with my parents who are seniors already, we were always tired at the end of the day. Felt like we were always on the rush. Always had to look for alternative ways to get to the city with the shortest time possible or lesser number of transfers. Check-in process was also a hassle for me, since i had to input all info about each guest.

This place is quite far from downtown.  It is about 30 min from Shibuya station.  Eventough it is quite far, the place has bigger accommodation area than normal Tokyo’s apartment or hotel.  It has complete kitchen, washing machine and oven for basic living while staying there.  The location is also 10 min walk from 2 station so it is very easy to be accessed.  Close to accommodation there are many supermarket that can provide basic needs like breakfast or dinner.  There are also some Japanese and even burger restaurant around.  So it is very convenient indeed.  With pricing given, it is totally worthy.  Room is very clean, towels and bed linen are clean as well.  Totally recommended for simple couples or small family.

A bit far from the city but this place is incredible! Clean, modern, comfy and homy. And nearby there is a supermarket and even mcD! I would love to stay again in this place if i have chance to go to Tokyo again.
ワンルームマンションのような部屋でした。布団は自分で敷かなければなりませんが、部屋が広いことと比べれば難ありません。 玄関の入り方に最初違和感ありましたが、スタッフさんは丁寧だし、一度チェックインしてしまえば、出入りしやすいです。部屋もとても静かでした。

Tenía mis reservas respecto a este hotel, pero realmente es muy buen hotel. Habitación amplia estilo japonés, limpia, casi justo frente a la estación Shin-koiwa en la Sobu Main Line. Ampliamente recomendado, sobre todo en época de Hanami donde se suele saturar todo el centro de Tokio.
たまたま予約サイトで安くて広い宿泊場所を見つけました。JR総武線の新小岩駅から５分程度のところです。快速も停まるので非常に便利なところです。周囲にはコンビニや飲食店もあり非常に便利です。広々としたフローリングでワンルームマンションをホテルのようにしたのだと思います。値段もお手頃で、非常に良かったです。

The place is a short 5 min. walk from Shin-koiwa station on Sobu main line (15 min from down town Tokio).  Many, many restaurants and bars as well as markets in the area.  The place was newly refurbished, very secure, each unit has a mini kitchen, very quiet, very clean.  In 1 unit 3 sleep comfortably, 4 would fit.  It was a bargain accommodation for Tokio - price wise, place wise and comfort wise.  Better then IBIS type of a hotel.  Car space was for free, but limited spaces. Yet during our stay only we parked in there. Great place to be based while in TYO

予約サイトで見つけた、客室の広さ23㎡のコンドミニアム？です。  JR新小岩駅から徒歩約３分♪ 住宅街？の中に建つ５階建ての建物。 元々は、ワンルームマンションの様ですね。  客室をリニューアルし、宿泊施設として半年程前にオープンした様です。  受付はオートロックドアを越えた場所に有り、看板に書かれた電話番号にコールして扉を開けて貰います。 現地での支払いは現金だけの様子… ルームキーを受け取り、小型のエレベータで客室に進みます。 オートロックドアのキーもキーホルダーに付いていますので、外出時には注意して下さい。  各階に客室は５部屋。宿泊施設HPの総客室数と合わないので、幾つかは賃貸契約でしょう。 各階エレベータ前に、分別用のゴミ箱が有りました。  客室に入ると、下足を脱ぎ、シューズボックスの中に納めます。 一口ガスコンロ、シンク、定員分の食器、電子レンジ、フライパン、お玉等の調理器具がコンパクトに納められたミニキッチン。 その反対側に、セパレートに別れた浴室とトイレ。 トイレには最近、温水便座が設置されました♪ 浴室にはコンパクトですが洗い場が有り、湯槽は一人で浸かるには十分な大きさです。 アメニティは、シャンプー・リンス・ボディーソープだけ… 必要な物は各自で準備して下さい。  廊下の扉を開けると、フローリングのリビング。 今回利用した客室定員は３名ですが、定員分の寝具を伸べると、荷物の置き場に困りそうな広さです。 テーブルの上に、シーツ類とタオル類が置かれています。 此方の宿泊施設は、セルフベッドメイキング方式。宿泊者が布団を敷きます。  エアコンは独立式 TVはケーブルテレビ 照明器具は調光と色彩がコントロール出来る最新式 壁紙も新しく、まるで新築そっくりさん♪ですね。

今回の宿泊料金はスペシャル価格で6,000円を切っており、さほど苦には成りませんでしたが、プロパー料金ならば気になる事が有ります。 リビングに座椅子が欲しい。 布団が煎餅布団の様に固く、マットレスが必要。 浴室に腰掛けと湯桶が必要。  ベランダも有って開放感を得られ、隣の建物も接近しておらず、同地区の他のホテルに宿泊した際に受ける圧迫感のストレスも無く、コ・ス・パは最高レベルです。  有料ですが、敷地内に駐車場も有り、希望者は事前の予約で利用出来るようです。  インバウンドもターゲットの一つで、韓国語が話せるスタッフさんもいらっしゃいます。  倍の広さのファミリールームも有って、何かと便利な宿泊施設でした。
ディズニーと東京観光で利用しました。 スカイツリーにも徒歩でいけます。 閑静な住宅地の中にあり快適でした。 デザイナーズマンションといった感じですごく可愛いお部屋。 こんなお部屋にすみたいなと思いました。 洗濯機もキッチンもありバストイレが別で快適でした。 次は１週間くらいいたいです。

Nous avons passé 3 jours à Tokyo et avions réservé cette chambre. Le système de code pour l'arrivée est très pratique et rapide. L'appartement était parfait! La cuisine était fonctionnelle et avec les ustensiles adéquats, la salle de bain était très pratique, les lits très confortables. Nous avions du thé et du café sur place, ainsi que la télévision et le wifi. A 5min à pied de la Tokyo Skytree et ses boutiques et proche de tous les lieux touristiques de Tokyo. Merci beaucoup pour cette chambre, pour notre premier voyage au Japon, c'est un super souvenir !

大阪伊丹からホテルの部屋まで、二時間で到着しました。スカイツリーと浅草の観光が今回の目的です。立地最高でした、徒歩で、スカイツリータウンへ五分、浅草雷門へ十五分。その分、観光や食事に充分な時間がとれました。　ホテルの部屋は、四階です。 夕刻でしたので、ライトアップされたスカイツリーが、大迫力で天窓から映し出されて、部屋の灯りを消し、しばし呆然。　白を基調とした部屋は、清潔感があり、機能性も良く、備品類も質感の良い物が使われていた。特にタオル類。斜め向かいに新しく鳴門部屋が建設中で相撲ファンには、たまらない立地になるんじゃないですか。 一週間位、滞在しても、飽きないと思わせてくれる、街とホテルでした。 また、来ます！

The staff were friendly and helpful. Some speak English well. Check in time at 16.00 but they let me check in at 13.00. The staff told me that the cleaning was not finish yet but my bed was ready. Maybe because they saw me sleeping in their sofa, I was feeling unwell at that time, so I'm grateful for that. I stayed in female dorm room. The bathroom and toilet located in the room. The other guests in my room were so noisy, they packed/unpacked their stuff at night up until 12 PM, using hair dryer etc, eventhough there was a note to keep the noise level after 9 PM. I think the hostel should be more strict about that. I like the neighbourhood. The wifi was fast. The bed and pillow a bit hard for me.

I booked Hiromas hostel in Ueno by mistake, but since I really like Ueno as a neighborhood I didn’t mind.  The neighborhood where the hostel is nothing special. You will find a couple of convenience stores and restaurants nearby. It’s not as near to Ueno station or park as I would have thought.  But the worst thing about the place would be the sleeping arrangements which seems to in some strange way amplify the noise from the cubicle next to you. At least mine did so I didn’t sleep more than a few hours each night during my two night stay.  The common area is kind of posh for a hostel. It actually more looks and feels like a coffee shop except they don’t offer coffee. For the free coffee and the better location I would definitely choose the Hiroshimas hostel in Akihabara over

I've stayed in the female only dorm for 3 nights. The hostel is located very central, only 5 - 7min walk to JR and metro stations, close to Asakusa and Ueno park. The beds are capsule style with a curtain and you have a locker for your valuables inside as well as the locker for luggage outside. Both the mattress and the pillow were extremely firm (but that's typical for most Japanese places). The only downside was the bathroom cleanliness, the showers smelt quite bad because of poor ventilation and the sinks and the floor weren't cleaned regularly. It was manageable but not really ideal because of the smell mostly. Otherwise, cheap and easy for a short stay!

It was a really nice and modern Hostel. The bed was comfortable and the showers were clean. There was a nice lounge and the personal was really nice. Definitely a Hostel I would book again. The price was really okay.

This place is not featured in most Hotel booking websites, I find this after I got hopelessly lost in Shinjuku Nichrome, and could not find my original booked hotel. It is in a very busy area, 1 block from ISATAN Departmental store, and 1 minutes walk to Metro stop.it is surrounded by many shops and restaurants.  The room is VERY SMALL, but for 6000 Yens, it is not more than a capsule space in Tokyo. Wifi is good, the hotel staff do not speak English and do not allow visitors into the room UNLESS an extra of 3000 Yens are paid. It has 10 floors but each floor has only 5-6 rooms. But be fair, the place is clean and safe, the lift works well and the location is excellent for the price, especially you plan to hang around Nichrome at night.

restaurants.name: Shabu Shabu All-You-Can-Eat Yakiniku Merino Shinjuku

reviews: Hostel Haru is so centrally located. Seconds away from the Tsukuba Express Asakusa station. Also very near the main Asakusa attractions. This property occupies the third floor of a building so it has this intimate feel. Clean property overall. Fast internet. Comfortable bed. And the super friendly host seals the deal! Thank you!

I I've never encountered a key locker in a dormitory . so that  I can put small suitcase safety. they offer free rental night wear called SAMUE japanese style cloth. good experience to wear it though  I'm japanese LOL. owner and staff is very kind . highly recommend to stay！  ゲストハウスでドミトリーにロッカーってある事って今までなかったのでとてもいいポイント！ また、パジャマも無料レンタルで作務衣を貸してもらえます。 24時間営業のドンキも1分のところにありとても良い立地。

We had a great stay. Clean, comfortable and cozy. The gentleman at the desk was very friendly and helpful. He brought donuts and helped us with our luggage. Affordable price too. My husband and I had the private room during our stay.

((++))  Check in/out easy. Staff friendly. ---- Room was nice & simple (liked), but not poor. Room was very clean. Spacious enough for one person (with 1 kid). Bed large enough for 1 parent and 1 kid. Excellent mattress yielding good sleep. Good cushions. Nice TV (free, BS258 Disney Channel in ENG). Free WiFi. Window could be opened to let fresh air in. Nice to have a water heater and coffee/green tea available. ---- Nice simple clean bathroom with useful amenities. ---- Nice policy of eco-cleaning (i.e., skip cleaning the room for up to 3 days) with a water bottle for each day cleaning is omitted and fresh towels in front of your door. ---- Good Italian restaurant around the corner. Indian restaurant next door. 7/11 across the street. ((--)) Too narrow space between desk and

bed in the main room. ---- Coffee/Tea not replaced on a daily basis. ---- Shower makes a lot of noise when warm water is turned on. If too much hot water is flowing (to get rid of the noise), danger of burning your feet when you adjust the mix warm/cold before activating the shower head. Toilet seat a bit too small. ---- Outside in the hall ways, the carpet seems old. Carpet in the elevators seems very used (understandably). Maybe tiles in elevators would be good.

Terrible hotel- be aware for $110 US this was my experience- no heat or a/c throughout the entire hotel, had hot water in the shower for a few seconds and then quickly ran out, tea kettle didn’t work, they promised to bring a fan as the room was so hot and it never arrived after several requests-  I had to open the window and the street noise was so bad I didn’t sleep.  Find another hotel as anything has to be better than this-  the bathtub is so small your knees come up to your face - room is very small but I could handle that- all the rest made it unbearable -

The room is "compact" but clean, well organised and sufficient for a single person. It's the smallest hotel room I've slept in but it worked! The bed was comfortable, the desk is small but useable, flat screen tv which you can pay for with a transit card (nothing in English, though), a tea kettle and the usual toilet accessories are provided. I only had a carry-on bag - anything larger might have presented a space problem. The check-in is annoying but the price is great. This is an expensive area and there are many pricey restaurants nearby as well as Rappongi.

We stayed at APA hotel nishi azabu in October 2018 and got the small double room (it was the cheapest deal). It's a nice clean hotel. It's small, which is expected.   Great location. It's about a 5 minute walk to the Hiro station. It is also about a 15 minute WALK to Roppongi!!!! 5 minute walk away to 7 eleven convenience store. This hotel is far enough from the busy area so that it's nice and quite at night. But it's also within walking distance to great restaurants in Roppongi.  The hotel has a French bakery on the ground floor, the baked goods look delicious, but quiet expensive.   The way the bed is situated, you'd have to jump over each other to get off the bed in the middle of the night to use the bathroom. Not really a hassle for us, but might be a hassle for those of you

who are light-sleepers. We luckily got a corner room, and bright windows on 2 sides, and had a view of the city!  There are plenty of USB plugs right by the bed, and also a couple of electric plugs for your chargers.   There's a vending machine on our floor, just in case you really wanted something to drink. We usually opted to walk to the convenience store, though, because it's way cheaper than the vending machine.  You'll see from our pictures how we situated our backpack and carry on luggage (we only brought 1 travel pack and 1 carry on suit case for our 2 week trip). We had to place the backpack on the table, and the suit case at the corner of the room. Even with 2 small suit cases, it was a very tight fit, but it was totally manageable for us.

Oh God !! Japan takes the cake for smallest hotel rooms in world. APA hotels, chain of hotels in japan.  rooms are old, toilets are squeezed up, breakfast closed earlier.   But they keep it clean, thats japanese culture  dont recommend for family at all,  one night at the most if you can't find any other hotels

It’s in an OK location. Check in times are ridiculous 4pm until 10pm. Luckily we were able to check in early. The staff are friendly and speak a little English. The toilets and showers were clean and maintained well. There is very little room through out the hostel. No where to sit except the beds! But it’s perfect for people who just need a place to sleep.

大学受験の為に息子と宿泊しました。2月の私大入試、2月の国立二次の2回です。 書斎付きの広いお部屋でした。お部屋、お風呂、キッチンなど設備がバッチリ。調味料など持参して自炊しました。近くにスーパーのオリンピックもあり、買い物も便利ですし、洗濯機もあり、洗濯物を乾燥機や浴室乾燥で乾かすこともできました。書斎はベッドとデスクがあり、可動式のドアがあり、独立した部屋にすることができ、そこで勉強しておりました。完全に家にいる感覚でリラックスして過ごせました。受験でとお伝えしていたところ、スタッフの皆様が、合格鉛筆や折り紙でだるまを折って下さったものなど、お部屋に置いてくださいました。お心遣いに感激しました。2回の滞在の際も、素敵なお菓子をご用意くださいました。レセプションや清掃のスタッフの皆様が本当に感じが良く、次も泊まりたいと思う施設でした。高層階だったので、部屋のテラスから夜景も楽しめました。お陰様で第一志望に合格し、今でも、こちらのホテルのお陰だね。と息子と話しております。 受験で長期で上京する方にはかなりおすすめです！

We usually stay at there Oakwood Premier Tokyo near Tokyo station since they all sold out this time. So, We tried there sister one.  First when we checked in we asked the reception if we can do a 1pm check out instead a noon check out. She told us if we we want a late check out we will have to pay for a whole day. ( never heard of that before ).  2nd) at night when I was asleep and  my wife woke me up told me there was a USED condom inside the laundry basket which is very disgusting.  3), we have stayed many different hotels, Airbnbs or service apt they all have a shower gel and shampoo provided, they have a 3 travel size bottles in the bathroom when asked if we can get more. she told us that they don't provide it then why do you have it there when we checked in. ( Specially for
the money we paid for the room).     We will never stay at the place anymore !!!!

Location is superb being minutes walk from the Shinjuku shopping belt,  It offers a great sleep as it's located in a quiet residential neighborhood.  Check-in is at the cafe on the ground floor.  Service is really superb!  The reception lady came out to send us off on the taxi to airport.

Unbeatable location. Very well equipped and modern apartment. With a small kitchen and washing machine in it. Very friendly staff. We stayed there at the end of our tour in Japan and we will return. Thank you very much for the stay.

The apartment is not big, but very comfortable, including a kitchen, fully equipped bathroom (with washer), a balcony, and a nicely decorated living room. The apartment is about a 10 minute walk from the Narita-Express platform at Shinjuku Station.  The front-desk staff is nice and VERY helpful.  Domo Arigato!   I find the place PERFECT for a 2-5 night stay, so I will just list the things that could be improved.  The washing-machine operating buttons are in Japanese.  I could not find an English manual anywhere (not even on the IPad included in the room).  A simple English-language sheet explaining where the ON-button and the Start-button are would be fabulous.  The lack of a proper work-desk might present issues to those with a weak lower back... the couch-and-coffee-table
arrangement is very attractive, but has it's drawbacks for heavy computer users.

Certainly this hotel is I think that it is good hotel. However, as a result of using less frequently, decline in the quality of service was seen. More specifically, in the reduction of the room of furniture, removal of bathrobe. And and so polite of the front of the human service. Use of a few times I thought it was appropriate for the year.

We stayed here again last month-this time for 11 nights. The staff were excellent and very helpful. Our room was on the 6th (top) floor, with a king-size bed and very nice linens. As expected,there was practically no storage space for clothes-we made the most of the pole with hangers.There was a separate toilet room and an adjacent large room with a jetted tub and shower. We enjoyed the Toto toilet with the heated washlet seat. The flat screen TV and the wifi worked well, as did the small fridge.The price is still low compared to large hotels in central Tokyo. We crossed the street most mornings for excellent lattes and pastries at the Donq boulangerie, and spent a lot of time exploring the narrow streets and shops of Jiyugaoka. There is so much to see in the area- there was a
festival with entertainment and street vendors one weekend. This location gives you the opportunity to be part of an affluent Tokyo neighbourhood.

Great place to stay just out of Tokyo. One of the more modern suburbs where fashionable higher-income youth come to shop and hang out, with lots of interesting boutique shops and some famous places such as Sweets Forest and some popular cheesecake/egg tart place that had a huge queue. There was a takoyaki chain store across the road, supermarket, cafes, and it was a few minutes walk from the train station.   Staff spoke really good English and gave very professional service. Our superior queen room was larger than we expected and great value for what we paid. The bathroom was very stylish and modern, with marble and mirrors, and a separate shower room with heaps of space and a large bath to our surprise. Bed was very large and comfortable, and the TV had free access to a premium

(adult) channel (tee hee) not that there was anything good on anyway.   Great luxury amenities at a budget price, minus the whole fancy room service and hotel bar atmosphere.   They also helped us out by looking after our luggage for the afternoon when we checked out.

We made this hotel out home base for a week of vacation with kids in Tokyo. It was recommended by someone who used to live in this neighborhood. It's a two minute walk to a station on two subway lines, takes half an hour to get to central Tokyo (Roppongi, Ginza, etc.) or 20 minutes to Omotesando/Harajuku shopping. Jiyugaoka itself is a fun and youthful neighborhood with lots of cool boutiques and cafes.  By Western standards this is a solid three star hotel, with decent sized rooms, full Japanese style baths (in most rooms), free Wi-Fi, and pleasant service. It lacks a business center (nowhere to print maps for your daily excursion) and laundry facilities, but both are nearby in Jiyugaoka, and a good supermarket (Peacock) is right across the street. All of this for about half
what you would pay in Roppongi or Ginza.

The room was very clean but tiny, which wasn't unexpected. The location is nice, being close to the train station. The wifi connection was also good, which was appreciated. My biggest problem with this hotel was the rock hard bed, could not get a decent night's sleep.

restaurants.name: Wine No Sakaba Di Punto, Jiyugaoka

reviews: Had a lovely stay here for my first few nights in Tokyo. I was really happy with it as a base to come back to every evening after spending busy days in and around the city. My wee pod was nice and comfortable and felt private enough to give me my own space which I appreciated. Check in was very straightforward. The accommodation was very clean throughout. Overall, excellent for the price. I did pop my head in downstairs as I was leaving to say thanks but sadly didn’t see anyone around. I will recommend this place to friends who plan to visit Tokyo in the future and may even return myself.

It is a really great hostel located only 5 minutes walk from Tokyo Skytree. Perfect to explore Tokyo. The hostel is very small and very clean with great showers. Would stay there again any time.  Also they have a bar and small restaurant. All in all perfect!

I came to Tokyo with the idea to minimize expenses and live comfortably. You can do it a t Morishita. From subway look for A3 exit. These exit signs are black against yellow background. I belive you can get this to this exit from Shinzuku line, not sure about Oedo line. Once on the street turn right, then follow your gps or my picture from googlemap. Too eat good all you need is 2 shops about 200-300 feet west of subway exit , at the main intersection you see on the pictures. One is meat, rice, salad etc. (very good, apparently family biz). And across from it, on the east side of the street is a french backery (yammy). Some quarter of a mile south from this crossroads is another bakery "Cattlea" (Tokyo Cheapo website mentions the one) Also very good. And for night time somewhere

north of the crossroads is "7-11" like 24hrs store. For 400-500 yen buy a cold dinner, the clerk will hit it for you in a microwave. That was my first meal in Tokyo, at 4 am. That's when I realized I don't need to follow those restaurant reviews. In this city (and in this country, I guess) you can eat good anywhere, anytime. At any of the shops I mentioned the bill did not exede 1000 yen. They might not though take credit cards. Do have cash. As for the hotel itself, all is good. Small room but enough for one or two. For public transportation get PASMO card, very convenient. According to reviews on booking.com hotel WI-FI is exellent. I borrowd a divcie at Narita airport. For 3 days some 4000 yen. However there are numerous shops with internet diveces like mine from "Wi-fi for hire", sim card etc. So, if you need internet on the go, not just at a hotel, don't worry, you will get something, I guess at any airport in Japan. I can account only for Narita and Haneda. Battery on the internet device was enough for a day and a half.

I have stayed in Urban Hotel for 12 nights. The Hotel is situated in Morishita, near two subway stations and is easily accessible from practically everywhere in Tokyo. The rooms were quite spacious (in Japanese standards) and as always in Japan, clean and tidy. The rooms contained all tolietica except combs and were equipped with air conditioning. Free Wi-Fi  is available in all rooms and has excellent connection. The hotel also contains a Laundromat.  On the downside: no one from the hotel staff speaks English (Japan after all), furthermore there is no breakfast or a restaurant in the hotel, however, you can make your own coffee in the morning using a heater at the front desk. The area around the hotel has many Isakayas (Traditional Japanese pubs) and some western restaurants
as well.   All in all Urbal Hotel Morishita is a good choice for both business and pleasure and receives the rank of 8 on the Daniel Scale..

We arrived and were told that there would be no staff to check us in so we just had to turn up and see what happened.   The hostel is distinctly average and there are bed bugs in dorm C at least. As a group of 4, we weren't happy at all because we didn't meet any staff during our entire stay. Would not recommend staying.

The Star Inn is a fantastic place to stay in Tokyo! It was like experiencing a real Japanese home just outside of the city and in a lovely local area. We were a bit apprehensive before staying at the Star Inn as it seemed very far out of Tokyo and the photos did not do it any justice. However, we absolutely loved our stay and wish we stayed for longer than 2 nights! (We were in the private double and the bed was so comfortable). Theres a very close train station in Aoto where you can get to pretty anywhere in Tokyo, it was great and very easy to get to from the Airport. We will be recommending this place to other travellers and friends :) thank you again for a wonderful stay. Amy & Max from England

Been here with my friends. And we're really love it.  The front desk is only until 10pm, and we're come after it. But we already inform to them about our arrival time, so the staff keep waiting until we check in. Kind of worried regardings to the reviews here, but after we check in we're decide that we're love this place. The family room is small for 5 and our luggage, so we decided to take out 1 bed from the room and we're share the other bed. The staff is so kind and friendly and so informative. I will recommend this place to my friends.

I found this place to be convenient as a base for exploring Tokyo. Seems to be owned and run by a small collective of friends so it’s cool to support an independent hostel rather than a mega-hostel. The neighbourhood is very chilled and, though there’s not much to do directly around, it’s kinda’ cool to get an insight into suburban capital life. The hostel is easy to get to from Narita airport as it’s a straight ride on the Keisei line. It’s quite a commute to western Tokyo from here but - logically - convenient for Eastern Tokyo sights like Ueno Park or Oshiage Skytree. In conclusion, don’t hesitate to chose this place; it’s a more than solid choice.

My families and I stayed in Star Inn for 3 nights. The rate per night is relatively cheap compared to other hostel.   Small and cosy, clean and very friendly staff who could speak good English.  However I think the location of the hostel is a little far from the sub way station, about 10 mins walk.  There are many cosy restaurants around the hostel and the 7-11 is just 5 mins away from it.  For those who love to bowl, there is a bowling alley nearby just newly renovated.

Ikebukuro lodging was a very cozy place in my opinion. The staff and their fascilities were overall great. The lodge is only 10-15 minutes walk from the Ikebukoro metro station. I stayed for a night and had a pleasant experience. Good value for the money.

I loved this place - the staff were so friendly and the location was perfect - near enough Ikebukuro station but far enough away that it was so peaceful . The room was such good value and was extremely clean. Recently renovated showers - would highly recommend it.

Glad to have stayed in this hostel for the last 2 days of my Tokyo trip.  I am very thankful that they let me store my luggage for 2N prior to my check in as I wasn't allowed to bring larger luggage to board highway bus. At first, I have problem locating this place from Ikebukuro Station Exit 35. Later, I tried walking towards Sunshine City (Tokyu Hands), cross the zebra crossing (Under the bridge)..I reached Tomod's Drug store. Turn left, walk along the pavement, I passed by Hotel Route Inn, Ikebukuro Hospital..then make a turn and the Lodging is there ! I think it is value for money that I could get a room for myself for the price paid (don't have to stay in capsules and has more privacy than cabin hotels). It provides good amenities like shower gel, shampoo and facial wash.

There is also a big fridge, hot water dispenser, microwave and washer too. The premise is kept very clean. The single lady's room I stayed though not very big, is spacious enough to open luggage and there is big rack for hanging clothes, very practical. My only minor dislike is that sometimes I could hear footsteps when people walk along the corridor. Overall, I enjoyed my stay there.

Room was small which is to be expected in Japan. Clean due to being quite new, they did not clean my room during my entire stay. Another thing which turned me off was their rule on their website which indicated a curfew. This was actually the wrong wording, it wasn't a lock out but actually having no service reception during the hours of 1-5am. You will be provided an access code so you can enter the building at any time.

急な出張で泊まりの有無が土壇場までわからず、なるべく安く宿を抑えておきたいと思い選びました。もともとドヤだということも理解した上で予約しましたが、結果的には3000円であの部屋に泊まれるなら全然OK。そして特筆は宿の方々の対応の素晴らしさ。とても親切にしていただき、リピートしたいと思わせられましたよ。各室に新しいエアコンがあり、シャワーも快適で、シャンプーとボディーソープは置いてあります。トイレも共同ですが清潔。壁が薄いので隣室や廊下の音が気になる人は耳栓いるかも。私は全く気になりませんでしたが。一応門限ありますが、暗証番号で玄関開きます。池袋駅徒歩10分かかりません。言うことなし。

Situated in more quiet part of Shinjuku, it is not far walking or train ride from all of the happening spots. The space is modern but still very cozy and comfortable. The staff here is great. Everyone has a smile and they are all willing to help. I will look to book with Glou again when I return to Tokyo.

We stayed 4 nights in the GLOU, and it's honestly difficult to rate. The location is wonderful, easy walk to the subway, $10 taxi ride to the major Shinjuku train station, easy walk to Golden Gai. The hotel is clean and new. The staff is wonderful with excellent English! BUT... the rooms are VERY small, and there is virtually no storage. It's difficult to walk between the bed and the wall to get to the small amount of floor space to put your luggage. That's the only drawback, but it's fairly major. We'd probably consider spending more next time to get a larger room.

Hôtel très bon rapport qualité prix,l’hôtel est neuf et super high-tech  Le personnel super sympa  Metro à proximité avec des restos juste à côté  Il est situé dans une petite contre allée  Je le recommande fortement

J’ai pris cet hotel pour 4 jours puis 3jours en ne sachant pas a quoi m’attendre ! Et quelle fut ma surprise, le personnel est génial, la localisation aussi a 2mn a pied de higashi-shinjuku.pas loin de la okubo jr station (environ 12mn de marche) quartier très animé le soir de ce coté. Chambres propres et entretenues. Je recommande ++++

I visited Tokyo in November with 3 friends, GLOU is located in the heart of Shinjuku. We loved the rooms, clean, new and simple!  The team was always there to help us with recommendations!   Thank you Fan and the team!

まだ新しいこともあり、全体的に綺麗で清潔。 チェックイン時にペットボトル水を頂けた。 フットマッサージャーなども貸し出してくれる模様。 洗顔や化粧水等のアメニティは、1階でゲットするタイプ。 シングルに宿泊。 部屋はシンプルな作り。 テレビは地上波、BS、YouTubeが見られる。 ビデオ系はなかったような。 あと、自分のスマホ画面をミラーリングできる。 ただ、テレビモニタの角度などは変更できない。 1階に休憩スペースを兼ねたカフェ（コーヒー＆パン程度）がある。 部屋、カフェともに、電源＋USBポートあり。 中心部からちょっとだけ離れてることもあってか、静かな立地。 全体的にシンプルで清潔感のあって使い勝手の良い印象。

1年前の開業数日後に宿泊。 2019/10/4新築オープンの新しいホテルで、当時ここまで開業間もないホテルに泊まったことはなく新鮮だった。  池袋駅や荒川線の向原駅からは少し歩くが、ホテルからサンシャインシティに近く歩いて行けるので便利。  14階建てのホテルで、コインランドリー（下の洗濯機と上の乾燥機各3台）や 飲料自販機はあるが、大浴場は無い。 朝は1階のカフェで軽食（パンやドリンク）が販売される。 エレベーターは2台連動で対面配置、新しく綺麗な三菱製。 1階から乗車の際はカードキーを翳し、↑ボタンが点滅中に押す。  客室内はシンプルなデザインで、オープンしたばかりだった為綺麗だった。 Wi-Fiは共通IDの他、客室毎に個別の物がある。 何れもテレビ画面に表示されるが、個別の物はミラーリング説明の画面で表示されており分かりにくかった。 （ミラーリングも試したが結局出来ず）  近隣には"セレクト"が付かない同グループ既存のホテル 「ホテルウイングインターナショナル池袋」（1989/11竣工→2000/8開業）がある為、あまり無いとは思うが間違いに注意。 荒川線向原駅から真っ直ぐ歩いて来た場合はそちらのホテルを先に見ることとなる。 ほんの少し遠くなるが、同じ荒川線の東池袋四丁目駅や有楽町線東池袋駅からも徒歩圏内。

目的の劇場に近いことと、全館禁煙とあったので選びました。 部屋はきれいで、禁煙だから臭くないし、ゆったりしているし、おまけに静かでした。とても落ち着けました。タオルもパジャマも心地良かった。 スタッフの皆さんの応対も気持ち良いものでした。 また是非利用したいと思います。  1階のカフェスペースも良かったのですが、すぐ近くに喫煙室があるのが難点でした。最初は人が居なかったからよかったけど、喫煙者が来て…。 全館禁煙と謳ってるのだから、喫煙室も無しで徹底されたほうが、安心して利用できるかなと思いました。 なのでマイナス１しました。

2019年10月新開的酒店, 距離 JR 站有一點遠, 但非常整潔, 設備完善, 房間有洗澡用品. 有很多物品可以借用, 雖然按摩器有點弱, 但很有誠意. 可能因為新開,工作人員多為見習生, 離開酒店去成田機場前, 詢問有關行李宅配問題幫不了忙 其他工作人員溝通都可以, 服務很好, 有幫忙訂到想去的餐廳 唯一建議, 可以給住客提供一些資訊, 例如行李托運, 由酒店去池袋站那一個入口方便推著大行李使用

Stayed here for 6 nights, and I think I will definitely consider staying here again on my next visit. The hotel is new, and the room is very clean and spacious comparing to other hotels in the area. Even though it’s a bit far from the train station, I still think they are worth the money.  But a couple things need to be addressed, 1. On my first morning, a housekeeper tried to open my door without knocking, what if I was changing and other guest was walking pass the hallway? This is totally unprofessional for them to do this, knock before you enter a room is a common sense, shouldn’t be making this kind of mistake at all.  2. The room doesn’t come with air purifier w/ humidifier which is pretty much a standard amenity in Japan.  Other than these, I can’t think of anything else

My friend told me to stay in Shinjuku when we visited Tokyo so I'm really glad that we came across G-stays. The location was amazing and just down the street there were a bunch of cool bars and affordable restaurants. I had some of the best ramen of my life just around the corner. The staff was super friendly and gave us some good recommendations for things to do in Tokyo too. The bed was really comfortable as well. Definitely recommended!

Our expectation of G-Stays when researching for our trip was relatively low, but we were encouraged by many reviews raving about location and quality of the rooms. Our experience (which is ongoing at time of writing), has been anything but.  Location is certainly central - but what people fail to mention is this establishment is nestled amongst the sleazy 'love hotels' and nearby strip clubs. This may not be a issue for many, but families may want to think twice.  Space wherever you are in Japan is a premium, and we did not expect to have the largest room when booking with G Stays. However, my partner who is 5"7 only just manages to fit under an incredibly inconvenient archway between the kitchenette and the bedroom. As a 6"3 male, the number of times I have hit my head on this

is unreal. Let alone the height of the bathroom ceiling once in the shower, meaning I can not stand while showing. The toilet in the same bathroom is also squished between the wall the door and the sink - all fitting into no more than 3 square metres.  When checking in, we were told as we were staying for a duration of 5 nights we would receive a "courtesy clean" of the room (weird, as an establishment that is consistently described as a 'hotel', I would've expected this daily?). We arranged for the clean to occur on the 3rd day of our stay, and upon returning found the room untouched. When asking the front desk if this was our mistake, they told us the clean was scheduled for the following day. Innocent mistake perhaps, but this voids the whole point of a clean halfway through your stay.  Throughout our stay (and again, continuing at time of writing) the most notable problem with this "hotel" is the maintenance and renovations in progress. At 8:30am every morning, we have been awoken by loud banging from inside the building. Maintenance is understandable and is clearly needed within the establishment. However we were not notified at check-in and there were no signs indicating this anywhere throughout the building. A clear annoyance for anyone wanting to sleep past 8:30am.  In summary; would not recommend.

Next door to the Subway Station, which in Tokyo means everything. The Staff is efficient and ready for prompt help, in whatever you need. Several convenience stores and 24h supermarket nearby. Also there are lots of restaurants, pharmacies and beauty stores in walking distance. I would stay there again and suggest to my friends.

Lovely staff here and the hotel was in a great location (central but not really noisy) but it was really really small. Not very consistent hot water in the bathroom and just a real squeeze generally for 3 of us.

Perfect location,low price!just beside higashi-shinjuku station,near shinjuku station(yamanote line)if from narita airport.place is surrounded by malls,restaurants,cafe,fast food,convenience stores!and the staff speaks English perfectly!❤️
東京駅、日本橋に近く地下鉄銀座線駅直近で移動にも便利です。羽田空港からも近くの宝町駅に乗り換えなしで行けます。 部屋は新しくバスが独立で快適でした。１階がコンビニで便利です。

立地が良いです。羽田空港へはホテルから約3分で『宝町』駅まで歩いて行けます。宝町からは1本で行けるので立地も非常に良い。また東京へのアクセスも良く、『八重洲南口』から歩いて5分もかかりませんでした。ホテルから銀座へも歩いて行けます。部屋は23平米ですが、間取りはビジホと変わらないため広さをあまり感じませんでした。(バスルームを広めに取ってあるからかも) バストイレ別でバスタブとレインシャワーもある優れもの。ベッドは一般的なビジホよりは広いです。立地的に翌朝出発が早い人やホテルにこもってあまり観光しない人におすすめのホテルだと思います。

2020年2月1日オープン。銀座線京橋駅からすぐ。出来たてですからお部屋は綺麗で清潔◎。お部屋は広めで荷物の収納も◎1Fはセブンイレブン。ホテル裏はヤマト運輸もあり、荷物もすぐ送れる（土・日曜・祝日休）。勿論、ホテルからも荷物は送れますが、直営店ですから梱包もしてくれます。何よりも銀座線京橋近くあることで、至る所へのアクセスは抜群◎銀座（目の前）、日本橋へは徒歩5分。東京駅へも8分。銀座線は他の東京メトロへの乗り換え、JRへのアクセスが容易なので大変便利な地下鉄です。フロントの方は、まだ経験不足で、常連のお客様の顔も覚えられず不慣れ感はありますが、頑張っていらっしゃるし、経験を積んでいけばどんどんよくなると思います。もと地元民から言わせていただくと、超穴場の清潔感あるホテルだと思います。現在もリピート利用しています。平日だと、日本橋へ出かければ色々な和食や食べ物が楽しめます（路地裏に色々あります）♪

オープン間もなくに利用したが、立地や新しい設備は良いものの、フロントは不慣れで全くサービスの説明が為されず随分居心地が悪かった、部屋には珈琲の用意も無い。 東京駅徒歩圏内とバス・トイレ別で２１平米の広めの部屋が売りの模様だが、その広さはあるのだろうがレイアウトの不味さで広くは感じられず、風呂もやや狭目で中途半端な大きさなのは残念、大きなズボンプレッサーが部屋内に固定されていて服に引っかかりそうで落ち着かず、窓の景色が隣接するビル壁なのはがっかりだが、内装が明るい色なのは救い、黒い内装の銀座の同系列ホテルよりは印象が良い。
最上階にあるフロントでチェックインをしてそこを通過して部屋に入るシステム。 安全性は高い。 部屋はとても綺麗だが、そこまで広いわけではない。 隣にちゃんとしたスーパーがあるので、買い出しは問題なし。 またウーバーや出前館も可能。フロントまで来てもらってそこで食事を受け取る。 駅からは10分少々歩く必要あり。

フロントが最上階にあり、客室へはエレベーターで降りると言う新しいスタイルに驚きました。新しいホテルで、フロント横には小さな庭園があり、和を基調としてまとまったコンセプトに気品を感じました。 客室は立地を考えると仕方ありませんが、あと少しだけ広ければと言う感じです。しかし、新しいだけあり、コンセントやスイッチ類は痒いところに手が届く配置ですし、テレビやソファーの配置もグッドです。 一番ありがたいのはトイレとバスが別で、ゆっくりと湯船に浸かれて疲れを癒せます。 スタッフも洗練されていて気持ち良く過ごせました。 ぜひ、また利用したいと思います。

できたばかりで大変キレイなホテルです。 フロントが１４階にあり、１階から直通エレベーターで向かいます。１４階から各階に向かうエレベータに乗り換えます。その際ルームキーがないとエレベーターが動きません。セキュリティはバッチリです。 今回泊まった部屋はモデレートツインでした。こちらのホテルの特徴として、トイレとバスルームが完全に独立しています。またバスルームも広々としていて、湯船も大きくていいですね。泊まる時には必ず入浴剤を用意したいです。 加湿空気清浄器も完備で、部屋に関して文句のつけようはないですね。 １４階にはホテルバーがあり、夜景を見ながらお酒を楽しむことができます。お酒の種類もなかなか豊富ですが、なにより日本酒の種類が多いというのがいいですね。日本酒党としては大変うれしいです。 朝食にも力を入れていて定食を選ぶことができます。今回は焼魚と鯛茶漬けの２種類から鯛茶漬けをいただきました。ご飯のお替りもできますので、朝からついつい食べ過ぎてしまいました。 アクセスも八丁堀・茅場町・日本橋・宝町の４駅の真ん中に位置していて交通の便も大変良いです。 ビジネスで使う事もありですが、観光で使ったり、ちょっとご褒美で泊まって非日常感を味わいたい、という人にもおすすめです。 総じてコストパフォーマンスは大変高いですね。 是非また泊まりたいホテルです。

開業当日に宿泊しました。東京駅八重洲口から徒歩12分とホームページにありましたが、運良く青信号が続き10分弱で到着。一度も曲がることなく、ただまっすぐ歩いて到着。土地勘の無い中高年にやさしい！！  エレベーターでフロントある14階に付き、ドアが開いた途端、屋上日本庭園！？　その向こうに東京駅が見えます。  ロビーに出ると和服を着たスタッフがお出迎えをしてくれました。 新型コロナ対策をしっかりと行っているようで、フロントカウンターにはアクリル板があり、まずは非接触体温計での検温から。 新人ホテルマンを先輩ホテルマンがしっかりとサポートしていて、笑顔と初々しい接客が好印象でした。   エレベーターは玄関から14階フロント直通が2機とセキュリティ付きの客室移動用の2機が分かれていました。 カードキーを持っていない人は、絶対に客室へのエレベーターを動かせないそうです。 また、外出から戻る時は一度フロントの14階を経由します。 セキュリティは万全。帰ってくる度に日本庭園が見られ、ホテルマンのお出迎えもあるので、お得感倍増。   ホテルから徒歩20秒程の24時間スーパーでお買物をして戻ってくると、夜の日本庭園を歩いている人がいる。 見ていたら、「よろしければ庭園をご覧ください」と素敵な和服の女性に声を掛けていただいたので、実際に出てみました。 「スカイツリーとか東京タワーとか見えませんよね？」とダメもとで聞いてみたら、「どちらもご覧いただけます。フロントの向こうにはベイブリッジもご覧いただけます」とのこと。 庭園の奥にはスカイツリーの上部が、逆側には東京タワーが、フロントの向こうにはベイブリッジが見えました。 出張で泊まったホテルでなんて贅沢。

ちなみに、和服の女性スタッフは常にいる訳ではないそうですので、お会いできたらディズニーのミッキーマウス並みにラッキーかも？   客室は期間限定というアップグレードプランを選び、ベッドの大きなダブルルームを独り占めできました。 お部屋には南部鉄器が置いてあったり（実際に使えます）、バス・トイレ・洗面が別々の3点独立タイプという作りだそうです。 バスルームは、明るくて広くてシャワーの水圧もしっかりあり、好みにピッタリ。 ベッドサイドにコンセントやＵＳＢ差込口があり、スマホの充電とパソコンでの資料作りも問題なし。   夜は14階の庭園に面したバーでお酒をいただき、朝食は1階の和食で食べたのですが、どちらも驚き・大満足。 次回投稿させていただきます。   今回はコロナ時期での緊急出張でしたが、いつか家族を連れてきたいホテルです。 お世話になりました。

東京でホテルを探し、建物が新しく（2019年7月オープン）価格も手頃なこちらにしました。 上野と浅草の中間に位置し、どちらからも徒歩10分程度です。最寄駅である東京メトロ銀座線の稲荷町駅からは徒歩5～6分です。 基準階は1フロアに5部屋、全体でも38部屋のコンパクトなホテルで、最上階には露天風呂がありました（利用しませんでしたが）。 部屋はそれほど広くありませんが、テレビや棚を壁付けにしたり、椅子ではなく壁際にソファを置いたりして、使いやすくまとめられていました。壁の色使いもお洒落な雰囲気でした。 東京に行く際は、また利用させて頂きたいと思います。 （館内案内を見ると、2階の自動販売機と、10階の自動販売機・駐輪場が、テープで隠されていました。オープンからそれほど経っていませんが、宿泊客の使い方に何が問題でもあったのでしょうか？）

location was perfect within less 15min walk to Senso-ji temple.  A slow walk around street corner, you might surprise there is plenty things to see.  Oh yes, a foot step across street, there is mini AEON hypermarket which open till 11PM.  Certainly the upper floor of onsen bath is just perfect, open air view! you might able to see Tokyo Skytree if you tall enough :)  Last, I and my friends loving staffs hospitality, kudos to excellent Ms.Won at reception lobby who help us along way giving tips where best place to go.

เดินทางสะดวกใกล้ subway สถานี inaricho ภายในห้องตกแต่งสวยดีแต่ขนาดห้องเล็กไปหน่อย เปิดกระเป๋าเดินทางขนาด 25 นิ้วก็เต็มพื้นที่ว่างในห้อง ไม่มีทางให้เดิน  ชอบที่บริเวณหัวเตียงมีช่องปลั๊กและช่อง usb ในตัว พนักงานต้อนรับค่อนข้างสื่อสารภาษาอังกฤษได้ดี

Wish it was a tad bigger but our stay was great! Clean and modern, very secured, rooftop hot tub, 7 kin walk from the Inaricho Station. If you have plenty luggage or are a bigger person, you probably want to book somewhere with more space. We spent most of our time sightseeing so it was really perfect for our needs.

It was a nice vacation with my brother and friend,this is better than staying in a hostel,even the room is small,its clean and modern,newely built accomodation accesible to both asakusa and ueno areas.The wifi is good ,the price is fair for tokyo price range.We had a good night sleep,neighborhood is really really calm and the bathroom is nice.I would love to stay again

オープンして間もなく利用させていただきました。レディース専用キャビンは大変居心地がよく、パウダールームも広くて基礎化粧品も全て揃っていて大変ありがたいです。2階の共同スペースでは、無料でコーヒーもいただけます。ウォーターサーバーや電子レンジもあります。ウォーターサーバーが水が無くなっているのに補充されていないことと、コーヒーマシンがメンテナンスに入ったせいか？ 夕飯後に飲めないのは残念でした。シャワールームは最高に快適で清潔です。広さも申し分無し！ また泊まりたいお宿です💮💯

Very clean, the facilities were great. The cabins were spacious, I could easily stand up in mine. The lounge area was very fancy and great place to chat with people who coming from all over the world! It’s close to Sensoji shrine and Tokyo Skytree!

Stayed here for 2 nights from the opening day. This place is located very close to all the attractions in Asakusa, stations and shops.  During our stay there, we went to Akihabara it was only a few stations away. The staffs were very friendly and helpful!! They even stored our luggages before check in and after check out so that we could stroll around Asakusa. Thank you so much:) Will definitely come back next time I visit Tokyo.
友達と貸切の部屋に泊まりました！ 友達同士で部屋で話したり快適に過ごすことができました。貸切部屋のちゃぶ台が可愛かったです！

My family and I stayed in this hostel for 5 days and 4 nights.   I must say that the place met my expectations and exceeded them! Even though the rooms were a bit small, the place was quiet and very comfortable. It had everything we needed. The room, bathroom and toilet were always clean! It had a tiny lounge area, and was quite inconvenient during meal time because it was the only place for guests to eat. The staff were very helpful and kind, so I would like to commend them for doing such a good job.   We will definitely stay in this hostel again!

A simple thing as a warm welcome can make you feel as if you have arrive and that you’re in the right place. I knew this as soon as the door opened and I was greeted. Check in was fairly easy and the room was neat. I do have to say that my capsule smelled a little like a wet dog which I either got used to or my perfume was able to mask the smell during my stay there. We stayed in the dormitory room. The total of 4 of us were able to make it work with all of our luggage. There were times where we had to finesse our movements about the room but thankfully it was done without complaints. I wouldn’t know how this would work for a solo traveler if unused to sharing space with strangers but my stay was with 3 of my siblings. I would one hundred percent recommend this hostel to all

traveler in that the staff are super friendly in a way that was never forced and its accessibility to the sensoji shrine. The shrine is a 15 min max walk away from the hostel and if you feel incline to continue which I heavily recommend, then another 30 minute walk to the Tokyo sky tree. The dormitory comes with a shower in the room and toilets are outside. The floor and bathrooms were always tidy and as odd as it to say to this, the toilets were a work of art. Especially how it’s flushed. I do recommend trying the Japanese curry and Plum wine from the restaurant. My brothers felt extremely comfortable there and made some friends with some other travelers staying in the hostel. We had no problem finding the place because location was saved into google map. It’s a walk away from the Ginza, Asakusa and the Hibaya line. I think the Asakusa line was the closest. I think this was by far the most welcoming place that I’ve stayed in all of my travels. So shout out to the cook, the manager and staff.

We had to walk around 10 mins but there a couple of restaurants and 7/11 so it’s worth the walk. Rooms are really comfortable and clean - same goes to toilets! People working there are really nice and helpful. The area is quite and easy to reach with subway.

It was the first time I traveled solo and stayed in a dormitory type of accommodation. Definitely worth repeating again! The price was really good, location was close to the metro and the room and common areas were clean. Not to mention the staff were really accommodating and friendly. Hoping to be able to book again soon :)

Asakusa is a quiet, safe area in Tokyo to stay. This bunk/ cabin small hotel was well priced but quite a walk for the 3 metro stations. The common area was tiny and walls between room and common area /bathrooms didn't go all way to ceiling so it was super noisy even though small number of guests.

I stayed at 7 hostels/hotels while traveling through Japan and this was my favorite by far. So clean, welcoming, comfortable, and friendly. Asakusa is a great central neighborhood, and my friend and I enjoyed walking the area, and it's so easy to get to multiple major subway lines from here. The bathrooms were especially nice here. Everything just makes you feel comfortable, and happy to come back after a long day of exploring Tokyo.

they deserve to set a higher price on their rooms. I visited again in a year because the last visit gave me a good impressions, they was still maintaining the best environment as same as i visited last time when they newly opened. all the greenery decor and Japanese zen style interior was really impressive. different kinds of unique plants were beautiful and made me feel like I’m in garden. especially drawing on the bunk was really nice, and the design of storage stairs to access the bunk was cool.(but the door was little bit narrow to put the luggage in.) finishing was perfect even the bunk beds and the walls were made of woods. but for that reason I could hear some stranger’s snoring in the next room because the bunks and the walls are made of woods. but still you can feel its

much quieter compared to other guesthouse. and they offer earplug. but they didn't even needed. also they had interesting exhibition in their dormitory room. they made a best use of their hall and reading space as a gallery even there's not that spacious.  the only thing that i felt uncomfortable was that they had no private bathroom in double room. but it was not a problem because each of the shared bathroom and toilet was designed like separated room. and if you are taller than 5'7", you'd better not book dormitory but twin room. but double room is always fully booked so i had to book last 3 days to dormitory.  + staffs were very cool(especially Kayo was very cute and nice) Yasunori and Makoto was very handsome, kind of representing northeast asia as well.

It was a great stay in "Guest House Denchi", I definitely want to book again. :D Walking distance from Kaminarimon/Nakamise Dori/Sensoji Temple.  The place is quite and easy to locate. Thank you Guest House Denchi :D

Guest house Denchi is new, very clean (including the toilets and shower which are spotless) and staff extremely helpful. Surroundings are also good with many options for dining and nearby some nice temples. We just spent the night, but if coming back to Tokyo on a budget, will definitely stay there again.

Kamar yang bagus dan bersih dan sudah lengkap dengan dapur dan semua piring peralatan masak sudah lengkap dan ad kompor gas ,oven,kulkas kamar dilengkapi ac memang si  kamar mandi bersama tapi kamar mandi nya bersih banget dan letak lokasi cukup strategis dan dekat dengan stasiun kamata dan hanya 25 menit dari bandara haneda di tokyo sangat rekomended
深夜抵達羽田機場，還好來得及搭上凌晨2:15的最後一班夜間巴士，大約20分鐘就到蒲田站，然後走路五分鐘左右就可抵達民宿。這是一家自己check in的民宿，我選擇共用衛浴的單人房，乾淨舒適！就像自己的家。

I arrived late night at Haneda international airport. The location  near to Kamata station. The room clean and comfy. The bath room and toilet share but clean well maintain. You can use the pantry for quick breakfast.

This hotel very clean and properly arranged. The room I have stayed comes with 2 single bed. It was value for the money. We did used the kitchen for cooking.   The bathroom also very neat and clean. It was safe to stay here.

Zeer proper en comfortabel hostel  Ruime kamers met airco en goede bedden.  Dicht bij het station en vele winkels.  30 min met de trein tot het centrum van Tokyo Wel rekening houden extra kost voor trein, bij ons ongeveer 1000 yen per dag per persoon
「島嶼会館」は羽田空港からモノレール浜松町で降りて直ぐに有ります。また、伊豆諸島、小笠原諸島を往復する客船の港「竹芝」からも徒歩で直ぐなので、良く利用させてもらっています。
伊豆諸島や小笠原諸島への定期船が発着する竹芝桟橋に近いホテルです。船が欠航したりした時に、島の人たちが宿泊できるよう、建てられたそうですが、一般の人も利用できます。ウナギの寝床のようなレイアウトで、奥に長くなっています。
上京の際にいつも利用しています。 展望風呂は朝も利用出来る為、大変嬉しいです。 ただ夜は11時までなのでもう少し遅くまで利用出来ると 有り難いです。

島しょに住んでいて、今回通院の為に利用しました。 船便は島に住んでいる人の事は後回しの時間設定の為、安く宿泊の出来るこちらはとてもありがたいです。 ただお手頃の値段の為か予約が取りづらいです。 前日や当日まであきらめずに問い合わせると取れることもあります。 また、フロントスタッフのレベルの低さが少し気になります。 部屋の鍵を間違える、領収書の宛名を間違えるなど、普通考えられない間違えをします。 ご利用の際は、心を広く持ってお泊り下さい。

東京滞在中にはよく利用するホテルです。まず、JR浜松町駅と地下鉄大江戸線・浅草線の大門駅から近く、交通の便がいいのがポイントです。客室は全室禁煙で、各階の廊下に喫煙室が設置されています。また、全室が芝離宮に面していて解放感があり日本庭園の借景が都会にいながらも癒しとなっています。部屋にバス・トイレがありますが、6階には大浴場があり、同階にコインランドリーも設置されていて、便利です。ルームキーはカード式で、いちいちフロントに鍵を預ける必要もありません。1階には外部の人も利用できるレストランがあり、夕食時は島の食材を使った料理が提供されています。

This is super good value!  I had a bed in a kind of small dormitory for men.  There is another one for women.  Toilets and showers are for women on the second floor and for me on the first floor of this guest house.  It was all very clean.  The area is nice (convenient store nearby, restaurants, 5 minutes away from the subway, just 3 subway stops from Haneda International Terminal).  The only drawback was that it was a bit noisy when people shifted into their beds.

Stayed here for 2nights for the start of my 9days long Japan holiday. It's ok for a short stay as the room we had (a double room) is relatively small.   Location is very close to a subway as well as a few eating places and family marts.  Comfortable stay, they also have a nespresso machine which I felt was a plus point.

We booked a premium room with breakfast. The room was of good size, enough space for 2 big suitcases and 1 cabin suitcase. Room is nicely decorated. The shower is great, we had shower with great water pressure and a bathtub. The room was a bit noisy as we could hear something which sounded like the air conditioning coming above our room. It didn't prevent us from sleeping though. No window in the room, which can be a little weird and doesn't help with jetlag. The staff is friendly and ready to help. The breakfast was great. We especially loved the potato salad and the vegetables in sesame sauce. Loved the bacon as well. The breakfast selection isn't huge but it's enough and of good quality. The location is very good. 1 min walk from Akasaka station, and 5 min walk from Tameike
Sanno. Overall, great boutique hotel, recommended.

Disappointed with the checkin time of 3pm. Following a 12 hour flight we arrived shattered. Our room was ready and we asked to checkin to our room at 2.30pm. We were told we could but it would cost us £15 for checkin 30 mins earlier. Totally a massive money making scam. In an already really expensive city.I have travelled all over the world and have never had this before.

The location of this hotel is incredible as it is close to food and the train station. The beds are comfy the rooms are clean and stylish, the breakfast is also great. Would highly recommend !!! As a first time visitor to japan this hotel has made my stay great and welcoming !

The owner of the place is wonderful - he greeted us when we checked in and even wiped our suitcase wheels for us to keep everything spotlessly clean. The facilities are great for Japan - there is even a kitchen and a small common area where my sister and I could eat our meals. Laundry on site was a huge bonus and there are adequate numbers of showers and toilets available.   The bed was not the most comfortable as the mattress for our tatami was so thin it was nearly nonexistent. Hard to sleep on the side as your hipbones hurt too much. Noise was an issue since sinks are out in the hallways and so are the hairdryers. People decide to brush their teeth loudly at 4 in the morning - you'll be up listening to them do it.   Overall a decent budget stay but definitely better choices

This accommodation is easy to find and it's good situated between train & bus stations as well as supermarkets and restaurants. Nice decoration, everything is bright and very clean. Everytime I arrived the owner cleaned the wheels of my luggage. The owner was kind and very helpful, but strict on the other hand.  The kitchen is normally equipped, sufficient for easy supply. The wi-fi was ok, not very fast and not very stable. My room was very small, but perfectly adequate for sleeping. The futon was thin, but ok. The floor looks like tatami, but it was not. A special feature is the soundproof music room, which can be used 24/7.  Not so good: From 10 p.m. there has to be absolute silence in the lounge. OK, these are the house rules and understandable. But there is no way to relax

and enjoy the evening after a long day with friends or other guests. This silence is enforced very strictly and penetrantly. The alternative would be to sit in the evening (with a small group) in the music room. But this is unfair to the musicians. So if you want to be communicative, this accommodation not suitable for you.

If you are looking for a very affordable place to stay in Tokyo, this is a good hotel to stay. Staff are very accommodating. Be prepared to use shared bathrooms though. And make sure you respect all guests as the rooms are very near to each other

This is a small hotel in the very center of Tokyo with good price. It is clean and modern. Price is affordable. Room was not big but normal for Japan. Nice bathroom. Address may not be Roppongi but it is in Roppongi. There are many nice restaurants and shops around.

Found this hotel in Azabu while living close by and had the chance recently to stay there.   Check in and reservation were easy and fast, the rooms were quite spacious for Tokyo, the bathroom and bath itself were both very nice and the bed was comfortable.  We ordered room service many times and they were always prompt.   Price was very reasonable at 20,000 JPY.   I definitely recommend it for couples.   Also the neighborhood has great restaurants, bars and cafes.

restaurants.name: Ganso Tonkotsu Kurume Ramen Fukuya Azabu Juban
Le Bar a Vin 52 Azabu Juban

reviews: We're a family of 4 and stayed at the quadruple room for 4 nights. We chose Smi:re Stay Oshiage mainly for how it looks and where it's located.   Pros: Great location, modern design, comfy beds, kitchenette, and in-room washing machine  Cons: No daily housekeeping, no wardrobes, tight hallway, could have used a full-sized mirror  Bottomline: Despite minor drawbacks, Smi:re Stay Oshiage is an excellent choice for a small family like ours. We definitely recommend this for staying in Tokyo.  Here's a more detailed review of Smi:re Stay:  1. Design We loved the minimalist design with concrete, wood, and glass. It kinda felt like sleeping in a Muji store (in a good way)!    2. Size & Layout It's not in any way tiny, but since the layout of the room is narrow, it's also not the most

spacious, especially since we had several luggage (however, there is enough space in corners and under the beds to stow them).   Two bedrooms are connected by a tight hallway, where the separate toilet and bathroom are located. The bigger room contains the master bed, dining area, and kitchenette, so it can be a bit cramped. The smaller bedroom, however, is just perfect for our 2 kids.   Technically, there's no work desk but the dining table can serve that purpose.  3. Comfort & Cleanliness The mattresses are very comfy, cozy, and soft, so we certainly slept well. The hotel also provided pajamas and disposable slippers so plus points for that.   The two rooms have air-conditioners to keep them cool (or warm, in our case, since we were here in December). The toilet (Japanese toilets with their built-in bidets are the best) and shower are very clean.   Water temperature is adjustable and water pressure is strong. Lots of towels and toiletries for everyone. Our only complaint is that there's only one mirror, which is placed too high for little kids. A full- or even half-sized mirror in the corridor perhaps would have been nice.  4. Service There is no lobby or front desk. The cafe/bar in the building serves that purpose. But Kenzo, who was on duty, was very friendly and helpful.   As for housekeeping, they throw the trash and replace the towels every other day and make the bed every 4 days. We're not too happy with that, but it's no deal breaker either.  5. Amenities As this is a serviced apartment, the room is equipped with a kitchenette with a stove, microwave oven, kettle, and fridge. There are plenty of glasses, mugs, plates, and utensils. Breakfast isn't included, so we just bought sandwiches from the nearby Family Mart or 7-Eleven.   There are plenty of hangers but no wardrobe cabinets, just a couple of wooden racks to hang our jackets. We liked that there's a washing machine in the room with free laundry soap for a single wash. The funny thing though is we had to dry up our clothes on a steel bar on top of the TV!     Speaking of the TV, only local channels are available. But the free and fast Wi-Fi made up for it.  6. Location & Security The location is excellent as Oshiage/Skytree is a great base to explore Tokyo. We can even see the famous Tokyo Skytree from our room! The hotel is a 5-min. walk from Skytree/Solamachi and a 1-min. walk from the B1 exit of the Oshiage/Skytree Station.   It's also in a quiet and safe side street of the neighborhood, so we we had a restful sleep during our stay.   7. Check-in & Check-out The check-in was super fast, with Kenzo double-checking our booking details and explaining the house rules for a few minutes. We were greeted by Pepper the robot at the elevator area (she's a delight, though she needs more information loaded in her system to be truly useful).  Check-out was just a matter of posting a check-out card at the reception.   8. Family Friendly The hotel is great for families. Our kids have a separate room (a bed each). Access to the station is a short walk for them. There's strong Wi-Fi if they just want to chill. And they loved interacting with Pepper the robot.

We spent 8 nights in this neat and tidy hotel for our family trip this Summer!  The 4 ppls room was good enough for our family (2 adults + 2 teenagers)!  The location of the hotel is so convenient (juz a few minutes walk from the Skytree Station)!  Love it & highly recommended!

Great hotel, very helpful staff. It is very close to Oshiage station which easily takes you to all the interesting Tokyo spots via metro and JR trains. It is also 10 minutes walk to Tokyo Solamachi for shopping.

The room was very spacious, staff were very friendly and helpful.  Hotel itself was located really convenient place which surrounded so many convenience store and good restaurant. Also it was just 3mins to Oshiage station and could even access Tokyo Sky Tree by foot in 5mins.  We would love to come back and stay here again!

My family and I stayed at SM:IRE Oshiage for two weeks. It's in a centrally located quiet neighborhood right by Skytree. Getting in we took the SkyAccess from Narita... You come out of the train station a block from the hotel. Check in was with Haruki. Showed us to the family room (5 ppl in my group). Rooms are not huge but super efficient and of you're coming to Tokyo and spending most of your time in your room... You're not doing travel the right way. Things to do and places to see are Skytree, Asakusa and Sumo district... There's a cool little Thai restaurant around the corner with a katsu place and a coffee shop right next to that. The hotel is quiet with the exception of the divider door between rooms... We had a fairly loud Indian lady Skype chatting in front of the

frickin door at 2 am... Knock on the door... People will usually get the point.... But that was our only "not ideal"moment of our stay. Check out was easy...  Before I forget...Wifi works well in main living area, less so in bathrooms.

restaurants.name: Ganso Tonkotsu Kurume Ramen Fukuya Azabu Juban
Tavern Ajito Azabu Juuban Main Shop

reviews: Great new hotel in Tokyo, which had everything I needed for a few days stay. Don't usually write these but decided to put a note on here as not only was everything spotless but nothing was too much for the hotel staff when there. Will definitely be coming again!
鶯谷駅と入谷駅から徒歩圏内で、とてもアクセスが良く大変便利なホテルでした！ また、お部屋の内装もとても綺麗で清潔感があり、大満足です。
良い宿泊でした。駅近で、お部屋もきれいでした。お風呂はシャワーのみですが、大きめのシャワールームでした。トイレはウォッシュレットでした。コスパ良かった。また伺いたいです。

great location. nice staff. The Barn Tokyo is in the entertainment district and near a metro station. Free wifi that is strong and consistent. The rooms were small which seems to be a normal in Tokyo. The rooms were clean. Got free upgrade so not sure if the normal room size.

Located very close to a number of stations, with surrounding eateries and convenience stores! The directions given to use when arriving from Narita were perfect, and we found the property with ease. We were extremely happy with the location and options available to us.   The apartment itself was very cute and clean, and perfect for what we needed! We loved the traditional feel to it, and it did not feel sterile at all. Also the washing machine is a big plus!  As others have mentioned in their reviews, Soshi is the perfect host. Our kids were excited to see him in the morning on our way out to do some sightseeing, and were eager to catch up with him on our return! Fun-loving dude. I would like to mention a gorgeous little green park for kids behind the property in the streets

sloping upwards.   We recommend this place 100% for families. Very close walk to Tokyo Dome City, which is a hub of restaurants, shops (Uniqlo), bakeries, and theme park! Also Korakuen Gardens is right there. also a short walk/one stop away from the lovely little area of Kagurazaka.   Soshi recommended breakfast at Cafe Kohian around the corner - traditional coffee house! The owner has a personalized stamp at the entrance for you to mark your travels in your journal or notebook, which the kids loved - the perfect souvenir!  Hopefully we won't have to wait to long to return - THANKS SOSHI!  The Sgro-D'Aprano Family.

Staying in Goen Inn is just like staying in an apartment complete with the kitchen, laundry machine and en-suite bathroom. The location is closed to at least 2 train stations, 2 Lawsons, several restaurants and in a walking distance to Korakuen park.   The host, Soshi, is a very helpful one. He helped us with our luggage even when it's already late night since the apartment doesn't have an elevator. So, it's not an issue. He helped us both when we arrived and departed. Thank you!

Goen is perfect for us.   we booked a family room with five Puton, three singal and a double. big enough for four persons, the facility in room are complete. The living room also can be a bed room, very japanese style. Bathroom and the toilet is a little small but clean and very easy to use. Kitchen has everything if you want to cook. Durting our travel, it's really like we are living there, very cozy and comfort. the favorite part is the location. not at the middle of the city but also not far from the main commercial area, transport are very very convenient, near three subway stations, easily get those famous area , la squra shooping mall and tokyo Dom by walking distance, a lot of restaurant with different style around, convenient store, book store and drug store, Even the

supermarket also have three choices and one of them is 24hour 7 days a week, lovely!!......so great location. Soshi is a fantastic host, very nice helpful and speak english so well. Before we arrival, we communicate by email and help me a lot about planning our travel. During our stay, he also helps us a lot. He's the kind of perfact host, take care about all the details but also make you feel very comfortable as stay at yourself's home. PLUS he is very handsome~~~~ i think it's a home far from home, next time, i'd love to choice here.again.

This dormitory style accommodation is very clean and cheap place to stay while in Tokyo. Though it’s a 2 double decker bed that can sleep 4 people in the room, making it cramp in the room, it is still better then some of the hostel accommodations in the area.
