The accommodation also provides breakfast with an option of Western and Japanese style breakfast, which helps save the trouble of going out to look for breakfast.   The staff at the hostel is also very friendly and helpful during the past few days that I was there with my family.

A fabulous location to start our Japan holiday and the staff were amazing. Just be aware that the beds are almost traditional Japanese mats... Breakfast is an option of English or Japanese and good quantities.

It takes a 5 minute walk from here to Senso-ji, which it's really suitable if you want to visit the temple at night. The rooms are quite tiny, but clean and they have all of the necessary facilities. The staff is super friendly and helpful! The breakfast is also included in the price and it's really good.

It's cheap, it's near metro station, it's clean, it's near Sensoji. Although a dormitory style accomodation,  and room can feel a bit cramp with two double decker sleeping 4 person in one room, it's still better than a lot of hostel. By the way, a bonus is you can see Tokyo Skytree  from your room window.

We, a family of 4 with 2 kids, had the beautiful queen suite apartment. There were two bedrooms and a spacious living room with a fully equipped kitchen area. Everything was in a very good condition and very clean. Furthermore it was very quiet, we heard nothing from the neighbors.  We liked the neighborhood a lot. It was quiet and we felt very safe. Each time we came back we enjoyed the pleasant contrast to the extremely busy downtown areas. A convenience store is nearby and there are many wonderful small restaurants. There are also many small stores to explore, and the Asakusa temple area is just 5 minutes away. The Asakusa station is 10 - 15 minutes away on foot, depending on luggage. This walk can be a bit tiring but is doable. In between the temple and the station is a

large shopping area, which should not be missed. The staff was very friendly and helpful and we could store our luggage for a few hours before and after our stay. In summary, it was a perfect stay and if we come ever back to Tokyo we will for sure stay here again.

I enjoyed staying in the Asakusa area, as I had a one year old on the trip with us. Our 17 year of nephew would much rathered be in the action packed areas. But a 10-15 walk to train station, made getting to those areas no problems. Nice being near the river. We did a fantastic cooking class 10 min walk away wiht Tokyo Kitchen which was great. Room was ok, not to big but ok for Tokyo standards I think. Staff were helpful when we needed them. Room could have come with more information on aircon etc, and area, restaurants etc but we found enough.

We stayed in a two bedroom apartment. It was comfortable for five of us .we arrived quite early and they allowed us to check in . Upon checking out we deposited our luggages with them for 1000yen which was reasonable for 5 luggages.   Location wise , it’s about 15mins walk from Asakusa Station , roads mostly flat . If you don’t mind the location this is a good choice .

コロナの影響でビジネスステイさせて頂きました。  早速チェックイン時に素敵なサプライズ！ 入浴剤、チョコレート、バスグッズ、珈琲紅茶パック等どれでも3点までプレゼント🎁 ※お部屋にはお茶パックが付いてます  疲れが取れる入浴剤と小腹用のチョコが頂けるのは凄くテンションが上がりました✨  本棚には海外からのゲスト向けのガイドブックもあり、大浴場のフロアーには電子レンジ、洗濯機が完備。 長期滞在でも手洗いでなくて洗濯できるのが凄く嬉しいサービス。  また、お風呂上がりにアイスキャンディーも無料で用意してるで、海外からのお客様が特に喜ばれそう✨ とても粋なサービスだと感じました。  また、テラスもあり暖かい日にはゆっくり読書や、 レストランのフリードリンクを持って寛ぐのもいいかもしれません^_^  12:00〜17:00は珈琲、紅茶、ココアなどドリンクフリーだそうで、とても寛大なサービスに驚きです。  朝食は普段はバイキング形式ですが、コロナの影響でワンプレート式になってました。 それでも十分な量。食材にこだわっており、特に味噌汁は社長の出身地佐渡の味噌をわざわざ調達しているそう(o^^o)  とても美味しくて、毎朝食べ過ぎて夜まで満腹でした(о´∀`о)  まさにおもてなしの詰まったホテルです。  各部屋に冷蔵庫、湯沸かしポット、フットマッサージ機もあり、至れり尽くせり✨  疲れた心と体をリフレッシュさせてくれます(*´ω`*)

銀座駅からは10分少々歩きました。ホテルの周りはちょっと寂しい感じ。まあ静かではあります。 畳のお部屋をチョイスしたので、はだしで歩きまわれるのは嬉しいです。ビジネスにはちょっと不向きな低めのテーブルですが、ソファーではなく畳の上に座ると良い感じの高さになりました。 お部屋にはペットボトルのお水が備え付けられていました。扉が透明で中身が見える冷蔵庫は、置き忘れ防止にも便利ですね、でもスイッチを入れないと冷えませんので注意。 最上階の露天風呂（とランドリーの利用状況）はお部屋のモニターで混み具合が表示されます。これとっても便利ですよね。お風呂上りはアイスキャンディーのサービスまであって、春・秋ならテラスで湯上りに食べるのもいいかな。
近隣に住んでいますが、来客の都合があり家族で旅行気分で利用させていただきました。２４時間滞在を選んだため、とてものんびり過ごすことができました。お風呂も数回利用し、気軽に旅気分のストレス発散ができました。清潔でスタッフの皆さんのサービスもよく、駅からも便もいいです。テラスの景色もよく、本当にいいステイができました。また利用させていただきます。友人たちにも紹介したいと思います。

コロナの影響でビジネスステイさせて頂きました。  早速チェックイン時に素敵なサプライズ！ 入浴剤、チョコレート、バスグッズ、珈琲紅茶パック等どれでも3点までプレゼント🎁 ※お部屋にはお茶パックが付いてます  疲れが取れる入浴剤と小腹用のチョコが頂けるのは凄くテンションが上がりました✨  本棚には海外からのゲスト向けのガイドブックもあり、大浴場のフロアーには電子レンジ、洗濯機が完備。 長期滞在でも手洗いでなくて洗濯できるのが凄く嬉しいサービス。  また、お風呂上がりにアイスキャンディーも無料で用意してるで、海外からのお客様が特に喜ばれそう✨ とても粋なサービスだと感じました。  また、テラスもあり暖かい日にはゆっくり読書や、 レストランのフリードリンクを持って寛ぐのもいいかもしれません^_^  12:00〜17:00は珈琲、紅茶、ココアなどドリンクフリーだそうで、とても寛大なサービスに驚きです。  朝食は普段はバイキング形式ですが、コロナの影響でワンプレート式になってました。 それでも十分な量。食材にこだわっており、特に味噌汁は社長の出身地佐渡の味噌をわざわざ調達しているそう(o^^o)  とても美味しくて、毎朝食べ過ぎて夜まで満腹でした(о´∀`о)  まさにおもてなしの詰まったホテルです。  各部屋に冷蔵庫、湯沸かしポット、フットマッサージ機もあり、至れり尽くせり✨  疲れた心と体をリフレッシュさせてくれますね(*´ω`*)

宝町駅から徒歩数分。 大きい道路から一本裏手にあるため、 静かな環境です。 ビジネスホテルとしては、一部屋の間取りは 広めで、畳のため、部屋でゆっくり寛げる のが、嬉しかったです。  最上階には、大浴場もあり、ゆったりできました。部屋のバスタブも大きめサイズです。  朝食は時節柄、ビュッフェスタイルではありません でしたが、プレートで提供された朝食は 味、量共に満足です。  大手チェーンにありがちな、 効率性を求めたギチギチの間取りと 異なり、穴場だと思います。  機会があれば、また利用したいですね。

The individual pods are a good size and include a small table and light. The toilet and shower facilities are all new and kept clean. Staff were really friendly. Unfortunately, the showers are downstairs and you have to walk outside to get back to them, not great in the winter. The rooms do not have much room to keep your bags on the floor or pick out clothes.

We really enjoyed our stay at Guest House Wagokoro. It's clean, cute, and the staff are so nice! Rooms are small but you have your own bathroom and closet. The futons were really comfortable. It's also in a great location and the staff provide recommendations for food options nearby. Highly recommend this place!

Super clean, super quiet, super friendly. Less than 10 min walk from JR Station ( Nippori Station ). We got a Japanese style room and slept on the floor which was a nice experience. This hotel is not located on a tourist area. Close to a super market and bakery and many restaurants at affordable prices.

A great place to stay, we cannot add any minus here. The place is clean, the personal is friendly, great rooms, and the neighborhood is very quite. The hotel is in a walking distance from the  Nippori station l, which is great if you are using a JR pass!

Really friendly host. Big room and good location. Easy access to jr-line. The room was very clean and leaving luggage for the day wasn't any problem. The rooms are really quiet. Good price/quality. Recommended!

While they style themselves as “hostel“ and there are indeed dormitory rooms available, Wagokoro is actually a fully featured hotel. Everything you expect from a hotel is there and much more – 24 hour reception, ensuite bathroom and even common kitchen/dining room.   The hotel is nice a mix of traditional Japanese ryokan and modern hotel. We especially liked that you have to remove footwear and use provided slippers when you enter the lobby.  The staff is very friendly and helpful. Though official check-in time is 3p.m. our room was ready as early as 12:30 p.m. – very welcoming after long flight and jetlag. Even if some of the hotel staff don’t speak English well we encountered absolutely no language barrier. Japanese hospitality is what you really get here.  Our room for 3

(western style) was a bit small but that’s expected from Japanese hotels. Bathroom was also very small but it even contained a bathtub! Spotlessly clean. Wi-Fi connection was very fast and stable. Some may find beds and pillows hard but again, that’s Japanese way.  Wagokoro is situated in a quiet neighborhood, there are all usual 24/7 conbini just around the corner and a lot of restaurants near train station. Nippori station is just 5 minutes walk (or 410Y taxi ride if it’s raining or you need to haul heavy luggage). The station is directly connected to Narita airport – Skyliner is faster and sometimes cheaper than NEX train. Yanaka cemetery and Arakawa tram are in short walking distance.  I must say that Wagokoro provided best value for money from all hotels we used during our two weeks trip in Japan.

If you know the ordinal rate of a stay in Tokyo, its quite reasonable in that area of Tokyo. The size of room is same as famous biz hotel, but compact kitchen is additional item compared with the hotel room of those. Acess from railway is not good, but lately the taxi first ride within 1.5km was changed to JPY410, which helped to choose this hotel. Free wifi is available and speed is good. Amenity is acceptable level. It is better than i.e. hotel in HK sizewise and pricewise.

I went to visit my husband and this hotel was the perfect place. It was in a quieter part of town but still had food stores and convenient stores within a couple minute walk. Also most train stations were only a 15 minute walk from us, or a $7 taxi ride, or a $3 bus ride. Everything was close by like Shibyua square and the big crossing. As well as the Skytree and Tower. All in all this was the perfect hotel for our needs and I highly recommend it.

On arriving after our 24hour journey with a awful cold and hurrendous jet lag that I had never felt before it was so nice to be welcomed by friendly staff at reception . Although they didn't speak much English and we couldn't speak any Japanese other than hello we were able to communicate and understand each other . We were on the 4th floor which didn't bother us but they were very apologetic about no lift . Our room was fine for us as we were out every day all day and evening seeing  everything we could in Japan . We had 2 small double beds in our room but as we wanted to sleep together there wasn't much room to star fish the bed :-) without my boyfriend getting squished . The bathroom is very tiny and when sitting on the loo the door was pretty much in your face and when they

say bath it isn't your usual western bath it's very small and deep but it had everything you needed as well as a little hob and sink also a microwave . Table and chairs tv free wifi although no sofa to relax when we got back from walking miles but we weren't bothered . 10min walk to ebisu station and very easy to use the jr trains and only one stop away from Shibuya . Great location to all the marjor sites ,7/11 and familymart couple mins away cafe and restaurants aswell .

I was there 3 weeks with a friend and I felt like at home: very quiet, very comfortable room and beds, wash and dry machine. Ebisu station is just straight on when you go out from the hotel, it takes 10 mins walkinh. There is a bus also in the same street to go to Shibuya directly. I would come back next time for sure.

Room was small, but had everything we needed (bathtub, kitchen equipment, tiny fridge). There was a laundry machine available. Staff was friendly but spoke only a little English. The neighbourhood is quite nice, and there are not a lot of tourists here. A short walking distance from Ebisu station.

飯店離駒込車站很近，附近也有超商還有藥局(可以免稅)，所以還滿便利的。飯店貌似是針對外國觀光客而開，所以辦理入房的機器支援多國語言，不會講英日文也很方便。房間大小適中，住起來很舒適，惟建議不要在接近check out的時候才離開，因為電梯很難等。  The hotel is very close to Komagome station, and there are convenience stores and pharmacies around, very convenient. The room is large, and the bathroom is bigger than regular size in Tokyo. In all, high C/P. There are lots of foreign tourists stay in this hotel, I consider the hotel as foreigner-friendly :) While, The building is high, but in order to save space, there is only one lift, so it might be rough to wait for the lift to come, especially in check-in check-out peak time.

Just back from two weeks in Tokyo - husband and I stayed at the Easton Hotel. Very good value for money, quiet room on 8th floor, reasonable size, excellent standard of cleanliness, good size fridge in room, clean towels and sheets every day.  Staff spoke little English but were very friendly and helpful.  Great location, 2 minutes walk from Nakano-sakuae subway and 15 minutes walk from Shinjuko main station.  Lots of little supermarkets, (7-11 stores have ATMs that take UK bank cards), coffee shops, restaurants nearby. Loved Tokyo - loads to see and do, public transport very efficient and cheap compared to UK standards.  Japanese people so efficient and helpful, and nobody talks on their cellphone on the train - bliss!!

I just got back from Tokyo and stayed at the Easton Hotel for ten days.  It was a great experience.  It's a small (about 90 rooms) hotel, less than a block from the subway and in a very nice and safe area.  The staff was very nice and accommodating and the bed was very comfortable.  The room was, of course, small, but plenty of room for one person (I had a single room).  There are a number of very good restaurants all around the area, from Korean BBQ you cook on a grill to a great yakatori place and the best bakery ever (Vie de France, strangely enough) just a block away, next to the subway.  We had delicious pasteries--both sweet and savory--from there every morning.  There is also a grocery store just across the street.  I highly recommend the Easton Hotel.
excellent value, great location right at nakano-sakue subway, 20" walk to shinjaku

restaurants.name: Kita No Aji Kiko to Jizake Hokkaido Nakano Sakaue
Bar de Espana El Cero Uno
Sakana No Hirataya Nakano Sakaue Ekimae

reviews: This hotel is good i will be coming back soon as possible for new fun trip. My friend told me this place is good for chilling and the service is not bad at all. So i will be giving this hotel/place a high review...

Everything was good except the room door somehow made me a bit upset because the bottom was not blocked.   The room and bathroom was clean and tidy.  The location is facilitating with lots of restaurants around.

The room was pretty small but really comfy and for the price is a real dealbreaker, the stairs are really steep and not easy to climb with big travel cases but the hassle is worth it at the end!, Recommended for travellers who are looking for a quick and easy stay!

The room is good for a short stay (1-2 days). The room is clean, a small selection (about one shelf) of manga is available in English and Japanese. Drinks (essentially tea and coffee) are given as free. Some gaming console are also available in the common room. A shower space is also available. The shower space and toilet was clean during my stay However due to the presence of a large space under the door (large enough for someone to crawl under the door), it doesn't really feel safe especially if you compare it to a standard manga café. However it does have the benefit of providing a bed. The hostel was located not too far from the Takadanobaba JR station which is a plus.  As a conclusion, I would recommend this place for a short stay and more to a male demographic than a
female one (due to the lack of safety and privacy)

This hostel was the most beautiful in Tokyo. By the way, I stayed at 4 hostels. The bad points are that the staff is waiting on the other floor at night. That's it. This is the only place in Japan where you can enjoy Japanese anime culture.

restaurants.name: Shabu Shabu All-You-Can-Eat Yakiniku Merino Shinjuku
Nikubaru Tabehodai & Biahoru Gabutto Hausu Takadanobaba
鳥貴族 高田馬場さかえ通り店

hotel_name: Mitsui Garden Hotel Toyosu Bayside Cross
reviews: I was amazed with the great view of Tokyo Bay area, especially Rainbow Bridge. You can enjoy the sights of Tokyo Metropolitan of 13 millions from Superior View Bath King rooms or Superior View Bath Twin rooms.  The communal bath on the top floor is simple but you can see the sky above you, too.  The former reviewer asking

The hotel is new, very near station, the staff at front desk was kind. The room is quite small but great view to the bay. Will try Roomservice next time (if they have any)  The breakfast was good, the restaurant has very nice view too.  They have onsen area for public bath but i prefer my own bathroom since corona time. Maybe see you next time.

Although it is a newly opened hotel, there are actually many problems.    First of all, when checking in, you will find that all the front desks are interns. When I ask them some questions, they always need to turn their heads and get into the small room behind to ask regular employees.  I think that as a mature Mitsui with dozens of chain hotels, the intern should not be left alone at the front desk.    Secondly, neither the interns at the front desk nor the regular employees hiding behind can communicate in basic English, which surprised me a lot.  Shouldn't this aspect be strengthened at the time when the Olympics are coming?  The most unacceptable thing is that they asked me to pay an extra 15,000 yen (my reservation is about 12,000 yen) when I asked that I want to see the

Rainbow Bridge in my room. I said I didn’t want to spend more than what I originally paid for my reservation to upgrade my room. They just couldn’t care less and kept telling me to pay for the upgrade.  I told the person at the front desk that I just want to see the Rainbow Bridge, and I also said that this is the first time I came to this hotel, but the front desk said "so what?!" Such a reply made me very angry.  In this way of responding to customers, he lacks the basic qualities of front desk staff.  I have stayed in many Mitsui hotels before, but this experience makes me very hesitant to make reservations for Mitsui hotels in the future.  I will try to discuss this with their general manager tomorrow when I check out, but I don’t expect they would realize their problems.  Don’t be fooled by their design or look. If a hotel have no idea about hospitality, they will never be a good hotel. Any hotel under Marriott group is better than this Mitsui garden hotel Toyosu.

restaurants.name: Starbucks Coffee Urban Dock LaLaport Toyosu 3 B1F
Kentucky Fried Chicken Urban Doc Lalaport Toyosu
Starbucks Coffee Lalaport Toyosu Seaside Deck
Wired Kitchen Urban Dock Lalaport Toyosu
Kope Lani Urban Dock Lala Port Toyosu

reviews: Location is perfect 2 Mins walk to the station. The hostel is clean from the common areas to the bathroom and sleeping areas. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They speak english which helps a lot.

There is a peaceful, friendly atmosphere here and everyone is courteous since it is one large hostel room with 20+ beds.  The floors, bathrooms, showers, etc. are meticulously cleaned every day.  Walk out the front door and the subway station is right there; a convenience store is just down the block.

Good location (very close to the subway station), from there is not too far to main hubs such as shinjuku/shibuya. Very clean bathrooms/toilets (they have a toilet with special features, for the people that would like to try those famous Japanese toilets). Dorms are good, there is a curtain for privacy and a personal light and socket. Not much room to store your stuff, but sufficient. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly, which makes the stay even better. Only thing missing is a common room (apart from the kitchen) to a hang out, but could be that it's normal for hostels in Japan (this is the first hostel I stayed at in Japan).

I recommend this place. Very nice, extremely friendly and English-speaking staff. Good location - just 2 minutes walk from metro station. Very clean and neat place. Places to sleep are very compact and in Japanese style.

Stayed in this hostel for a few nights back in May with a friend as part of our trip round Japan, absolutely brilliant in every way, very clean, quiet, and staff could not have been more helpful and kind, even taking my friend and I to the train station the morning we left. We will definitely be back!

It's a beautiful place in the sense of Japanese aesthetics on both interior and exterior. In the room, the floor covered in tatami mats so I felt easy and comfort. There is a rooftop balcony where anyone can go up. I could see the night view of Sky Tree just in front of it. The most amazing point was that I could soak in a bath. Feel the warmth of the natural wooden interiors and very good smell of it.  It was the best way to heal the long tired of journey.  Overall, perfect Ryokan is full filled with Japaneseness and heartwarming. Even a little far from the station, I would stay here again.  外観も内装も日本らしさが味わえる旅館。畳じきの部屋はコンパクトながらとても居心地がよく、落ち着くことができた。ビルの屋上にはバルコニーがあり、誰でも上がることができる。そこからスカイツリーのネオンが正面に見えた。とても気分が高揚した。
そしてこの旅館の最も素敵なところはお風呂だ。バスタブに天然の檜を使っていて、お風呂場全体に檜のいい香りが充満していて体が元気になった。長旅の疲れを癒やすにはやはり日本式のお風呂が一番いい。総じてこの旅館には日本らしさとやさしさがあふれていると思う。それが駅から少し離れていても、ここに行きたくなる理由だ。

The hostel can be reached either from minowa or asakusa station. From those two stations just follow google maps to reach the hostel. Its roughly 15 mins walking to sensoji temple.  We stay in room 302 with three futons. Its just enough size for three of us. Clean bedding eventhough the pillow is too soft. The towel is bit smelly. The room has private toilet . We have to shower in first floor in the communal bath with little onsen just next to it. Its clean and good onsen. Overall its a good stay but its too far from stations.

hotel_name: The Gate Hotel Tokyo by Hulic
amenities: Fitness Centre with Gym / Workout Room
reviews: The rooms were clean, and very comfortable. The bedroom area may be a bit small, but they have the most spacious bathroom I've ever seen that you won't feel being cramped. They prepared a surprise gift for my friend's birthday. The weather wasn't good that day but the lobby balcony seemed a very good area with a very nice city view of Ginza. The only downside I could say is that they didn't offer us breakfast option like, if they have buffet breakfast for a fee etc. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting central Tokyo.

Not enough words exist to describe how wonderful this hotel is. From the location (perfectly located in quiet/high end Ginza AND literally next to all train lines), to the staff (everyone is extremely friendly and was very easy to communicate), to the hotel finishes (high quality, large rooms).   My husband and I stayed in a king room for 3 nights during our stay in Tokyo. The room was large with more than enough room. In room amenities (Nespresso, bathroom accessories, etc) were great.   Location: we visited a different area around Tokyo each day and had no issues accessing any of the metro or JR lines as there are stations for both lines literally right outside your door. We preferred the Ginza area as it seems to be a quiet, less crowded part of the city to return to at the
end of the day. Basically unlimited shopping and dining options within walking distance.   Highly recommend this hotel.

Remarkable hotel when we visit Japan🥰  The front desk has been incredibly nice and helpful and was very helpful in advice on what to do in the city. Parking is adequate. Hotel was very clean as well as the room. The breakfast was better than what I expected.  Though we didn't spend too much time in the hotel, other than sleeping but it left a great impression on us! Our sheets, towels and surfaces of desk, counter and bathroom were all regularly cleaned during our stay.

We stayed at this ideally situated hotel for two nights at the start of our trip to Japan, and one night at the end. It's in a great location and easy to walk to sights and subway stations. The rooms are comfortable, staff helpful and friendly, breakfast very good with fresh fruit and yogurt available and the Taittinger Bar is a lovely place to have a drink.

Recommended this hotel by my friend who travels often to Tokyo.  In all it’s good for frequent travellers to Tokyo but not for new visitors   Faves :  new modern decor  Lovely Lounge  Classy and chic  Comfy beds   Grumps:  No direct link to hotel from metro or train station  Problematic if you have big luggages Limited Breakfast items  No concierge Service eg booking of taxi or tours Young new staff not familiar with Tokyo

restaurants.name: Shabu Shabu Yakiniku Tabehoudai Merino Ginza
Sake to Koshitsu Izakaya Maguro Daihyo-dan ta Daihyo

reviews: Plat Hostel is a beautiful little hostel with friendly staff in a nice location. The famous Asakusa Shrine is just a short walk away and you can see the Tokyo Tower from the hostel. There are also a lot of restaurants and convenience stores in walking distance. We arrived at Ueno station and walked to the hostel what took us about 15 minutes. We booked a double room which was very small but so cozy! It’s also a smart room what means that you can controll the lights, the air conditioning, the door lock and all the stuff with a hostel offered smartphone.

Its new and very very clean! Bed is comfy. Sitting area could be bigger, but is ok. Everything ist provided like shampoo and stuff. Towel for rent. And you have to pay for luggage storage. Is a very good location near sights and metro. Plenty of restaurant around. Staff is nice.

Japan is a country that just knows how to do efficient comfortable and effective dorms.This hostel is in a great location close to the metro station. The staff are friendly. The kitchen is small but functional. The bathrooms and showers were spotlessly clean and provided free shampoo conditioner and shower gel. The WiFi was fantastic. Each pod was comfortable and had sockets, a light, a hook and a privacy curtain. There is a small safety deposit box for each person.  There is not a lot of floor space outside of the pods but there was enough to get by. I would definitely stay here again.

&AND HOSTEL ASAKUSA STATION is located less than a 5 minute walk to the Asakusa Tsubuka Express Line Station (Tokyo Metro Tawaramachi Ginza Line station is about 5/8 min walk while Asakusa station servicing other lines such as the Ginza Line and Asakusa line is within a 10/15min walk) as well as many cafes, restaurants and shops.  Sensoji Temple as well as Nakamise shopping street, Don Quijote and Hanayashiki are within a 10min walk from the hostel.   The hostel consists of 3 different rooms types, mixed dormitory, female dormitory and double/single private room. Dormitories start at 2,000Yen a night while Private rooms start at 5,000 Yen a night.  I had booked on Expedia and got 50% percent off and was staying in the Female Dormitory for 8 nights.  Floors 3-7 consists of these

rooms along with 3 sinks and 4 toilet rooms (2 female & 2 male) as well as a small terrace. The beds are quite spacious and include a ledge for your coat/jacket, a clothes hanger, USB port, outlet, light and AC unit to keep you cool during the night. They also have a QR code that you can scan and see how busy it is in the shower rooms and the lounge.  The 2nd floor consists of the shower rooms (5), shower/bath combo (1), kitchen area and lounge. All of the shower rooms include Shampoo, conditioner and body wash for free. Guests can use the dishes, sinks, fridge, microwave, kettle, coffee maker as well as the pots and pans provided. As well there is laundry machines available for 500 Yen. Each floor has it's own wifi, making it easier to connect when going from floor to floor.   On the main floor there is the reception, lounge and outdoor terrace. The staff is friendly and helpful, which at check-in was very reassuring considering that I had been waiting for my luggage that I had sent for delivery for 3 days with no delivery to be seen in sight. I let them know the number of the previous hostel and asked if they could let me know if my luggage had been dropped off at the other hostel. To my happy surprise the next day when I had come back from being out, my suitcase was waiting there for me. The staff member had gone to my previous hostel and personally picked up the suitcase and brought it back for me. For me this was above and beyond any customer service I had received at any hostel or hotel. It really made the hostel stand out from any other that I had stayed at previously.   There is no parking for guests so if you have a rental car, you might want to consider choosing a bigger hotel over this one. The offer luggage storage from 8am for 300Yen, as well they sell a assortment of necessities incase it was the one thing you always forget to pack (Toothbrush, towel, razor,etc..).   Check in is 4pm to 11pm, there a 1,000Yen charge for checking in after 11pm.   Reception is from 8am to 11pm.  Overall out of my trips and all the hotels I've stayed in so far in Japan this is my favorite. I would definitely recommend it to anyone coming to Tokyo and want somewhere not only nice to stay but has very friendly and helpful staff.

My partner and I got a private from with a bunk bed. We both had our little pod, which I guess can be weird for some people but we didn’t mind. The rooms are obviously very small but probably standard for Tokyo. Bathrooms and toilets (which were shared with other guests) were always super clean! The hostel is right next to Kuramae station, 7/11, lots of little food places and even McDonalds. Only thing was the mattress...I don’t know if that’s the norm in Japan but we found the mattresses super hard. We did get used to them in the end but could do with slightly softer mattresses (we have firm-medium at home). Would still go back and stay there!

Really nice place. We stayed there for 3 nights. Beds are comfy, baths are clean, staff is really friendly. The view from the roof is amazing, but you can put some more lights there. You have really easy access to public transport. It was a really nice start of our trip.

When we arrived the front desk was a madhouse of people trying to check in and the one guy at the desk trying to handle all of them. He did admirably but we did have to wait a while. There's an automated check in system but no one uses it or perhaps even knows how to use it. The elevator is *very* slow and the only way to get to the rooms. We had booked a four bed dorm room for our party of three. I could never figure out at the front desk if we were supposed to have a stranger in the 4th bed but one never showed up so I think if you book most of that room they'll let you have it privately. Had coin laundry on the 5th floor. The beds are cube style, as a 6'3" (190.5 cm) guy I was worried it might be too small but it was perfect. The cubes got a little stuffy at night but you can

just open your privacy curtain. Each cube had a light, outlet, hangars, and a small lockable box for your small belongings. Your bags go under the bunks in a cubby area on the floor. Each pod of beds is behind a door that you need a key to access so it's semi-private. If you and your bunkmates don't find the room to be a comfortable temperature you can go downstairs and the guy at the front desk will adjust the room's temp. Showers are individual locking stalls with a solid door. Shampoo/conditioner and soap are provided. Do *NOT* toss your provided towel as my roommates did, they will charge you (a small fee 100JPY I believe) for a new one. Kitchen and lounge area are on the ground floor with the front desk (which is part of what adds to the madness). Lots of nearby food, train station was close, and you're very close to akihibara and other major Tokyo areas. I was really happy with my stay and would definitely stay again.

What a great find , short walk to downtown great value I recommend share  dorms, but I believe there were rooms as well.  Well designed areas and communal kitchen and lounge in entrance foyer Great coffee around the corner at En

stayed here for 4 nights in female dorm - its clean and comfortable. located near to public train stations and family mart. check in was made easy and faster. there is one elevator to all floor. kitchen also available just next to the reception if you plan to cook.

My daughter and I stayed for one night before moving on to Kyoto. I confirm other reviews in their: - Location between 2 JRLines - Near Shinjuku - convenient short walk to main street where there are is food , convenient stores etc  The building looks new and modern. The pick up instructions are clear and concise and the manager, MJ ( who converses well in English) is very responsive and would remind me if I hadn't responded about something via email.  The room is indeed small and just ok for 2 people and already you need to be organised about where you place and open your suitcases (we had 2 big ones). I just ended up placing my suitcase in front of the door at night before bed. The other one could sit on the 2 seater couch.  The beds are comfortable and there is aircon /

heater PLUS a humidifier. The TV monitor very conveniently swivels so it can face all sides of the room. The kitchen is well equipped and they even provide necessary detergents for dishes and washing machine.   For a very small room, the bathroom is very spacious. There is first a dry area where the washing machine and toilet is and you can change in there as well. I LOVE that they prepared many hooks for hanging - something that many hotels have overlooked. The bathtub is nice, new and clean and fabulous to take a nice long soak in.   There is a dresser/ desk which has power points for charging. I notice several power points in the room so definitely ample distribution of charging points.   I was only there one night but I seem to feel that the Wi-fi was pretty fast.  My only complaint is that there are only stairs so you need to be prepared to carry your luggage. I was already warned so I was mentally prepared but good thing my room only on second floor so it was 2 flights of stairs up.

Fantastic place. There is no reception as such but they are very responsive on email. We landed early in Tokyo from London so were in desperate need of a nap by lunchtime, but they managed to let us into the room at around 2pm which was much appreciated!  The location is superb. It is in a little warren of back alleys that feel very residential. The area feels very safe, even late at night.   The JR Yamanote line goes through Shin Obuko which is a 5 minute walk away.   The centre of Shinjuku is a 10-15 minute walk, but the walk is very interesting as there’s so much hubbub and lots of little restaurants and shops along the route.   We thought this was a much better experience than we might have had from booking a big chain hotel in the centre of Shinjuku, all in all we felt very
lucky to have booked this place!

I loved this place. Check in time is a little late - 4pm - but when MJ (the manager) saw my elderly parents with me, she made every effort to prepare our rooms as quickly as she could. MJ was very accommodating and helpful - she was very patient in teaching us how to use the heater and the other appliances in the room, and was very helpful with giving us information about the city throughout our trip. The rooms were clean and designed simple but very well. Rooms are a tad small so I wouldn't recommend the room for a party of more than 2. The location of the motel is very close to 2 of the train stations on the JR line so it made getting around very convenient. I loved BMJ Shinjuku Okubo and will definitely stay there again when I'm in Tokyo.

I stayed for one night on a business trip and I am very happy I stayed here. The rooms are comfortable everything is clean and the staff are super friendly and multilingual. I would recommend this place anyone. It's less than a 20 minute walk from the station and only one stop away from shinjuku so everything is very convenient. If I need a place to stay in Tokyo again I will definitely try to come here again

I picked this hotel purely because of the location and the price. Right next to the Nippori station. You'll have to find the right door and go to 3rd floor by elevator to reach the reception. Staff was nice and tried their best to communicate, even though their English was not good. I got to leave my luggage there supervised for a couple of hours, as I arrived before I could get to my room. I got a smoking room (I don't smoke inside but didn't have a choice about the room when booking via a third party) and the smell was horrible, but I knew beforehand that would be the case, and fortunately there was fabric freshening spray which really helped. I didn't expect best quality when I didn't pay a whole lot, and I think I got what I paid for. A safe, clean place to rest between

exploring the city. The room had basic cleanliness, but clearly everything was somewhat old and a bit worn out. There were nice restaurants near this hotel, and the Yanaka Ginza street, old cemetary and Fabric town are just a couple of steps away. The best thing about this hotel is the location next to the station. The Yamanote line stops in Nippori and takes you for example to Ueno, Tokyo station, Shibuya and Harajuku quickly. Unfortunately the best thing about the hotel was also the worst. My room's window was facing the station (no view whatsoever, just a grey wall) and I could clearly hear all the noises. The trains don't bother me one bit, but all the other noise, such as announcements, jingles (yes... the trains have jingles) and warning tones were super loud and disruptive. It went on until 12 at night and started again at 5 am. I had ear plugs with me but didn't sleep too well with them, because I usually don't wear them at night. But to be able to get some sleep they were absolutely necessary. So bring them if you're staying in this hotel and I really mean it.  Overall, not a stylish place, but functional. Wouldn't stay here again though, because of the station being so loud.

Hotel Sunny is located on the JR Nippori line, so it's very convenient to go to many places. About 30 mins to Shibuya and 40 minutes to Haneda Airport.   It's right outside Nippori Station, East exit, turn right and there you are. Though it's a 2 star hotel, it's perfect, I cannot find any flaws. Staff were friendly and helped when in need.   Lobby is on the 3rd floor. Rooms were spacious and amazing, didn't look like a 2 star hotel AT ALL. Water temperature was easy to adjust, free water everyday. Sanitized bedroom slippers were provided. Bed was spacious, joined together by two beds but you can barely feel it. Window can be opened so cool air can come in if you don't want to switch on the air con during colder seasons.   Radio,music, lights can all be adjusted just behind the
bed.  Would definitely come back here again when I visit Tokyo! Definitely recommend it!

This small hotel is located literally just in front of Nippori station on the JR Yamanote line.  It is very convenient to go to Narita airport by the comfortable & direct Keisei Skyliner.  There are many restaurants and shops around.  The hotel has a family restaurant on the 2nd floor accessible from an escalator.  The lobby is on the 3rd floor and accessible from the elevator.  We were confused at arrival and took the escalator to end up in the busy restaurant; we had to cross the narrow restaurant with our big luggage to come back down !  Lobby area is stylish.  Staff at reception was courteous and efficient.  The room is small, as any other business hotel in Tokyo.  There is a mini-fridge.  Everything is clean.  The hotel doesn’t look old, but the decoration is definitely

old-style with some fake marble walls.  It is really not to my taste.  The bathroom is modular and clean.  The hotel may look tacky, but it does the job and it does it well.  The most important is the cleanliness.  And its location is very convenient.

I recommended my friends to stay at this hotel because its near the Nippori sta. But he just told me the rooms have no air conditioning!!  And when he asked the hotel staff, they can only tell him : Hot only. Hot only.. Another guy say open window  Seriously ? then if in Summer how to stay there ??

The location of this hotel is quite strategic because it is very near with Nippori Station (station for JR train and Narita Skyliner), so it will be easier if you want to explore Tokyo by train. The room is not too big (typical room in Tokyo) but clean and comfort enough. Check in and check out process also simple and fast. And near hotel there are some restaurant and convenience store that provide your basic needs. Overall good stay at Hotel Sunny.

restaurants.name: Oshinobi Koshutsu Sosaku Washoku Izakaya Nagomi Nippori
Kinkura Sakaba Kin No Kura Nippori Ekimae
Umakaraage to Izakameshi Miraizaka, Nippori Ekimae
Katarai Dokoro Za Watami Nippori Ekimae
Sky Beer Garden Wb Cafe Tokyo

reviews: We stayed here for 2 night in November 2018, but unfortunately the hostel was full so we had to move to another. But this hostel is really a dream. We enjoyed our two nights a lot. Everything is so well organized and thought through, the host is great and it’s very clean. It’s only for girls and therefore very calm, so maybe not the biggest “party hostel”, but really nice for experiencing Tokyo and Koenji. I can really recommend this hostel and if I go back to Tokyo I will definitely stay here again. It’s a short 10 minute walk from the station, but you will walk through the streets of Koenji, so it’s no problem. The hostel as has a kitchen (where you can cook, make coffee etc), common area, washing machine etc.

I can't say enough good things about Grapehouse! It's such a cute little hostel located within walking distance of Koenji station. The owner, Sanae, was an amazing host. She and some of the other guests spoke English, so I would highly recommend this place not only to Japanese guests but to others who don't speak Japanese as well. The dormitory, bathrooms, and common area were all clean and well-organized. It was an amazing value for the price I paid to stay for 10 nights! Thank you Grapehouse and Sanae for making me feel at home when I was in Tokyo!

Love this place! If you are adventurous and like to explore Japan the non-conventional way, this is the place for you! Place is quiet, clean with basic amenities and cooking is allowed. Host is also friendly, ask for tips to explore the area. The area is away from the usual tourist hot spots but it is in a great neighborhood-Koenji, where you will experience the real Japan. Lots of shops within walking distance, I've done my hair cut, shopping, dining and even spa all in the neighborhood.  Would definitely go back again!

i stayed there fro 2 nights and found that the place was like a house with well decorated. this guesthouse is for women only that made me feel safe. the entire house were cleaned.   the bed was comfortable, high speed wifi and the owner are friendly.   the house located not far from koenji JR station, about 10 minutes walk. along the road from the station to the hotel are interesting shops. there are everything you need, cosmetics, local food, fresh seafood, delicious donut , second hand clothes, etc.   they has no curfew but there are limit period of taking a bath after midnight.  this place will be my first choice if i have a chance to go to Tokyo again.

Being an ex-Hotel Food & Beverage Director for many years, this TA review will have a few pointers of interest that you need to know before making your hotel selection.  This is the second time that we've been to the Sotetsu Fresa Inn property.  Previously, it was under a different name/ownership.  Here's the $64K question:  Does Size Matter for your room?  Here's the perspectives:  The size of our queen size bed dominates the square footage of the room.  The bed was over 50% of the size of the room. If you have large luggage, there's a good chance you'll be "hopping" over it in the aisle.  When you sit on the toilet, your knees almost hit the door.  If any of these items disturb you, then consider another hotel.  The flip side of the coin is that this is very clean hotel,

extremely close to the Kamata train station.  It's not the cleanest/safest area, but there are really good restaurants if you look hard enough.  There's an excellent Tonkatsu restaurant in the Aroma One contemporary building that's TDF.  We found an excellent "carousel" style sushi restaurant in the Kamata train station on the 6th floor that will be our go to sushi place in the years to come.  Top notch sushi at a very reasonable prize.  Great!  On the food and beverage side of this hotel, they definitely need improvement.  They have a buffet Japanese style breakfast for around $10-12.00.  The first morning we were there, the "hot" food did not have covers on any of the items.  The food was warm at best.  My suggestion is that if you are going to serve a Japanese buffet breakfast, put your best foot forward.    The next day, I made a mention of this fact to Ms. Kajiwara/Hotel Manger on Duty.  She was apologetic and said that she'll note this and pass on the information to her staff.  Surprisingly, the very next day I was shocked to see that 90% of the "hot" food items had plastic covers on them!  The breakfast experience was so much better......  The dilema to traveller's is this:  Do I want to sacrifice important space in my room for the convenience of being close to the Kamata rail station.  If you don't mind the "Tiny Nation" syndrome, you'll be okay.  If you're a little on the taller side, I'd definitely select another hotel.

The hotel itself is clean and efficient.  The rooms are as rooms are in Japan, if there is more than one of you in the room - it can be challenging moving around.    Tiny bathrooms, as in the majority of hotels in any Japanese city - but good water pressure and the water is always hot.  The amenities (toiletries) are fair - but could be far better.  Be sure to have your own electrical adapter (if you need one).  They do have them available - but they are for purchase, rather than lending them to you for your stay.  Though these adapters are reasonably priced - they are not trying to make a quick buck off the guests.    The free wi-fi was very good, speedy and didn't drop out at any time (whilst I was using it).  The reception staff do speak limited English, enough to get by -

but they are very helpful and friendly - and if you try out your Japanese on them, they are a delight.    Don't bother with the breakfast (unless you really have to).  All in all for what it was - it was super expensive, comparably.  There are so many restaurants in the surrounding area (at a much lower cost) that you really do not need to worry about eating in the hotel.  The breakfast offerings were not up to scratch.  Supposedly more than thirty items (they must have been counting the ketchup, sauces and condiments!) - but at a push (and if you are uncertain or nervous about eating in local eateries where they do not speak English at all - then it could be a viable option (although there are lots of bakeries at the station where one can just point at items (or self serve).    The location of the hotel was very convenient - literally a few minutes walk from Kamata station.  Very easy to find and accessible.  The station has trains into the city every few minutes, so all in all very convenient indeed.    I would stay there again - and I am very picky.

Landed at Haneda airport delayed because of a mishap at the airport. It was late so took a taxi as the bus service ends at midnight. It's located near the JR Kamata station. Can see the side of the hotel as you exit east. Tons of eating places around the hotel. At night there are a lot of office workers drinking which brings all kinds of interesting people. Many eating places and a Starbucks in the train station. I stayed here because it's cheaper than staying in Tokyo, and the train will take you there in 10 minutes. Anywhere you want to go. Rooms are typical for Japan and is clean and safe. I would stay here again.

Exit east of JR kamata. Cross diagonally towards smbc(red). Infront of smbc has a sushi shop on left. Walk in the alley. 3mins walk from kamata JR. A lot of eateries. Infront of JR kamata has a airport bus to Haneda. 20mins away. Very convenient. Hotel front desk staffs can speak English. Room size reasonable though look abit old. Aircon is not the cool kind. Luckily it was in fall, wind comes in from window. Overall okie to stay.

We arrived at Haneda Airport past midnight, hence I booked a nearby hotel to avoid a pricey taxi ride if we were to go directly to downtown Tokyo upon arrival at this time (trains and buses don't operate 24/7). We paid 2710 yen from the airport to this hotel. As we were tired from the flight, I appreciated the fast check in. Our room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom is spacious - not the usual small Japanese bathrooms. Wifi is fast. We availed buffet breakfast the next day and it was a good mix of traditional and Western food. Check out was also convenient as I only had to return the key card via a machine. From the hotel, the nearest station (JR Kamata) was less than 5-min walk. Very good location indeed! This hotel is perfect for those whose flights arrive or depart at

restaurants.name: Taishu Sakaba Beetle Kamata East Entrance
Chinese Style Tavern Korakuen Kamata East Entrance
Fujimi Shanghai Katei Ryori Totochan No Mise
Meat * Fish Red Hot Club Kamata

reviews: Pænt og rent. Meget meget venligt personale. De har det lidt svært meget engelsk, men meget hjælpsomme. Det eneste minus var, ingen morgenmad. Ligger lige midt i mellem to stationer og meget tæt på Shinjuku.

The​ room is​ 27​ sq.m big.​ I​ love​ it​ so​ much.​ Stuff was​ nice  and​ friendly.​ It​ is​ about​ 500​ M​ from​ Sasazuka​ station,​ only one​ stop from​ shinjuku​ station​ though  KO line.​ So​ fast.​ Very​ recommended this​ place.​ There​is​ public onsen​ nearby too.​ By​ the​ way,  forgot  to​ take​ photo​ when​ arriving.​ LOL.
駅からも近いですが、バス停が目の前ですぐに渋谷へいけました。部屋内部リニューアルしたばかりできれい！！ The rooftop sky deck is the best！
只能以超值形容，入住的是三人房，很大，比日本其他酒店大得多。新裝飾，住得舒適。唯一缺點是離車站較遠，約7-8分鐘。

We had a great stay at O-Home, a simple and spacious hotel around 2-3km from the centre of Shinjuku and Shibuya.    Staff were really friendly and the rooms are really large for Tokyo standards. There aren't really any amenities at the hotel outside of the room with the exception of a nice rooftop area but for the price and size, it's a great find!

It's new hotel, so clean and beutiful room. They served us a cup of green tea with chocolate when we arrived! Good service.It takes 5 mins to the station. Near Asakusa temple. I saw SKY TREE from room. I want to stay the hotel again!

I stayed here for 6 nights, and had wonderful time!! The hotel was so nice and clean, also the staffs were very friendly and helpful, they gave us the direction to the skytree ( we could walk to there for 15mins:)), and made a reservation for french restaurant there.  Especially, the bath room was gorgeous!!  We stayed at corner twin room. Half-open bath was so nice with fresh air but bit cold in this season. It must be wonderful in spring to see Cherry blossam, river, and Tokyo skytree from balcony. I heard there is a fireworks festival in summer over the river.  The Access to Asakusa downtown is so good, about 10 mins walk.  Definitely recommend!!

This hotel is a solid three star hotel, but I've given it an extra star because it does nothing wrong.  From checkin to checkout you probably won't see any staff - the entire process is automated. Even baggage storage is a do it yourself activity with a bar and flexible cords you can lock. The included breakfast was interesting because it contained many Indian flavored offerings along with nan bread along with many of the items found in a typical Tokyo breakfast.  Our room,  one of the smallest ones they offer,  was clean and quiet. We managed to find space for our luggage,  something that is not always true in Japan.   I also gave extra weight to the fine location.  In one direction you are only a few blocks from Kappabashi,  the kitchen ware district.  In the other direction

it is a reasonable walk to Sensoji. Lastly,  you are close to the Tawaramachi station of the Ginza line. This station has an elevator from the platform to the street for both directions. The one in the direction to Ueno is not obvious, but it is a great help if your train is leaving from Ueno station. I hate carrying luggage downstairs.

Stayed here for 6 nights. Family of 4 traveling with an 11 year old. Wonderful beds. Great shower. There’s a Family Mart store around the corner, Higashi Shinjuku station a 6 minute walk away which was our starting point each day. There’s also a McDonalds across from the station, and yummy Indian food close by (Asian Nan House). Slippers and sandals are provided for no-shoes policy. Overall, a great, comfortable place. Self-check in was easy and they email you instructions on how to use everything inside the room (tv remote, heater, shower).

In Japan, almost hotel without a family room for 2 adults and 2 children. Luckily we found this hotel. The hotel is in the city centre, around 15mins on foot from underground. However, it’s not good in summer time because it was too hot. There have a grocery store nearby, around 2 mins on foot.

This is a great find in Tokyo and we stayed here for two weeks.  The hotel is in a lovely district of Shinjuku-in a quiet suburban area with access to local restaurants and convenience shops and it’s about 15-20 minute walk away from the main bright lights of downtown Shinjuku.  It is about a 5 minute walk to a subway station-Higashi-Shinjuku, with two lines running from this station that links you to the major tourist sites.  Downtown Shinjuku is one or two subway stops away taking less than 5 minutes.  The rooms are well appointed, our room was on the 3rd floor (303) and had a lounge area with TV, sink, kettle etc and then a seperate space for our bedroom and bathroom. The room even had a balcony.  The bed was very comfortable.  The rooms are not serviced everyday, but clean

towels, toilet paper etc are available if you stay for more than 4/5 days.The rooms are a good size compared to other hotels in Tokyo-we call them bijoux.  The local area has everything you need-as you come out of the hotel if you turn left there is a convenience store (Family Mart) and a laundrette (Wash).  If you turn right and continue down the street the hotel is on, there are small restaurants and the best bakery in Tokyo.  The bakery is open Tuesday to Saturday from 7.30 to 12.30pm and has gorgeous fresh sweet treats (western and Japanese) and savoury treats including baguettes as good as those you get in France.  Less than 400 metres from the hotel is Shinjuku Eastside-there are two larger convenience stores and about 10 restaurants.  We would not hesitate to stay here again

I stayed here with my daughter for 3 nights and we both loved it. It could be tricky to check in as staff are only on the premises from 4 pm until around 8 pm. They do provide an access key code outside these hours though if yoh contact them earlier. The beds are super comfortable with amazing big fluffy duvets. For Tokyo standards it was also very spacious. We stayed at another couple of places around Tokyo and this was by far the best value.

amenities: Fitness Centre with Gym / Workout Room
reviews: Like most Japanese hotels rooms are small by our standards. I had a double room which was adequate. Staff were very accommodating even though there was a language barrier, my fault.    Good location plenty of restaurants and shiops close by, close to Metro

I booked a standard double room, 18 square meter in size. This is quite typical of “business hotel” in Japan, catering to people who travel for business. What’s interesting about this hotel is the provision of daily pyjama which is nice.   It’s about 5 mins walk to Osaki JR station on Yamanote line which easily connects you to other major parts of Tokyo.   The downside is the breakfast. After trying the breakfast twice, I decided to have my breakfasts in other cafes nearby. There are lots of options for breakfast within 3-5 mins walk away.

All in all, it's an ok choice. The hotel scores a 1 out of 10 for character, 7 out of 10 for comfort, 9 out of 10 for location, 9 out of 10 for the wifi, 3 out of 10 for the included breakfast, 5 out of 10 for amenities.  Check-in was cold, yet efficient. The room was slightly larger than average for a room in Tokyo, and tastefully decorated overall. Bed was not very comfortable, nor were the pillows - very hard. Good sized bathroom with good amenities.   Rooms have a Handy smartphone guests can use which is great for travellers. You can take this phone with you and use it for finding your way around the city using Google Maps, using the city guides/tour recommendations on the phone, free 30 minutes of mobile hotspot (then paid after that...). It was very, handy!  My rate

included breakfast, which is served at Il Chianti Restaurant below the hotel. Hours are 7:00am-10:00am (last entry for breakfast at 9:30am). It has an ok buffet selection, nothing special at all. And after eating this for 4 days in a row the offerings were very repetitive and boring.   The hotel does not have a Fitness Centre, but directs guests downstairs to the Sports Club NAS, where hotel guests must pay 1080 JPY to use the facility.   The hotel has guest laundry on the 10th floor and is self-serve. 200 JPY for just a wash, 400-500 JPY for wash/dry (in the same machine).  Location is good - Osaki train station is less than a 5 minute walk away. There's lots of restaurants and shops around the hotel. Ginza area is only a 10 minute ride away on the train.

I arrived in japan early morning so i show up to the Hotel extremely tired after traveling all night at 11h00. Receptionist told me I could check in early and to come back at 13h00 So i went out for Lunch and came back to check in early as i was nicely offered.  Once back i was then asked to pay first 10$ per hour for checkin in early. I was kind of surprised and explain that i was not advice about it. But they just repeated that I have to pay now otherwise i could not get in the room. Which I did and requested an invoice as I kind was feeling worried about their attitude.  A day after, i tried to explain to the receptionist that it was not nice to invite me to check in early and once I was there, they would charge me extra. She would not listen a second and just repeat that it

was company policy.  I made a point that Company policy is probably to charge extra for early check in therefore they should tell the guest in full and the truth.   Anyway, except this stupid incident which was honestly unnecessary. All staff member are extremely diligent. It is a Business Hotel very well located with a great team. Anything i asked for was always done very well. The staff were indeed profesional.  will be back!

The relax massage chair in the room is what I want to say first. If you find the chair, please try it!  The room is normal size. It’s large enough for travelers to expand suitcase in the room. So, I can recommend this hotel for foreign travelers.   Location is good, and it’s about ten minutes walk from JR Ohsaki station. JR Ohsaki station is one of the stations in JR Yamate line,  and it’s convenient to visit main terminals in Tokyo, such as Shinjyuku, Shibya, Ikebukuro, Shinagawa,  Akihabara, etc.  But, I think it’s a little difficult to find this hotel for the first comer. It’s better to check the access map on the hotel home page before visit.

restaurants.name: Yugetsuan Osaki Station Nishiguchi Think Park

reviews: Having stayed at another APA hotel in Tokyo, we knew somewhat what to expect. This hotel follows the excellent standards of APA hotels such as efficient check-in, English speaking staff, impeccable cleanliness but that's where the positive comparison ends. We knew to expect a small room but the Tawaramachi hotel took cramped to a whole new level. Our previous hotel we could slide our luggage under the bed but here the bed base is down to the ground. It was a smaller room anyway which we didn't think possible but this room is really only fit for one person. There is, quite literally NO where to move with 2 people and their luggage. Nowhere at all.  Secondly, the breakfast. Our first APA hotel had a decent buffet breakfast and being the same chain expected similar. But no. Here,

you drop into the adjacent fast food outlet where your breakfast voucher entitles you to a microscopic proportion of egg, a piece of toast, a small salad and a coffee/tea. That's it. If you're looking for a proper breakfast, look elsewhere.  Thirdly, the curtains. Our first APA had full blockout curtains and we expected similar but unfortunately the curtains here allow the morning light to filter through denying oneself the opportunity to sleep in and some needed winks.   Forthly, the TV. OK, so this is the same as the other hotel but who in their right mind mounts a TV of such massive proportions in such a tiny space. Seriously this TV is bigger than the average person would have in their lounge room but to have such a TV in a room like this is just bizarre.  The hotel is situated in an OK location but with Tokyo's excellent subway system, anywhere in the city is fine.

We thoroughly enjoyed our APA hotel stay. The room was very small but I think that is normal for Japan! The room was modern with nice amenities. The hotel had an onsen upstairs to use as well.  It was right near the subway station or a 10-15 minute walk to Ueno station (major station with shinkansen and JR lines). The hotel was right near the precinct of Asakusa where we explored the various temples, bought souvenirs and street food. I would stay there again

I am 6’5” tall and I had been told that I would not fit anywhere in Tokyo; that I would have to duck under every doorway, be cramped in every bus and subway, and I would go home with neck and backache. While some of that was true, I was apprehensive about the APA hotel, though am pleased to report that - although the rooms are smaller than a Brit may be used to - they’re still fine for tall people and you will fit in the bed (they do these funny flat pillows in Japan that weren’t the easiest, but if you ask at the desk they will get you a bigger one that’s more like the ones we have in the west).   The room was spotless, and while I did occasionally struggle to manoeuvre around the bathroom (which is quite small for a tall person), I was able to use the facilities fully and

found the room very good value for money (my wife is normal sized and also liked it). There’s a huge TV in it, there’s WiFi, there’s a fridge for you to make use of (which was a godsend, as we were able to stock up at the 7-Eleven or Family Mart and leave things there), there’s even laundry and baths upstairs. They left us bottled water every day which really came in handy too (Japan is roasting in October which I was not expecting). The staff were great, it’s right on the Ginza line, easily accessible from Narita airport, and though it’s not what you’d consider a luxury hotel, if you’re in Tokyo on holiday you shouldn’t be using the room for anything but sleeping and showering anyway. Also there’s a great pastry shop to your left as you come out the front door, a little independent bakery, that’s worth going to for sure.

I stayed for 5 nights and the service was excellent. The room although a bit small but it has all what i need. Bathroom was super clean. WiFi is fast enough for me.  The location was excellent. Just 1 minute walk from Tawaramachi St on Ginza Line which is just 2 stations away from Ueno St and 1 station away from Asakusa St. The easiest way to come from Narita Airport is by using Keisei Skyliner Express to Ueno St and transfer using Ginza line to Tawaramachi St. Super easy and convenient. Located nearby halal food too. You can actually walk to Tokyo Skytree for around 15-20 minutes walk.   There is no early check-in available and check-in time will be at 3pm sharp. During that time, people will start queueing for check-in. For those who come early in the morning, they can store
your luggage so that you can explore Tokyo. Don't worry about your luggage and even your shopping bags, it will be safely secured.  Will definitely be staying here again if i'm in Tokyo.

Such a nice room, best onsen even have an open air onsen,  they give you a bottle of water every day,  best location and nice staff. Do not like the breakfast cause they serve you a portion and nothing more!

restaurants.name: Kyusyu tavern Basashi Jidori Sengyo Ichome Ichibanchi

reviews: Our family stayed in Sasazuka in hot & humid July. Although Sasazuka is a solid 40 minute walk from keg landmarks,  if you're happy to cstch the complicated Japanese trains then you'll be fine. The apartment was perfectly clean & met our needs because it was inexpensive & perfectly located near a mall & convini.  The 7-11 and Lawson just downstairs offered some delicious & easily accessible cheap eats for a day of free-exploring in Tokyo. I would recommend staying at Kario Sasasuka if you don't mind the extra distance from Tokyo. The pay-off is more space, comfortable beds & cheaper accomodation.

Just stayed here one night, and I’m glad it was only one night. The location is convenient, right next to the station, although that also means you have the noise of the train lines; there’s no sound-proofing at all. The walls are as thin as cardboard, so you can hear your neighbours clearly. The room is OK but nothing special, and the bed is too hard for my liking. There’s no tea or coffee in the room, but the WiFi works well.  Check out time is 10 a.m., and I asked if I could leave a bag with them for a few minutes while I went for a coffee at a nearby coffee shop. No, the receptionist told me, not possible. Who wants to stay in a place where they have an attitude like that?

Right next to station n a stop away from shinjuku connecting to other lines . Dryer function in e toilet is amazing.staff are helpful and speaks good english.we stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment. Its a little tight in space especially with luggages which is common in japan  but its comfortable .light cooking is possible but there are many food options available easily. 2 convenient stores are jus downstairs

Excellent location, lawson/7-11 are just right beside the building. There are many eateries nearby and train station is just 1min walk away. I love the studio style apartment where you have a mini kitchen area and washing machine. Room space is small but definitely much bigger than most of the hotels in Tokyo. Only downside is that there is no daily housekeeping but not much of an issue for us. Would definitely come back to stay again when I visit Tokyo the next time.

No reservations, a great place to stay! The apartment style hotel has a kitchenette and a washer dryer. The three-person room was large enough for our party of three. Right outside the front door you will find almost anything you need within a five minute walk including grocery stores, convenience stores, specialty stores, restaurants and the train station. Very happy that we chose this location for our Tokyo stay.

amenities: Photo copier / fax In business centre
reviews: We’ve been to Shinjuku many times and the Prince Hotel is by far the best location for us. We travel heavy with skis  and way too much luggage. You can walk underground from the main Shinjuku station to the hotel. All the shops and restaurants are right there. Opt for a room upgrade and negotiate the price at check in. Get an upper floor for awesome views.

Stayed 3 nights as it is prepaid, couldn’t bother to change hotel. Interior is very jaded and old, it is a centralized heating hotel so it can get warm and stuffy with no way of adjusting it - the only option is a portable box device that does not help much. Woke up with very dry throat. They also got my booking mixed up and gave me a smaller room till I showed them the photo of what I have booked, then they gave me what I paid for - standard double. Location wise, it is incredible, but would rather pay for Hotel Gracery instead for a modern and newer property. Told them that I don’t want 13th floor but they told me, that’s the only option, coming from a hotel of low occupancy period. The service and security from level 1 staff is good and that earned them the Average rating
instead of Poor. Could loan umbrella when it rains.

A good place to book but be sure to get a larger space area for a room, quite cramped, more than 15 sq ft room may be ideal. Fuga restaurant had excellent dinner, buffet breakfast was just so-so. It’s very near Don Quixote’s, 7-Eleven’s , family marts. Room is cleaned spotless daily.

It is very accessible to the metro. The breakfast buffet is good. The location is amazing bec there’s a lot of good restaurants and stores in the vicinity. The staff are very accomplishing and welcoming as expected.

Well, My fiance and I stayed 5 nights. Room is clean but narrow . We got high floor room with city view , is beautiful in the night. We regret, we didn't spend more at sky bar, that is the most beautiful spot to enjoy city view at night . They have shopping mall too at the ground floor and the hotel location is right in the middle of city, so easy for us to go everywhere in Lovely Yokohama City . I got the problem with the safety box, my passport and wallet was inside of the safety box, when i tried to open it, it's doesn't work so we call the reception to fix it, They fixed soon (fast response) And second think that i didn't understand, in the room there is tiny trash bin, so is not big enough for our trash, so we just leave it beside of  trash bin then we go out , when we came

back to our room, the house kipper just took the trash inside of the bin only and didn't take the trash beside of the bin. So we called the front desk again to take the trash (weird policy) I expected to get clean room with no trash left, but we have to leave the note on the trash to tell the house kipper. And also I always got freeze in the room especially after shower, the room should be warmer in the winter ,  Note For the hotel : Need be more faster to handle check in , we been handled by a trainee, I don't say that trainee is not good, but the senior staff suppose to accompany the trainee. So the guests could be handle more faster to get check in  But overall is good , thank you shinjuku Prince Hotel for your service and thank you for your kindness , we enjoyed our stay, and my fiance said she want us to stay at Shinjuku Prince Hotel again next time ,

restaurants.name: R Baker Inspired by Court Rosarian Seibu Shinjuku Pepe
Shabu Shabu Full Private Room Kururi Shinjuku East Entrance
Cheese Cheese kitchen Shinjuku East Entrance

reviews: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights in February 2020. I really enjoyed the stay. I thought it was an exciting and different experience for a really good price and in an excellent location. The bathroom facilities were great, as was the sauna. My boyfriend and I both agreed that the beds were not the comfiest and it was often difficult to sleep due to the volume of other guests on the corridor and that the corridor light was left on all night. Also, it was absolutely boiling!  Staff were very helpful. Although this was a fun experience, I would recommend it for the solo traveller or friends of the name gender, not couples. Exciting for a few nights but if you're a light sleeper it's maybe not the place for you.

This capsule Hostel is a very nice and clean place with the great option to relax in the sauna, the beds are comfortable and bigger than I thought and the staff is very nice as well.The only critic I have is that the lights are always on in the room so even when you are in the capsule it is never completely dark also it is a waste of energy.

I booked from expedia and read the reviews before booking, and everything on the comments/review sections seems to be pretty accurate The capsules are more modern than other places, it’s very clean and well organized. They gave me a bag filled with 2 towels, Pj’s , toothbrush set, slippers and a tray inside the assigned locker. The locker assigned is pretty big, enough to fit one cabin sized luggage, a full sized backpack, wintercoat and more. It just wouldn’t fir larger size luggages, but there are space available for that! The receptionist also offered to keep my huge luggage in the locker on the lobby floor (which I personally think is safer, there’s tag number, my name signed on a form and someone will always be there to look after it imo?). The shower size is pretty tight,

I didn’t get to try the sauna though. The capsule size is okay, yes there will be noise every now and then, but it’s manageable, it’s just like having a roommate back in Toronto.   I felt secured and confident once I found out that everyone needs to give their keys to the receptionists everytime they leave the building, and exchange it with a token/card-like with their room number on it. I think it’s brilliant for security purposes.   The pillow is a bit weird, like made out of beans or something. It’s fine with me though cause I have my own travel neck pillow. There is a blanket as well. The “door” on the website looks like an actual door, but it’s actually just a blind.  The only thing you should know is that food and drink is not allowed in the cabin (allowed in the lobby only), the shower room is in a different floor. There is elevator, but must be able to take one level stair up to the lobby.   Overall, I have a good experience. It’s perfect if you are on a budget, just need somewhere to crash and don’t mind tight spaces. Remember to bring earplugs if you’re a light sleeper! :)

1 min walk from the station, free wifi, clean bathroom and friendly staff. I wish there’s a small foldable desk in the bedroom so that I can use my laptop. The sleep area is also quiet. Slippers, room wear, towels, shampoo are also provided. Can buy razor, water, skincare set at the check-in counter.

Very helpful staff. Facilities are extremely well kept and clean. Great location, 2 minute walk to Ebisu station on the Yamanote line. Less than 10 minutes on the train to Shinjuku, Harajuku and Shibuya. Highly Recommeneded!

restaurants.name: Chabuya Tonkotsu Ramen Chabuton Ebisu East
